Opportunity Overview

The Job

The Marketing Associate position is part of HBO’s Partner Marketing Team. The Partner Marketing team works across traditional distribution partners to drive HBO & Cinemax subscriptions and revenue, deliver and optimize content and products across the distribution landscape.

The primary role of the Marketing Associate position is to work in collaboration with Leadership across departments to execute marketing initiatives that drive subscribers, revenue and product engagement. The successful candidate will be an imaginative and decisive problem-solver, resilient in an environment of fast-paced change, and highly collaborative. In this role you have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working with a diverse and dynamic group of professionals.

The Daily

  • Establish strong partnership with Account teams and internal departments to deliver against defined goals/objectives
  • Optimize and ensure the positioning of the HBO brand, programming and products across account initiatives by leveraging key research insights and marketing analysis
  • Creative management and execution of all marketing initiatives including media, print, digital, social etc.
  • Develop and assist with marketing campaigns across multiple accounts as well as other initiatives that drive platform registration and usage
  • Liaise with key internal teams including Campaign Marketing, Consumer Marketing, DSM, and Legal
  • Encourage innovation and challenge business as usual


The Essentials

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Prior work experience required
  • High EQ/Exceptional interpersonal skills
  • Highly organized project management skills
  • Extremely effective communicator, presenter, influencer
  • Strategic and tactical experience in subscriber acquisition, brand development, and marketing communications; preferably with an MVPD, high-tech or web-centric businesses a plus

The Perks

  • HBO exclusive events
  • Paid time off to volunteer
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands



About Us

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

America's most successful premium television company, Home Box Office delivers two 24-hour pay television services—HBO®and Cinemax®. HBO continues to take advantage of the latest technological innovations with advancements that include the availability of HBO programming online though HBO GOSM and MAX GOSM , as well as HBO On Demand®. and Cinemax On Demand®. in HD. Just as HBO is a company noted for its commitment to excellence in the products and services it delivers to consumers, it makes the extra effort to create a work environment in which fairness, equity, trust, and individual responsibility are valued. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.


Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
This is a pivotal time for the company and its brands. 15 years after the company’s founding, we are setting the strategic direction for what the next 15 years will look like. To address this need, we are looking for world class strategic researchers and thinkers who can help us solve thorny brand challenges using best in class techniques in partnership with brilliant stakeholders.

This role will be a part of the Marketing Insights team, partnering closely with cross-functional teams such as Data Analytics, Brand Strategy, and Communications to help understand the brand and what drives it. Specifically, in this role you will identify critical insights about the reputation of the corporate brand and the company-owned brands such as Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp. As part of the consumer marketing organization, you will play an essential role in shaping how we tell each brand’s story.

In this role, you will design, execute and deliver high-impact primary research as well as analyses of secondary research data. The work will be both quantitative and qualitative in nature, but with a particular emphasis on quantitative. The candidate will be a marketing research expert with a passion for solving brand reputation challenges. Strong analytical, communication, project management and presentation skills will be essential for this role.

The candidate will be an energetic, curious, self-motivated, and entrepreneurial person who enjoys working collaboratively, but can ultimately execute projects independently when needed.

This position is full-time and will be based in the San Francisco office, with frequent visits to other stakeholders based in Menlo Park.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work closely with the Brand Intelligence Insights lead as well as cross-functional partners to design and execute actionable quantitative and qualitative.
  • Execute deep dive research and analyses to unpack important brand strategy issues and manage regular quantitative and qualitative brand reputation tracking studies to help put these strategic challenges into context.
  • Develop innovative methods of brand reputation measurement and analysis using the company’s data and audience tools, as well as with primary research collected by external agency partners.
  • Synthesize findings into clear reporting and actionable insights.
  • Help create a unified view of the company’s brand reputation across a variety of audiences/constituencies in partnership with other key stakeholders.
  • Travel for research when needed 15% of the time.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • 5+ years of agency or in-house consumer research experience. The work should be both quantitative and qualitative in nature.
  • Experience executing quantitative research independently, including questionnaire design, fielding, analytics, and reporting.
  • Experience translating research findings into insights that can be understood by group of stakeholders.
  • Experience identifying and evaluating potential research and analytical approaches to tackle brand reputation challenges and determine which would drive results.
  • Experience partnering with data analytics partners in solving brand reputation challenges.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience directing research agencies/vendors to deliver results.
  • Experience threading together multiple research studies to contextualize challenges and inspire stakeholders to think differently.
  • Experience executing brand reputation tracking studies.
  • Statistical modeling and data analysis experience (e.g. regression modeling, significance testing, applying sampling weights, etc.).
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

• Do you see the world differently than others?
  • Is your passion bringing innovative ideas to life?
  • Are you an ambitious, self-starter who wants to create change through Marketing?

If any of the above are true, we are interested in speaking with you!

Job Summary:

12-Month Junior Marketing Associate on leading brands within our Global Marketing teams. Those selected for this position will be:

o Creative visionaries and strategic thinkers

o Resilient: able to thrive in a dynamic, fast-moving environment

o Passionate about by trends, new products, and advertising

o Ability to self-manage projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment

Experience in the industry is a plus, but NOT necessary.


Key Job Accountabilities:

o Social Listening and Competitive Research

o Keep up-to-date on the latest products, trends, and insights across platforms (social media, blog, print/digital magazines)

o Continuously compile information about competitive new launches, advertising, and formulas.

o Present competitive findings to team and/or brand managers.

o Product Ideation and Development

o Propose need gaps based on analysis of competitive landscape and trends that align with the brand identity

o Generate ideas and write creative concepts for new products

o Work with team to brainstorm product names

o Write and edit packaging copy that differentiates your brand and product in the market

o Manage new product formulations, including liaising with lab and consumer test center

o Prepare product samples throughout the development process

o Assist in preparation for team/brand meetings, including bi-yearly trends presentation to Global CEO

o Administrative support

o undertake ad-hoc projects specific to business/division needs

o Provide additional administrative support on an as-needed basis

Minimum Requirements:

o Bachelor’s degree; must have graduated within the past 12 months (Dec 2019 or May 2020)

o Minimum GPA of 3.5

o Must provide valid work authorization in the United States

o Proficient in Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

o Excellent written, analytical and communication skills

o Solid understanding of data management and ability to use Excel to organize data, create reports, and deliver meaningful insights and recommendations


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application for a recognized disability under applicable law, please email USApplicationAccommodation@support.lorealusa.com. Please note this email will only respond to specific requests for assistance completing the application as a request for accommodation for a disability. All others will not be considered.

Job Summary

NATURE OF POSITION: Development of Data Driven Education Content in Agribusiness

PRINCIPAL DUTIES: This position is part of Purdue’s Center for Food and Agricultural Business (CAB) and this individual will report directly to the Executive Director, Dr. Allan Gray. It will involve working with a team of faculty seeking to understand dynamics and driving forces for change in the agribusiness industries that serve production agriculture. The focus is on data and information that supports the strategy, marketing, finance, and sales expertise of CAB faculty. The analyses undertaken by this individual will seek to characterize market, customer and competitor relationships at the local, regional, national and international level. Current research in the group is focused on the implications of changes in consumer demand, technology (digitization, automation, blockchain, etc.) and industry consolidation on the agribusiness industry with a focus on agricultural input manufacturers, retailers, and first handlers. The selected applicant will be expected to play a leading role in research projects, develop executive education materials (presentations, simulations, case studies, etc.), publish in industry and academic outlets, and contribute to obtaining external funding. This person will be housed in the Department of Agricultural Economics but will be involved in collaborative relationships with industry partners requiring travel for problem identification meetings, data collection, and workshops to discuss results of research.

Education and Qualifications

The successful applicant will hold a Ph.D. in agricultural economics, agribusiness, business or a related field. S/he should have research experience in framework development, survey methods, and data analysis.

Salary

Commensurate with training and experience.


Application

APPLICATION: Applications and references may be initiated by writing to or emailing: Allan Gray, Center for Food and Agricultural Business, Purdue University, Department of Agricultural Economics, 403 W. State St., West Lafayette, Indiana 47907-2056, email: gray@purdue.edu. A background check is required for employment in this position.

A complete application includes:

  • A cover letter describing the applicant’s research interests and experience
  • A resume´
  • Names, email addresses, and phone numbers of at least three references who can evaluate the applicant’s qualifications for this position

CLOSING DATE: January 10, 2020, or until an acceptable candidate is found. Applications will be reviewed as they arrive.

Purdue University is an EEO/AA employer fully committed to achieving a diverse workforce.


FLSA Status
Exempt

Location: Mountain View, CA

Job Description:
JD Digits AI Lab is looking for research scientist interns with strong background in deep learning, machine learning, computer vision, and natural language processing. You will be uniquely positioned in our team to work on challenging problems and advance the frontiers of AI technologies.

Responsibilities:
  • Conduct state-of-the-art research in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, natural language processing and big data, and publish scientific papers under supervision.
  • Research and evaluate state-of-the-art AI algorithms prototypes for our projects.
  • Develop AI products for industry. Example tasks include but not limited to automatic machine learning, recommendation systems, speech recognition, question answering, face/image/text recognition, robo-advisors, etc.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience in developing new algorithms with track record on top journals/conferences.
  • Familiar with at least one of deep learning frameworks: Tensorflow, Pytorch, Caffe, Mxnet, etc.
  • Self-motivated and eager to learn new things.
About JD Digits

JD Digits was formerly known as JD Finance before comprehensively brand escalated in November 2018. Its operational purpose is to connect finance and real industry by using digital technology, boosting the influence of the Internet, enhancing the digital and intelligent development of industries, foster the development of the real economy and create greater social value. Centered on the cutting-edge technologies including data technology, AI, IoT and blockchain, JD Digits has completed the deployment in finance, city, agriculture, campus services and digital marketing, and integrated the personal end, corporate end and government end in terms of its clients.

In the future, JD Digits will more deeply explore current business patterns and enter into more real industry sectors.

About JD (http://corporate.jd.com)

JD.com is the largest e-commerce company in China, and the largest Chinese retailer, by revenue. The company strives to offer consumers the best online shopping experience. Through its user-friendly website, native mobile apps, and WeChat and Mobile QQ entry points, JD offers consumers a superior shopping experience. The company has the largest fulfillment infrastructure of any e-commerce company in China. As of June 30, 2017, JD.com operated 7 fulfillment centers and 335 warehouses covering 2,691 counties and districts across China, staffed by its own employees. JD.com is a member of the NASDAQ 100 and a Fortune Global company.

Position Summary

Our Team
The Data & Strategic Insights team enables a holistic 360 view of the consumer and content for the entire Discovery organization. The team leverages a central research model with shared data and analytics services that can be accessed by all consumer-facing business functions. This team creates a shared, cohesive language with standardized data, metrics, and reporting to enable a global research community.

The Role
The Research Analyst is responsible for supporting television audience and content research, reporting, on behalf of Discovery’s major media brands and ad partners. This position will support and partner with business end-users embedded within the brand and ad sales teams as well as colleagues in the Data & Strategic Insights Team to develop and implement collaborative solutions to research and analytics problems.

Responsibilities

1. Work with brand & programming teams to provide data and insights through standardized and automated reporting
2. Communicate data and insights in meetings, strategy sessions, emails, and presentations
3. Monitor brand/content/consumer performance over time to identify and interpret trends
4. Use analytical and syndicated research systems to produce relevant network reports, analyses and presentations. Ensure research reports are consistent, accurate, and timely
5. Collaborate with research colleagues to exchange relevant information, and insights
6. Follow data management best practices and support a central source of truth that that drives multi-platform business optimization as well as accountability across the organization

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field
  • 1-3 years professional experience
  • Experienced with television audience measurement including consumer demographics and behavior, i.e Nielsen, Lake 5, Star, MRI, etc
  • Thorough understanding of media industry topics and trends including content, marketing, advertising, branding, experience, and consumer technology
  • Interest in TV, media, advertising and/ or entertainment industries
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Analytical thinker
  • Must have the legal right to work in the United States
New York City, New York, NYC, NY

The team:
We are a fast-moving, analytically driven B2B marketing team. We show innovative companies how they can improve their applications and get to market faster. We do hundreds of events, thousands of marketing campaigns, research and evangelize ideas that move our industry forward, and more.

The opportunity:

We are looking for a talented Illustrator to join our growing design team. You will collaborate with a team of designers, writers, and engineers to create original pieces of artwork to bring our brand and content to life.
You will be responsible for translating complex technical concepts into simple, clear illustrations that gets the idea across in clever and unexpected ways. You must be able to think conceptually and produce idea-driven artwork and adapt to our vector illustration style.
This is a full-time and on-site role in our NYC office.

You will:
  • Work with content team and sketch, develop, and refine ideas
  • Create artwork for various channels such as our blog and social media
  • Design infographics and diagrams
  • Design iconography and patterns
  • Work with our developers and video team to animate illustrations
  • Evolve and codify our design and illustration language

Requirements:

  • BFA in design or illustration or relevant work experience
  • Strong portfolio that demonstrates problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Proficiency in Illustrator, Photoshop
  • Excellent design, color, and typographic skills
  • Energetic and enthusiastic
  • Strong organizational skills

Bonus points:

  • Experience with animation tools
  • Experience with 3D tools
  • UI design

Datadog is a monitoring service for hybrid cloud applications, assisting organizations in improving agility, increasing efficiency, and providing end-to-end visibility across the application and organization. These capabilities are provided on a SaaS-based data analytics platform that enables Dev, Ops and other teams to accelerate go-to-market efforts, ensure application uptime, and successfully complete digital transformation initiatives.

Swanson Reed is a leading firm in the area of R&D tax credits and innovation incentives. We service a diverse range of clients from technology start-ups to billion dollar NASDAQ listed and Government Owned Corporations in the commercial aspects of research, development, management and technology transfer. Swanson Reed seeks to recruit a Marketing/Administrative Assistant to join their energetic team.

The Position

Swanson Reed is looking for a marketing/administrative assistant to support the team in the US.

The job will consist of:

  • Building Brand Identity in the U.S.
  • Social Media Marketing
  • Admin support
  • Project management
  • Blogging
  • Assistance with the development of R&D plans
  • Keeping up-to-date knowledge on the R&D tax credit

You will receive on the job training and guided until you are fully competent.

Requirements

The successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of success as a Marketing/Administrative Assistant, preferably within a professional services or financial services environment. You will have outstanding communication skills, demonstrate a proactive and results orientated approach and have strong planning and organisational abilities. You will be driven, proactive and be able to work autonomously.

A self-starter with an inquisitive mind who demonstrates a committed and flexible approach complemented by exceptional relationship management skills will excel in this role.

Location

Fort Worth, TX

Remuneration

The pay rate is $30 per hour.

CUSTOMER SUCCESS MANAGER

MURAL’s mission is to help global teams collaborate with design thinking. Creative teams use MURAL to discover, share, brainstorm, and organize ideas to define solutions.

You will be working in a rapidly expanding market, helping use and promote an in-demand solution that is truly a must-have for any modern business with remote teams.

Design-driven Global 1000 companies like IBM, Steelcase, Intuit, Autodesk, USAA, SAP and EY use MURAL to scale their design culture. Universities like California College of Arts, Stanford GSB, and Hyper Island are teaching the next generation of innovators using our solutions.

YOUR MISSION

As a CSM, you will grow our business by managing customer accounts and helping them achieve their goals. Our belief is simple: making customers better, makes better customers. Your role as a CSM makes that a reality. You’re responsible for creating an exceptional customer experience.

  • Understand our customers and become their advocate.
  • Help clients onboard into MURAL and get them ready to go.
  • Design and distribute content to help maximize the use of MURAL.
  • Motivate, inspire and teach our customers how MURAL can add value to their company.
  • Monitor usage in order to identify and suggest new use cases.
  • Spot opportunities to upsell more value added services.
  • Manage renewals in your portfolio, working with Sales as needed.
  • Collaborate with Product team on how to improve the product.
  • Collaborate with Marketing team on events and content.

YOUR PROFILE

The top candidate will be able to convey how exciting and innovative our software is, in-person and at a distance. You will turn our current customer base into MURAL fanatics by showing how easy and fun it is to collaborate in MURAL. The ideal candidate will have:

  • 2-3 years experience in SaaS customer success, account administration and support.
  • Ability to manage and interpret customer behavior through metrics and CRM data.
  • Excellent command of English and great visual communication skills.
  • The ability to provide exceptional guidance via email, phone, video, and in person.
  • A passion to help teams succeed and empathize with them.
  • Ability to switch contexts, from emails to demos to internal meetings and more.
  • An undying concern about new, better ways to solve problems.
  • A willingness to contribute to our customer success and share your expertise with others.
  • Ability to work independently from a remote location.

Ideally,

  • You have experience in design thinking and creative disciplines, or are willing to learn.
  • You have worked with Design, UX, Research and Product Management roles in the past or are aware of design thinking practices and related fields.


WHAT WE OFFER

In addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Flexibility with schedule
  • Ability to work remotely
  • A phenomenal learning environment for you to develop

NOTE: Candidates willing to work from remote locations in the East Coast are preferred, but others will also be considered, e.g., Austin, TX or Portland, OR.

ABOUT US

Formerly a startup in residence in IDEO, MURAL is funded by Alta Ventures, Intel Capital, Collaborative Fund, NXTP Labs and 500 Startups, among others. We have team members in San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, Amsterdam, and Buenos Aires, but you will also find us exploring other places around the world. Check us out online: www.mural.co

North America Candidate Marketing Lead
Organization: Corporate Function/Marketing and Communications
Location: New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Atlanta, Dallas, or Washington DC

Accenture
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With 469,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

Corporate Functions – Marketing & Communications
As part of this team, you’ll play a key role in helping Accenture execute its strategy. You’ll work with a diverse team of innovative marketing experts who focus on the following areas: global brand management and advertising; global events and sponsorships; internal communications; marketing research; media and industry analyst relations; corporate and financial communications; internet marketing; recruitment marketing; client-centric marketing; and industry, service line and geographic marketing campaigns.

YOUR ROLE: North Candidate Marketing Lead

We are:
A leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. People in the Corporate Function career track contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.

Marketing and Communications professionals build a powerful and differentiated global brand at the corporate, industry, capability and geography levels that supports the Accenture strategy; enhances long-term client relationships; inspires employees and candidates; and drives profitable revenue growth.

You are:
A savvy, highly creative and experienced integrated marketer who can create a powerful and differentiated employer brand and candidate experience to attract top talent to Accenture in North America. You have a deep understanding of the Gen Z and millennial audience segments and consumer and acquisition marketing strategies. You’re a digital first marketer and have deep expertise planning, implementing, managing and measuring digital and social marketing campaigns.

The work:
Accenture is growing at unprecedented levels with aggressive hiring targets each year. Candidate Marketing is one of the few areas of Accenture where true “B to C” marketing takes place. You will develop and lead Accenture’s marketing strategy and teams for North America across all audience segments (undergrads and MBAs, experienced hires, managing directors, alumni). You’ll partner closely with Marketing & Communications and Talent Acquisition teams to plan, develop and implement integrated marketing programs, including creative development, candidate engagement and resume generating marketing campaigns, that deliver new and innovative ideas both off- and on-line.
  • Define and oversee the region’s candidate marketing strategies and objectives across all audience segments (graduates, experienced hires, managing director, diverse candidates, alumni), working with global and geographic marketing teams, HR and Talent Acquisition teams
  • Ensure that proper metrics and tools are in place to monitor and measure effectiveness of programs implemented
  • Ensure integration of all marketing channels including digital, social and alumni network as part of our marketing mix
  • Develop and manage candidate marketing programs involving research, positioning, message development, production of online and offline collateral, advertising, case studies, employee profiles, and website content
  • Oversee the management of the North America careers website content/design/functionality
  • Manage stakeholders and leadership expectations in complex matrixed environment

YOUR EXPERIENCE: Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Minimum of 15 years of marketing and/or communications experience
SET YOURSELF APART: Preferred Skills
  • Deep expertise and skills in implementing tools and metrics to effectively monitor and measure marketing programs
  • Extensive experience leveraging digital and social channels to reach a desired audience
  • Strong stakeholder management skills – working with senior leaders
  • Bonus points if:
    • You have an advanced degree in a related discipline
    • You have a global perspective and understanding of business marketplace
Professional Skills
  • Strong organizational, multi-tasking and time-management skills
  • Leadership and team building skills
  • Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian
  • Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian
OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU
  • Your entrepreneurial spirit and vision will be rewarded, and your success will fuel opportunities for career advancement.
  • You’ll make a difference for some pretty impressive clients. Accenture serves many of the Fortune Global 100 on high-profile projects.
  • Opportunities to learn daily through training, assignments, and collaborating with experts across the company.
  • Access to leading-edge technology.
  • Along with a competitive salary, Accenture offers a comprehensive package including generous paid time off, an employee healthcare plan and a competitive 401K program. Learn more about our extensive rewards and benefits here.
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

As a Research and Development Scientist in the Diagnostics and Genomics Group, you will contribute to the development of cutting-edge target enrichment solutions for Next Generation Sequencing. You will work with a cross-functional team to create new products and applications for cancer research and diagnostics. In this key role you will use your extensive molecular biology expertise to plan and execute NGS target enrichment and analysis workflows. You will be expected to contribute to projects requiring coordination with other functions, including R and D, marketing and manufacturing. You will be expected to address a broad range of scientific problems of varying scope and complexity. Laboratory expertise should include Next Generation Sequencing, RNA and/or DNA sequencing and hands-on molecular biology. Ability to work with large datasets and perform basic bioinformatic analysis is a plus.

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for providing scientific expertise to routine laboratory service clientele, contract research customers, and FSNS personnel. Has regular communication and interaction with each of these parties. Assists with evaluation of new or improved methods for analyzing food products and environmental samples for continual expansion and enhancement of laboratory service offerings. Carries out all aspects of contract research services including proposal generation, budgeting, coordinating, executing, reporting results, and billing of contract research projects. Provides on-site client assistance for troubleshooting purposes or contract research projects as needed.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintains a high degree of technical competence by reading scientific journals, attending professional workshops, and being aware of food industry regulations, issues, and trends.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) with evaluation of new or improved food and environmental testing methods to ensure that the most up-to-date technology is provided to clientele.
  • Travels to scientific meetings and industry trade shows to stay abreast of current scientific, industry, and regulatory trends and to interact with clientele.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) with preparation of technical writing pieces for periodicals and newsletters.
  • Prepares and delivers scientific and technical presentations.
  • Demonstrates excellent customer service skills and the ability to understand and resolve scientific issues, answer questions, and gain customer confidence for both routine laboratory services and contract research services.
  • Plans, proposes, and communicates with clients regarding contract research services.
  • Coordinates and executes contract research services.
  • Prepares and/or approves reports for said contract research services.
  • Prepares associated budgets for said contract research services.
  • Prepares billing for said contract research services.
  • Interacts directly with operational staff and clients to discuss food safety concerns, regulatory guidance, testing needs, and results.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) to develop proficient and manageable programs for new contract research service business resulting in company growth and profitability, by assisting with development and improvement of marketing materials, client visits, and sales presentations.
  • Willing to support all other departments in the lab as needed based on business demands.
  • Travels for and assists with in-plant investigations and troubleshooting for FSNS clients.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ph.D. in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Chemistry, or related field preferred
  • Minimal educational requirement is M.S. in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Chemistry, or related field
  • Working knowledge of aseptic sampling technique, automated lab equipment, and acceptable methods and procedures
  • Familiarity with USDA MLG, FDA BAM, CMMEF, APHA, and AOAC methods and procedures
  • Broad knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures of a food testing laboratory
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard and mouse and to handle other communications/computer components.
  • Potential exposure to odors, fumes, airborne particles, hazardous chemicals, and microbiological pathogens.
  • Noise level varies from quiet to loud.
  • Temperature varies from hot to cold.
  • Interactive and fast-paced team oriented tasks.
  • Overnight travel may be required at the discretion of management.
  • Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Summary

Posted: Dec 17, 2019
Role Number:200133053
The ALAC (Apple Latin America & Caribbean) Marcom team is part of the global Marketing Communications team at Apple who are responsible for all consumer facing communications. This includes advertising, apple.com, direct marketing, Apple Retail, channel, packaging, video, corporate identity, and partner communications. We are producers, writers, editors, designers, project managers, developers, photographers; all driving towards creating the world's best marketing communications. We strive for excellence where no detail is overlooked and where the customer experience is paramount. We never compromise in our pursuit of great work. We are looking for a world-class Strategic Planner to help ensure the flawless development and execution of extraordinary communications in support of Apple’s business goals in Latin America. You will be instrumental in driving the rethinking and reimagining of how Apple communicates to its customers in the region today. This is a new role within ALAC Marcom, and you will work closely with the local Latin America Leadership, Product Marketing, Brand and Creative teams to identify and address the critical challenges and opportunities for Apple in the region. As well as with the worldwide Planning team based in Cupertino to provide insights, knowledge and inspiration to some of the best creative talent in the world, in order to champion the very best creative work that only Apple can, and should deliver. The role of any Strategic Planner at Apple is not to invent truths, but to uncover truths, turn them into insights and help communicate them in the simplest, most inspiring and most engaging ways possible. Strategy is sacrifice, and we need someone who can look at a complex market landscape and confidently separate what we should do from what we could do.
Key Qualifications
  • The ability to work as a team but more importantly, to be proactive and self directing.
  • A deep understanding of, and extensive experience in brand communications.
  • A wide range of experience working on brands that tell inspiring and engaging stories.
  • A track record of leading strategic conversations with Creatives, agency partners and people from various internal disciplines.
  • Experience of partnering with, and building real, positive relationships with creative talent who span many fields - advertising, video, interactive, print, retail.
  • Strong commercial instincts, and proven experience in research/business problem identification and resolution.
  • Strong knowledge of the Channel environment, a key area of focus for Apple.
  • Solid skills in core areas: business and brand strategy, insights and research, media and communications planning.
  • Experience of building productive working relationships with key partners outside of the Marketing function, along with agency partners.
  • Great writing, visual story-telling and presentation skills are required. (Experience with Keynote a plus.)
  • Bilingual ability in Spanish (and/or Portuguese) and English is required.
  • 12+ years of planning experience at a creative agency or on the client side.
Description
Develop insight driven marketing briefs that inspire the best work possible; briefs for Latin America Marcom, but this could also include helping to develop specific global briefs. Establish relationships and garner insight from different disciplines within Latin America and with the global Planning team, including spending time in California. Collaborate with agency & research partners, Product Marketing, Sales & Brand Teams to identify and prioritize key marketing challenges and opportunities for the market. Consolidate opportunities and priorities into Country-specific Marketing Plans, annually and quarterly. Provide the Latin America and global teams with regular communication-based insights, competitive reviews and market snapshots that could impact briefs and subsequent creative work. Provide critical thinking and insights to select global projects/initiatives. Draw on many different sources of insight and knowledge to weave together strong creative narratives. Develop strong relationships and partner closely and efficiently with some of the best creative talent in the world. Strive to build the best communication experiences possible, but never be satisfied that you achieved it.
Education & Experience
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required.

If designing marketing materials excites you then you've come to the right place. As a marketing designer at LaunchDarkly, you will help create beautiful and delightful user experiences, generate great stories and play a key role in continuing to push our brand and messaging into new territory. You'll be an integral part of building and designing the future of LaunchDarkly's marketing for external and internal audiences. You'll work on projects spanning digital, print, physical goods, events, and more.

LaunchDarkly is a rapidly growing software company with a strong mission and vision carried out by a talented and diverse team of employees. Our goal is to help teams build better software, faster. You'll join a small team from companies like Atlassian, Intercom, and GitHub, and you'll have an immediate impact with our product and customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with the design and marketing teams to craft and deliver beautiful, consistent marketing experiences across digital, print, and physical spaces that push every aspect of what LaunchDarkly does to new heights.
  • Deeply understand the LaunchDarkly product so you can bring it to life through marketing campaigns, web pages, in-app experiences, and more.
  • Work collaboratively with other designers, developers, marketers, across the company to visualize the overall LaunchDarkly story.
  • Help with the end-to-end marketing asset creation: strategy, user research, prototyping, feedback, and execution. Effectively communicate research findings, participate in user testing, build and deliver campaign assets, and work with our talented engineers to ensure everything we ship meets our high standard of quality.
  • Help build, maintain and evolve the marketing design system.

Basic Qualifications:

  • 3+ years experience and a solid portfolio of creative marketing design focused work for top-notch digital products.
  • Experience working with web design systems.
  • Experience with html, css, and javascript, illustration, video, and/or motion design.

About LaunchDarkly:
LaunchDarkly is a Feature Management Platform that serves over 10 billion feature flags daily to help software teams build better software, faster. Feature flagging is an industry standard methodology of wrapping a new or risky section of code or infrastructure change with a flag. Each flag can easily be turned off independent of code deployment (aka ”dark launching”). LaunchDarkly has SDKs for all major web and mobile platforms. We are building a diverse team so that we can offer robust products and services. Our team culture is dynamic, friendly, and supportive.

About Us

United Genetics Co. has been developing and selling various vegetable seed products since 1990. We specialize in processing tomato, fresh market tomato, melon, watermelon, squash, hot pepper, sweet pepper and cucumber. Throughout the years, United Genetics has successfully grown into a network of sister companies across the globe allowing us to expand our breeding programs to Turkey, Italy, Spain, Mexico, and India. We owe our fast growth and continued innovations to our highest valued products - our people. Our employees across all countries are committed to "New ideas for better seeds," ensuring our products' quality comes before profit, and being true to nature.

Our efforts to become a leading seed company continues to move forward with Kagome acquiring United Genetics Seed Co. in 2016. Our merger and acquisitions further expanded the United Genetics network and gives us a greater opportunity to better serve our customers to deliver the highest quality of seeds.

Position Details

To breed and develop innovative and competitive seeded and seedless watermelon hybrids for priority segments and global markets.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain a well-organized breeding program that provide a continuous competitive pipeline of hybrid watermelon products for priority markets in the USA and Internationally.
  • Implement an effective strategy for 2N and 4N inbred development and hybrid 2N seeded and 3N seedless performance.
  • Undertake evaluation and analysis of product performance in comparison to competitor varieties within the breeding stations and external trial sites. Travel to the locations of the trials for evaluation.
  • Maintain breeder seed of parent lines with maximum genetic trueness, seed quality and adequate inventory. Provide descriptions of parental lines and experimental hybrids, providing support to foundation seed, pre-commercial and production units.
  • Communicate and discuss various breeding strategies with other breeders to achieve breeding goals in the most effective manner.
  • Plan with station manager and other colleagues to achieve breeding tasks with greatest efficiency.
  • Make strategic breeding crosses to enhance germplasm, incorporating multiple key traits and novel traits into existing germplasm for population development, line enhancement or marker development.
  • Design and execute effective biotic and abiotic selection indices. Use of molecular markers to facilitate selection, as applicable. Use fields and greenhouses for other selection, trait and performance validation.
  • Plan and execute crossing blocks to make new hybrids with the combinations of grower and consumer traits to meet watermelon nutrition, production, and market criteria. Set up crossing blocks to maximize efficient use of space and labor considering plant culture, pollination, and seed harvest activities.
  • Perform other incidental and related duties as required and assigned.
  • Interact with product development, marketing and sales personnel, and major customers to evaluate and identify new commercial hybrids.
  • Stay current on new and emerging breeding technologies and genetic resources. Evaluate their relevance, and incorporate them into the breeding program if practical and feasible.

Position Dimensions and Qualifications

Internal Contacts:

Direct contact with Research Director, Breeding Coordinators, CEO, Vice President, all Plant Breeders, Station Manager, Plant Pathologist, Product Development, Sales, and Production, Greenhouse and Field staff and contract laborers

External Contacts:

Customers, Vendors, Industry professionals, Universities and Government institutions.

Educational Level and Focus:

MSc or PhD degree in horticultural science or agronomy with a specialization in applied plant genetics and/or 7-10 equivalent years of experience in plant breeding.

Skills and Abilities:

Interpersonal: Ability to motivate, develop, and coach people as they work, and identify the best persons for the job. Ability to articulate and share information with management and team members by telephone, in written form or in person. Ability to develop and sustain constructive, respectful and cooperative working relationships with others, being aware of different behavior styles that might impact effective working relationships. Ability to act professionally in holding others accountable to agreed upon responsibilities and tasks. Adept at time management of self and others.

Communication: Ability to verbally communicate information and ideas, providing clarity for others to understand, as well as, if in writing. Demonstrate patience and willingness to identify and understand the speech of another person, and be sensitive in cross-cultural communication. Be adept at listening and giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking for clarity as appropriate. Take initiative to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong, and participate in problem solving to the extent of your ability and scope of responsibility.

Technical and Analytical:

Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word; Excel; Outlook and Powerpoint) and plant breeding database applications. Highly skilled at observation, phenotyping and optimizing abiotic and biotic selection pressure, showing ability to adopt cellular and molecular tools to improve selection efficiency, heterosis and quality control. Adept at focusing attention to detail. Ability to balance goals within logistical and budgetary guidelines.

Administrative and Operations:

Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, vegetable farming and seed production methods. Ability to plan and execute to meet deadlines.

Physical Demands:

Participate in constructive feedback. Deal calmly and effectively in a seasonally demanding work environment. Working flexible hours or over-time on short notice may be required. Must be able to work in the office and fields/greenhouses under various ambient conditions, particularly reduced air-quality and in periods of high temperatures possible exceeding 100 degrees F. Must be physically fit to walk, bend, kneel, squat, bend your neck, and lift up to 50 lbs. Agro-industrial and lab chemicals are sustainably used on site in compliance and in accordance to regulations.

Travel:

Domestic and international travel is required, approximately 10% of the time.

Work Environment:

Office, outdoor and greenhouse work with seasonal temperatures close to 100 degrees, walk on uneven surface and within limits, be exposed to chemicals.

Special Equipment Used:

Using computers and computer systems (software) to set up functions, enter data, track or process information.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Our primary research ranges from formative to evaluative, using approaches such as diary studies, in-depth interviews, and quantitative surveys. For this position, we are looking for individuals with a Qualitative background or mixed-methods background (experts in both qualitative and quantitative methods) and who bring an understanding of how to integrate diverse sources of insights. The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about UI design, passionate about optimizing product experiences in the social media space, comfortable in a flat, fast moving organization, excited to collaborate, and focused on impacting the design of Instagram.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work closely with product teams to identify research topics.
  • Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes.
  • Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs.
  • Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods, including in-depth interviews, ethnographies, and focus groups.
  • Interpret and analyze research results through the lens of UX and social science.
  • Collaborate closely with quantitative researchers.
  • Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing.
  • Partner with engineers, analysts, and other technical roles to create and share research.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor in Economics and Social Studies, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, or Social Science
  • 3+ years of experience in applied product research
  • Experience with survey design and response effects
  • Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative research methods
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) or Master in Business Marketing, Digital Marketing, Economics and Social Studies, Human Computer Interaction, Political Sciences, Psychology, or Social Science
  • 5+ years of experience in applied product research
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Overview

ES99: AN AGENCY WITHIN IMPACT.

Although officially established in 2018, ES99 was in the making for several years prior. As Impact’s rapid expansion brought more opportunities for optimizing businesses from the inside, it also uncovered a need for these businesses to improve their external presence for their customers’ branding & marketing needs. The internal design division at Impact was re-imagined to meet these needs and ES99 was born.

As a full-service boutique agency located in downtown Chicago, our core offerings fall into four main categories: research & strategy, branding, web design & marketing. Our client roster includes everything from B2B manufacturers to B2C CPG brands and everything in between. We’re always on the lookout for engaged, collaborative, creative people to bring into the team.
INTERNAL STRUCTURE

Our internal team is split within these core competencies:
  • Creative (strategy, design, ux/ui, copywriting)
  • Client management (research, account, digital media)
  • Production (web development & print)
  • Sales (business development)

OVERVIEW

We are seeking a qualified, self-sufficient, and thorough Marketing Researcher for immediate hire. The Marketing Researcher will be an integral part of the sales team and will assist in the preparation of high-impact primary research, both quantitative and qualitative, to be used exclusively on sales proposals.
Using extensive research methodologies, you will perform detailed research in a variety of industries with a focus on small business enterprises. You will play a vital role in sourcing and extracting valuable market information and turn that information into sellable and actionable items that are aligned with the agency service lines.
In this role, you will work primarily with business development while interacting with the creative, client management and production departments at the agency. This role report directly to the VP of Sales, but works closely under our Senior Researcher.

This is an exciting time at ES99 due to the substantial and ever-growing list of clients and this role will allow you be part of the agency success, from the very start in the sales process, while growing as professional and work surrounded by an energetic, fun and passionate team

Responsibilities

  • Coordinates with sales team to determine research objectives
  • Utilize various professional sources to find and extract pertinent information
  • Provides support in the preparation of comprehensive research documents
  • Prepares plans and collects data that is relevant to digital marketing strategy for clients
  • Shows adaptability when working on research related to any industry and any target
  • Communicates diligently with team members via proper channels to discuss research throughout the sales cycle (pre-during-post sale)
  • Consistently learns new digital trends to stay competitive and finds ways to adapt new trends into marketing opportunities
  • Prioritizes time spent on research based on deadlines
  • Dedicates time to turn metrics into insights that are ready for sales proposals
  • Reads, writes and proofreads extensively for longer periods of time without losing focus
  • Shows eager interest in all agency departments and service lines in order to adapt the core services into research insights that help close sales
  • Participates in internal and external meetings and calls including client-facing time

Things We Are Looking For

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, research or related field
  • 3-5 years of digital marketing experience
  • Proficient using Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneDrive and Teams
  • Desired skillset: Accountability, positivism, attention to detail, ability to provide insightful deliverables under fast turnaround deadlines, assertive decision making, time management, adaptability, team mentality, passion for all things digital and curiosity.

Conducts research and analysis projects to support the organization’s policy, program implementation, and marketing and outreach activities.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

Depending on the services needed and the skill set of the Research Analyst, responsibilities may include the following.


1. Project Scoping and Implementation

  • Design and scope research/evaluation projects in response to market needs, internal program needs and external funding opportunities.
  • Mentor junior members of R&A team in research methods and project work.

2. Research and Statistical Methods

  • Compile, read, and summarize existing literature to frame research efforts and inform policy.
  • Administer surveys, focus groups and/or interviews.
  • Assemble, manipulate, analyze and interpret data from various sources, often in coordination with external research partners.
  • Perform statistical analysis, including multivariable linear regressions, GIS-based spatial analysis, time series modeling and forecasting techniques.
  • Effectively communicate findings and implications to internal staff and high-level external stakeholders.
  • Review analyses conducted by other research analysts for quality.
  • Document research procedures and develop SOPs.
  • Draft written reports and proposals describing completed or proposed model design, implementation and results.
  • Work collaboratively with program teams and other members of R&A team to achieve objectives.

3. Data Visualization and Reporting

  • Generate web-based data visualizations, maps and reporting tools.
  • Access and facilitate reporting from existing program, customer relationship management (CRM) databases, and enterprise resource planning software databases

4. CSE Program Support

  • Develop analytical tools for program assessment, tracking and evaluation, including projections of budgets and participation rates.
  • Support/represent program staff in public reporting calls and committee.
  • Support program teams in measurement and evaluation activities.
  • Support program staff or senior members of R&A team in developing presentations.
  • Participate, as needed, in program working groups, meetings, and regulatory proceedings.
  • Advise program teams of research needs, opportunities, strategies and best practices; help them scope research projects that help meet their project goals.
  • Maintain effective working relationships with internal clients and other stakeholders.

5. Other

  • Contribute to R&A team strategy/work plan.
  • Present at conferences, produce research briefs and reports, write blogs.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Role Specific Responsibilities:

QUALIFICATIONS

Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Required

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Proficiency in at least two of the following:
  • Data visualization software (e.g., Tableau)
  • Statistical analysis tools (e.g., STATA, R)
  • Relational database development, maintenance and reporting
  • GIS mapping software (e.g., ESRI ArcMap 9+, QGIS)
  • Python
  • JavaScript
  • Quantitative research design and methods
  • Program evaluation
  • Extraordinary attention to detail, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to explain complex, technical concepts to non-technical staff and stakeholders
  • Self-motivated to meet deadlines efficiency, distributed generation and/or energy storage
  • Record of publications and/or presentations in industry relevant setting
  • Experience with advanced quantitative research design and methods
  • Experience working with or within public agencies
  • of multiple concurrent projects and implement quality assurance protocols
  • Ability to work independently on long-term projects
  • Demonstrated propensity to proactively communicate with teammates and seek feedback on work
  • Interest in working with data, research and sustainable energy initiatives

Preferred

Understanding of electricity sector (including rates) and/or markets or policy related to electric vehicles, energy

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook AR/VR brings together world-class experts to develop and ship groundbreaking consumer products at the intersection of hardware, software, and content that help advance Facebook's mission of bringing the world closer. It functions as a start-up environment, focused on innovation and breakthrough technology with aggressive and ambitious timelines.
The AR/VR team is seeking a Marketing Researcher to work on the Portal product, reporting into the Portal Insights Lead. The successful candidate will harness and translate insights into strategic marketing plans and communications, and create strong cross-functional partnerships with the Portal marketing, communication, product and analytics teams. This role will also help develop new hardware products, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, support creative development, optimize marketing to drive conversion of product funnel and ultimately create more value for consumers.
The ideal candidate will have exceptional research skills across both qualitative and quantitative methodologies, proven hands-on experience as a practitioner and manager, a hunger to drive significant business impact/outcomes, and an interest to remain deeply engaged in the execution of work. Strong time management and communication skills are critical, and experience with technology is a must.
This role is based in Menlo Park, but travel may be required up to 10-15% of the time.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Lead global marketing and product insights projects for Portal
  • Collaborative partner with Marketing, UX, and Product organizations to understand consumer needs and product use cases, define brand positioning, develop audiences, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, and optimize/improve marketing communications to achieve business objectives
  • Design and execute comprehensive, best-in-class quantitative and qualitative research solutions, at both the product and brand level. Leadership in technique and methodology is essential
  • Define people problems to influence executional strategy, goals and metrics to ensure line-of-sight to success
  • Translate data insights into actions and recommendations. Core focus will be on marketing and communications strategy and plans, at both a brand and product level, but will also include new product development and definition
  • Partner with Decision Science to develop hypotheses and comprehensive test and measurement plans, to design and execute experiments to achieve marketing objectives and drive marketing effectiveness
  • Ability to interface directly with leadership, and act as an effective communicator to influence decision-making and product planning
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • 4+ years of experience in marketing research or product research teams
  • Experience with qualitative and quantitative research methods
  • Experience working on global/ multi-country research studies
  • Experience in leading insights-driven campaigns/product launches from definition to execution, driving and influencing product and marketing decision-making
  • Experience engaging both at the technical/product level as well as on brand marketing/communications
  • Experience engaging in research work at a tactical/executional level as well as managing the growth and development of a team
  • Communication and presentation experience with using insights to influence executives and colleagues

Once mastered, you will help our team collect world-wide patent data, improve data collection operations, and provide quality checks of existing data. About us:

Limeade is a software company that elevates the employee experience and helps build great places to work. The Limeade ONE platform offers employee well-being, engagement, inclusion and communications solutions in one seamless user experience. Recognized for its own award-winning culture, Limeade helps every employee know their company cares.

We’re committed to creating a mission-driven, positive culture of improvement made up of the best and brightest people in the business. And we’ve got the awards to back it up: Puget Sound Business Journal ranked us #1 Best Workplace in Washington, and Seattle Business ranked us one of the top three Best Companies to Work for in Washington State. We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in North America (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™), and Fortune magazine recognized us as a Best Workplace for Women. Learn more at www.limeade.com.

About the role:

Limeade is looking for a Researcher to join Limeade Institute on a full-time basis. This position offers an exciting opportunity to carry out new, primary research, conduct applied research to deliver value to our customers, and partner with teams across the organization to bring this research to life.

In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to see research being used in practice within a short time frame. The researcher will focus on conducting in-depth reviews of literature to inform our research plan and executing primary research on various employee experience topics (e.g., engagement, being a great place to work, well-being, inclusion). You will be creating detailed summaries and general recommendations based on literature reviews and statistical analyses, writing white papers, submitting research to conferences and assisting with publishing articles in peer-reviewed journals. In the process, you will be partnering with the other members of Limeade Institute and teams across the organization (product, content, marketing, customer success) to help them utilize research findings. Finally, you will have the opportunity to work with our customers on custom research projects, delivering insights and recommendations. This person will be reporting to the Director of Research within Limeade Institute.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct a detailed review of literature on a range of employee experience topics, with a large focus on primary research publications
  • Carry out data analyses ranging from simple cross tabs and mean comparisons to more complex multi-level and growth models
  • Assist in designing and planning original research studies
  • Carry out research studies from planning to completion
  • Present findings and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders
  • Author white papers for internal and external use, submit materials for conference presentations and assist with writing articles for peer-reviewed journals
  • Work with teams across Limeade to share our research and help inform product, content, marketing and customer success best practices development
  • Work with our customers on custom projects, share insights and provide recommendations

Requirements:

  • Ability to demonstrate our values in an on-going and consistent way
  • Ability to work independently to find relevant articles and other publications
  • Experience distilling complex research findings into short, easy-to-read summaries
  • Experience planning and carrying out primary research
  • Experience presenting research findings at conferences and to non-academic audiences
  • A Doctoral degree in psychology, sociology, business, such as Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, or related fields
  • Experience with data analysis using SPSS, R or similar
  • Experience working with SQL and using basic data queries such as select, sort and simple joins
  • Experience independently running and interpreting statistical analyses such as Logistic Regression, Ordinal Regression, Hierarchical Linear Modeling, Structural Equation Modeling and doing participant matching
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills


Limeade provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Limeade will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

: Quickbooks.com is looking for a User Experience/Market Research Manager to join our Quickbooks Market Research team and partner with Marketing, Design, Product Management, Data Science, and Engineering to uncover deep insights about our existing and prospective users’ behaviors and attitudes as they shop.   • Passionate about creating a best-in-class shopping experience for customers

  • Strong communication skills with ability to deliver impactful presentations to both inspire and align stakeholders and leadership teams
  • Knowledge and experience with search engines, web analytics and business acumen
  • Familiar with online research tools like UserTesting, Optimal Workshop and Wevo
  • BA/BS required, MBA preferred

Asuragen is seeking multiple outstanding undergraduates, recent graduates, and/or Master students in the biological sciences for 2020 summer internships focused on developing innovative nucleic acid or protein-based technologies. These research positions will address early-stage projects relevant to Asuragen’s molecular diagnostics portfolio that currently influences over 15 million patient management decisions each year.

Projects will advance technologies or molecular assays that can help determine disease state which could lead to better diagnostics and informed patient treatments. The projects focus on interrogating biomarkers with precision medicine applications. Each intern works with a team on a specific project led by a Senior Asuragen scientific mentor; projects are scoped to produce defined outcomes within the internship period. Additional opportunities include interacting with team members across other departments (e.g. Marketing, Manufacturing, and IT) and participate in meetings (e.g. technical, department, companywide, and journal club).

We are looking for academically accomplished, highly motivated, and collaborative individuals with a strong interest in industrial R&D. Previous research experience is preferred, particularly experience with molecular techniques such as DNA or RNA isolation, PCR, capillary electrophoresis, sequencing (short- or long-read next-generation sequencing), and/or protein-based methods such as protein extraction/purification, western blotting, or ELISA assays. Proficiency with routine data analysis, management, and presentation tools such as and Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is expected.

Additional information:

  • Expectations are 40 working hours/week. Ideal start date is May 26, 2020
  • Technologies of interest will vary by project, but typical examples include PCR methods (including quantitative and digital PCR), fragment analysis using capillary electrophoresis, multiplexed array systems, and/or next-generation sequencing
  • Diagnostic disease applications span neurogenetics (such as Huntington’s disease, myotonic dystrophy, fragile X and autism spectrum disorder), and oncology (liquid and solid tumors)
  • Visa sponsorship is not available for this position

About Asuragen

Asuragen is a molecular diagnostic product company changing the way patients are treated in genetics and oncology. Asuragen’s diagnostic systems, composed of proprietary chemistry and software, deliver powerful answers using broadly installed instrument platforms. They are simple to adopt and expand the ability to serve patients. Asuragen is a product foundry rapidly and efficiently addressing current and emerging clinical needs, including cancer diagnosis and monitoring, reproductive health and aging, serving laboratories across a patient’s lifespan with its best in class diagnostic tests. For more information, visit www.asuragen.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Asuragen is an E-Verify Employer in the United States.

Job Description:

Research Director – Online Communities

Research/Account Director is a leadership role that should excite anyone with a Marketing Research and Business Management background. This is a position that will allow you to present new tools and cutting-edge research to your clients. You will have the ability to work across qualitative and quantitative avenues to impact your client’s business. You will work closely with the Social Space Community Manager to interpret the client's feelings and you will guide your team in the creation of compelling online communities. The best-suited candidate will be able to lead and manage a team that can successfully gather and interpret data that will drive client business.

Responsibilities:


  • Focus on building, maintaining and leading a multi-functional account team to achieve sales and profit goals.
  • Develop a thorough working knowledge of qualitative research principles and methodologies, encompassing a broad range of products.
  • Deliver effective presentations and create robust research designs that will enable clients to answer their key business questions.
  • Acquire and maintain excellence in research, seeking out third party sources of information and expertise.
  • Develop annual business plans that lay out revenue and profit goals as well as strategies and action steps for each client, reflecting strong strategic thinking and a clear path for achieving financial goals.
  • Recognize and develop opportunities for organizational and/or product innovation.

Required Skills:


  • Strong leadership and people-management skills
  • 7-10 years of experience in market research
  • 5-7 years of experience in financial services and/or conducting research for a financial services client/account
  • Experience with Brand Strategy
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Experience in the execution of a business plan that requires leveraging effective internal relationships across multiple functions and levels, including project directors, moderators and executives
  • Strong people management skills, coaching and developing direct reports
  • Client service and business building with a background in strong strategic thinking and creative problem solving
  • Innate desire to learn and excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Background in leading and inspiring teams that work collaboratively with a diverse group of colleagues
  • Comfortable managing a demanding and multi-faceted work load

Required Skills

Required Experience

With detailed, structured, and multifaceted training; our objective is to provide you with the tools to perfect the marketing craft while assisting with managing our business operations. This includes entry level marketing, sales, promotions, customer service, and leadership training.
