About Us:

Since our founding over 10 years ago, we’ve always been a different kind of company. After moving to New York from his native Turkey, our CEO Hamdi Ulukaya found that in America, yogurt just wasn’t as delicious or widely available as it was back home. He thought everyone deserved better options, so he set about making delicious, nutritious, natural, and accessible Greek Yogurt right here in the U.S.

Our mission since day one has been to provide better food to more people. And now as the No. 1-selling Greek Yogurt brand in America and the second largest overall yogurt manufacturer, we believe every food maker has a responsibility to provide people with better options, which is why we’re so proud of the way our food is made.

Our food philosophy of crafting quality products with simple ingredients is what makes Chobani a different kind of yogurt. Our belief that business done right has the ability to change lives and strengthen communities is what makes Chobani a different kind of company. From the way we source our ingredients to how we treat our employees, Chobani strives to make universal wellness happen sooner with everything we do. Certified as a Great Place to Work®, our culture is built on shared passion, dedication, and a commitment to doing what is right. Together, the Chobani family has created something unlike what any company has done before. The possibilities are endless.


Chobani is an equal opportunity employer. Chobani will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on any basis including, but not limited to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, military and/or veteran status, marital status, predisposing genetic characteristics and genetic information, or any other classification protected by federal, state and local laws.

Overview

This seasoned knowledge management specialist works as a part of a diverse collaborative international research team to advance organizational knowledge and programmatic effectiveness. This specialist focuses on the integration and translation of research knowledge to inform Compassion's child development program policy and practice, leadership decision-making and marketing platforms. The specialist generally takes primary responsibility for the development, generation, collation and delivery of credible research knowledge from multiple internal and external sources. He/she plays a key role in quality assurance of research reporting and the development and maintenance of research policies and guidelines. As an active member of a multi-disciplinary team, he/she will participate and take initiative in other team responsibilities as the needs arise. He or she may coach and oversee the work of other program effectiveness research specialists.

This position represents an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between state of the art research learning, both internal and external, and evidence-informed program design and improvement. The role will make a major contribution to a growing evidence-informed culture and capacity within Compassion.

Essential Job Functions

Responsibilities
  • Maintains a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. Is a consistent witness for Jesus Christ, maintains a courteous, Christ-like attitude in dealing with people within and outside of Compassion, and faithfully upholds Compassion’s ministry in prayer.
  • Acts as an advocate for children. Understands and advances Christ's mandate to protect children. Raises awareness of the needs of children and takes active steps to help protect against neglect, abuse, and exploitation of children. Promotes the dignity, respect, positive treatment, potential of children in all circumstances. Encourages the involvement of others in helping children in need. Reports and appropriately supports responses to incidents of harm of children if they occur.
  • Collaboratively informs and develops the strategic direction for the sharing of research knowledge and thought leadership with peers, practitioners and organizational leadership.
  • Applies consistently high standards to develop, generate, collate and deliver credible research knowledge based on quantitative and qualitative research findings, from both internal and external sources.
  • Applies appropriate learning approaches and principles in the promotion of reliable, timely and meaningful knowledge to multiple audiences via multiple modes and forums.
  • Contributes to internal research results reporting and collaborates on the delivery of research learning objectives for peers, practitioners and stakeholders.
  • Manages and develops team standards, policies, ethics requirements and research guidelines.
  • Oversees and helps develop research report quality assurance to ensures consistency and accuracy of results reporting.
  • Draws on field exposure to advise program managers, field office staff, and leadership on relevant programmatic issues when requested and through contribution to and/or leadership of multi-departmental project, creative thinking and analysis teams.
  • Interfaces with other Compassion departments and individuals who collect information and data (e.g., marketing, auditing and quality assurance, business intelligence, and management) in order to minimize duplication of effort, build cooperation and support the growth of dynamic and consistently high quality knowledge sharing across the organization.
  • Presents research findings to small and large audiences in a consumable manner for expert and lay stakeholders.
  • May coach and provide expertise to other professionals and support staff in the program effectiveness discipline.

Qualifications

Faith
  • Has a personal relationship with Jesus Christ.

Culture
  • Accountable for supporting, upholding, and engaging in Compassion's core "Cultural Behaviors" in all internal and external communication and relationships.

Education
  • Bachelor's Degree in International Development, Economics, Psychology, Public Health, Epidemiology, Ethnography, Anthropology, Social Science or related discipline.

Work Experience
  • Three years' experience working in this or similar position or field.
  • Significant coursework, qualifications and/or experience in advanced research methodology.

*** Equivalent education, training and/or certification may be substituted for experience and education shown above ***

Working Environment: Office – Standard Office Environment

Physical Demands: Sitting, standing, and/or walking for up to 8 hours per day

Travel Requirements: May be required to travel up to 15% of normal schedule

At the NBA, we’re passionate about growing and celebrating the game of basketball. Through the intensity of the game and the amazing athletic skill of our players, we deliver excitement to hundreds of millions of fans around the world.

As a global sports and media business, the NBA is so much more. While Basketball Operations runs the league’s on-court activities, other departments manage relationships with television and digital media partners, develop marketing partnerships with some of the world’s most recognizable companies, oversee the licensing of NBA merchandise, and handle a wide range of responsibilities that drive the NBA’s success.


Position Summary:

Seeking a versatile team member in the Global Content Media Distribution (GCMD) department. The successful candidate will be responsible for being a key contributor on various projects spanning media rights valuation, analytics, research and strategic initiatives across departments within the League. The role will expose you to scenario modeling, analysis and reporting. among other focus areas.


Major Responsibility:

  • Become fluent in all areas of content monetization such as FTA, PayTV, OTT, social and mobile at the NBA while understanding the challenges facing rights owners and distributors given the media ecosystem.
  • Understand the position of GCMD within the organization and its relationship with other NBA departments.
  • Conduct and subsequently draw insights from deal valuations, content engagement trends and comparative data to provide useful context for key decision makers in GCMD.
  • Take the lead in creating a methodology and basis for GCMD content evaluation in sponsorships and campaigns.
  • Have comfort in working with limited data but be able to draw useful insights.
  • Become fluent in qualifying media rights values through a variety of methodologies such as comparable, quantitative, qualitative or competitor/landscape analysis.
  • Assist regional GCMD teams with renewals and new business evaluation, metrics and timely hands on support tied to active deal discussions.
  • Assist with weekly reporting, trend analysis, multiple GMD strategic initiatives and incremental revenue-generation responsibilities, including providing top level reports and insights on key NBA international digital partnerships involving NBA App, nba.com and NBA League Pass partners.
  • Work with regional representatives to identify process enhancements, existing bottlenecks and future solutions to streamline GMD functions.
  • Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, to a broad range of internal and external constituents.


Required Skills/Knowledge:

  • Outstanding quantitative, research, modeling, and problem-solving skills with knowledge of finance a plus.
  • Self-starter who independently gathers and analyzes data from a variety of sources, draws conclusions and then acts on findings.
  • Experience working and multi-tasking in a dynamic, cross functional, fast-paced environment in a matrix organization.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
  • The right candidate will be able to explain, and where needed, defend her/his analysis both verbally and in writing.
  • Minimum 2 or 3 years of top-tier investment banking, private equity, management consulting or media corporate finance experience.
  • Strong facility and familiarity with MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  • Understanding and interest in the media rights landscape, key industry players, macro trends and disruptors is a plus.
  • International experience or knowledge is a plus.
  • Prior media or sports experience a plus.


Education:

BA/BS degree required

MBA Preferred


We Consider Applicants For All Positions On The Basis Of Merit, Qualifications And Business Needs, And Without Regard To Race, Color, National Origin, Religion, Sex, Gender Identity, Age, Disability, Alienage Or Citizenship Status, Ancestry, Marital Status, Creed, Genetic Predisposition Or Carrier Status, Sexual Orientation, Veteran Status, Familial Status, Status As A Victim Of Domestic Violence Or Any Other Status Or Characteristic Protected By Applicable Federal, State, Or Local Law.

Overview

Company & Program Overview:
Viacom has a clear vision: to be the premier destination where a diverse mix of hardworking people want to come, to stay and do their best work! We pride ourselves on bringing the greatest entertainment to our global audiences, and we know our company runs on the dedication of our passionate and creative employees and interns. Through television, film, digital content, live events, merchandise, studio production and more, Viacom connects with billions of people in nearly every country in the world. At Viacom, interns will have the opportunity to start and develop their professional careers at the home of iconic brands like BET, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount and others!

In the Viacom Internship Program, interns will be working in a vibrant and inclusive environment alongside employees from diverse backgrounds. Through Campus to Career’s in-depth offerings, interns gain exposure across our business while making significant connections for their future and accessing exciting career opportunities. In addition to hands-on experience our programs include networking, mentorship, resume workshops, speaker sessions, career development, movie screenings, ticket raffles, visibility to top industry executives, and much more.

Internship Departments:
Ad Solutions (Ad Sales) is a leading innovative organization that delivers the advertising revenue across all Viacom cable TV networks using state of the art research, data, partner marketing, and sales strategy approaches. They work across all media platforms – TV, digital, social, experiential/live events, emerging platforms; and all audiences. Overall this department helps drive brand value, manages channel priorities, meets distribution opportunities, increases revenue and considers cross channel goals.

Business Development & Strategy identifies growth opportunities and reaches out to new businesses, with the goal of driving new and incremental revenue across Viacom networks. These teams handle all prospecting, strategic ideation and planning, as well as execution of all marketing programs for new clients.

Consumer Products extends programming trademarks to create licensing and products including book publishing, home video and audio tapes, apparel, and children's toys. These teams ensure that our products have a retail presence in the marketplace and that Viacom is considered a first-class partner to licensees, retailers, and partners both domestically and internationally.

Content Distribution negotiates distribution agreements, maximizing revenue and marketing opportunities from traditional (Comcast, DirecTV, Verizon FiOS, etc.), digital (Amazon, Hulu, etc.) and new media distribution channels while ensuring that fans can discover and engage with Viacom content on every available device and platform.

Marketing communicates the value of each network to viewers and the cable communities. Interns will play an integral role in building and engaging customers, strategies, and campaigns. There are various areas within Marketing that contribute to the overall impact of the networks' message. These areas include Consumer, Digital/Social Media and Integrated.
  • Consumer Marketing is responsible for all strategic planning and execution of on and off-channel campaigns. These teams are responsible for defining network objectives, targeting audiences, researching insights, and developing strategies. They facilitate the ideation and implementation of consumer facing events associated with each show, and work across departments to ensure a 360 marketing plan is working cohesively toward launch.
  • Digital/Social Media Marketing develops and executes strategy for all major social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.), and for network series and specials. Their main goals are to drive on-air tune in, boost show awareness, and cultivate consumer engagement.
  • Integrated Marketing works with advertising partners to build co-branded marketing programs tied to their respective channels, events, and shows. Their work includes development of custom creative linear television, digital platforms, and cross-network campaigns to ensure Viacom reaches fans everywhere.

Summary

Posted: Nov 20, 2019

Role Number:200120306
Imagine what you could do here! At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Apple’s WW Product Marketing team is looking for a leader with vision in market Research to support the insights needs of our key B2B verticals. Identifying White Space Opportunities across multiple lines of product categories & businesses. “Market Sensing” - Mobile Devices, Computing Devices, Streaming Media Devices, Services, Apps, and new capabilities such as Augmented Reality. - Understanding the evolving complexity of the multi screen experience consumers have across mobile, home, and work. “Convergence 2.0” 2. Re-Envisioning existing data and new data to uncover insights and build models to create trends. “Data Harmonization” - Use existing internal data and re-envision it by cleaning and applying a new lens to find unseen insights. - Combine disparate data sets to build models and trends for all product categories, Apps, Services, and new spaces. You will monitor and communicate the status of our & competitors products, uncover relevant insights, find growth opportunities, and see opportunities to optimize our capabilities. Education & Experience

Who We Are:

Mekanism is an award-winning, independent, full-service advertising agency made up of creative entrepreneurs. With offices in San Francisco, New York, Chicago and Seattle, we serve as collaborative business partners with some of the world’s best brands, including Ben & Jerry’s, HBO, MillerCoors, Peloton, Facebook, Charles Schwab and Alaska Airlines. Our creative approach to brand building is best described as “The Soul & Science of Storytelling”: Communicating a brand’s purpose with ideas informed by data and rooted in human truths.

Mekanism has been named to Ad Age’s “Agency A List” and twice to their “Best Places to Work”. We have also been listed on Creativity’s “The Creative 50” and have been recognized by Effie as one of the “Most Effective Independent Agencies”. We have been profiled by The New York Times, Fast Company and ABC’s Nightline. Mekanism’s campaigns have been covered and studied by Harvard Business School.

We take great pride in making unconventional campaigns for brands in conventional categories. Our patented blend of storytelling for emerging media takes a small army of Mekanistas to pull off. What is a Mekanista you ask? Being a Mekanista requires a rare combination of being a strange, wonderful and talented person who enjoys coffee, ping-pong and impromptu rooftop jam and workout sessions. We are smart, strange, wonderful folks that brave our contentious and often spirited brainstorming sessions to make advertising magic. You will learn how to navigate the complex world of many different types of companies and learn how to effectively encourage clients toward new ways of thinking.


Key Areas of Responsibility

Media Channel Planning Support: Work with a range of vendors to support media planners as they build sophisticated digital media plans, using research tools to prioritize and justify partner recommendations.

Flawless Digital Media Execution: Hands-on execution, monitoring and management of media buys: digital video, display, social & native advertising.

Digital Partnership Innovation: With your strong digital / mobile / social / emerging media passion, help us crack innovation for our clients when working with publishers and other media companies.

Measurement and Analytics: Produce reports and manage delivery of campaigns against client KPIs. Readily dive into data to identify trends and insights, then apply them in the form of media and creative recommendations.

Managing Tasks & Timelines: Support the team as the owner of contact reports, task lists, and project timelines. Become an expert in the delivery of all elements of a successful media program.


Qualifications:
  • Previous experience as an employee or intern with a media company or integrated agency a plus
  • An understanding of cross-channel digital media, including video, display, native and social a plus. Facebook Blueprint and Google certifications give you a distinct advantage.
  • You must have a passion for creativity, innovation and interesting ways to use media.
  • Ideally have experience working with clients with both brand and performance media needs.
  • Ideally have experience developing plans for campaigns that push the limits of social, and digital marketing.
  • You must be comfortable working at a fast pace and be able to work directly with creative & planning teams. We blend teams across disciplines.
  • You should have great client skills. This means you should like to, and be proficient at, presenting work and fielding client requests. It also means you're generally a nice person.
  • You are a social animal. You like to present creative and account with new technologies and ideas to help grow business.

At PitchBook we work to provide global professionals with comprehensive data on the entire venture capital, private equity and M&A landscape so they can discover and execute opportunities with confidence. We credit our success and rapid growth to our cutting-edge products, customer centered attitude and ability to embrace and drive change.

In just over a decade, PitchBook has reached over 1,000 global employees with offices worldwide, and we’re not slowing down! Consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work, our culture is at the heart of our success and is driven by excellence, inclusion and fun. At PitchBook we’re committed to fostering an open and collaborative work environment.

Job Overview:

Are you the type of person who communicates well and loves finding answers to challenging questions? Are you looking for a role where you can make an impact, create channels of communication with industry leaders, and join a rapidly growing company that has opportunities at the next level for high performers across several departments? If so, we'd love to talk!

Summary of role:

Nearly everyone in Research starts as a Research Associate. In this role you will join one of our data-set teams with an initial focus on mastering our data management tool and direct outreach processes. Once mastered, you will create outbound campaigns using email and/or phone calls to gather and update data in our platform. The focus will be on primary research, which is the collection of proprietary data obtained from contacts at investment and advisory firms involved in PE and VC deals, or the companies being funded with private capital. This learning process and growth of industry knowledge creates a pathway for our Primary Research Associates to grow into Senior Research Associates and Team Leads within Research or a variety of roles on other teams at PitchBook.

Primary Job Responsibilities:

  • Building relationships with industry professionals at private equity and venture capital backed companies, service providers or private investment firms
  • Managing email and/or call campaigns with the goal of gathering and verifying private markets data
  • Working with marketing, editorial and customer success teams to tailor email messaging, meet reporting deadlines and better understand client use cases
  • Leveraging technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently and with the utmost quality
  • Working with team to develop and improve processes, tools and methodologies
  • Taking on projects to identify opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
  • Becoming an expert in PitchBook’s core research areas of private equity, venture capital and M&A through dedicated training

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Communication skills, both verbal and in written materials, targeting an audience all the way up to the executive level
  • A strong sense of urgency, as well as comfort making a high volume of outbound calls on a daily basis
  • The belief that anything below excellent isn’t good enough and expectations of the same from those on your team
  • The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • Strong organization methods and top-notch multi-tasking skills
  • Incessant curiosity, innovative thinking and meticulous work habits
  • A background or interest in the private equity, venture capital and M&A industries
  • 1 – 2 years professional experience, which might be in the form of an internship
  • Bachelor’s degree required

Brilliant PR & Marketing Seeks Public Relations Press Coordinator

Leading agency serving consumer lifestyle brands with an emphasis on products for families including baby and maternity, toys and games, tech, and housewares and food, Brilliant PR & Marketing seeks an entry-level Public Relations Press Coordinator to support our fast-paced culture and rapid growth!

Our ideal Public Relations Press Coordinator is at the start of their career but has aspirations to progress quickly to more senior-level agency positions. Key responsibilities will be tracking the success and result your team generates through media monitoring, fueling our agency’s proprietary results reporting database, creating custom reports to merchandise results to clients, communicating those results directly to clients, and more.

This role is the perfect opportunity to learn and refine elements of the public relations trade that are the foundation for every role within an agency setting. This includes refining your research skills, developing professional judgment, learning how to strategically communicate with clients and more. You’ll work within the framework of a supportive 3-4 person team that will depend upon and guide you in executing the fundamental account tasks you’ll be leading while valuing your contributions to clients’ campaigns, strategies, events, and activations. We also recognize that the right candidate for this role may not be fresh out of school, but rather a seasoned professional from another field looking to take the first step toward a career pivot, or, a PR veteran who has been away from agency life for a while and looking to reenter.

So what’s Brilliant all about? We are a unique PR agency in that our more than 20 team members each work remotely, with pockets of staff centralized in NYC, LA and Scottsdale, AZ, and even more scattered around the country. We give our people the resources and freedom to get their work done without having to sit in a cubicle or stuffy office, but team members are expected to be self-starting, super-motivated individuals who have project and time management down to an art. Although we are remote, team members are expected to be available and online during normal business hours.


Responsibilities Include:

  • Monitoring client media, influencer, and social coverage and sending “Hits As They Happen” emails in real-time
  • Tracking and coordinating product requests, sample inventory, and client sample budgets
  • Generating monthly client reports via Coverage Book and manage real-time published coverage tracker in AirTable
  • Using Cision, Klear, Google, Twitter, Instagram, and more to build curated media and influencer target lists
  • Developing management skills by leading interns to success
  • Becoming a professional researcher and mastering the art of using Google, LinkedIn, and other search engines
  • Showing off your understanding of numbers and data by taking the charge on identifying insights and creating metrics reports
  • Learn how to be a pitch master!

Beyond these core responsibilities, you’ll have an opportunity to contribute to the bigger picture and reach toward more advanced tasks. Examples include contributing ideas for pitch angles, influencer opportunities, activations, and campaigns, drafting pitches, press materials and more.


Requirements Include:

  • At least 6 months experience in consumer products PR, preferably in an agency setting (including internships or college work experiences). No internship experience? Check out our Press Coordinator in Training program!
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication, project management, and time management skills
  • SUPER organized style and the ability to focus working off-site
  • Excitement for numbers! PR involves analyzing data to identify trends and areas for improvement.
  • Familiarity with Outlook, Cision, Google Docs, video conferencing and Glip
  • Experience with Coverage Book, Meltwater/Klear, AirTable and video and photo editing software is a BIG plus
  • First-hand experience with social media channels and influencers including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube (preferred)

Did we forget to mention Fabulous Fridays? You get the 1st Friday of every month off!

Overview

Job Summary


Perform and develop methods in industrial microbiology involving both Quality Control and Research and Development functions which may include: microbial evaluation of over-the-counter (OTC) pharmaceuticals, personal care products, nutritional supplements, and foods; microbiological monitoring of manufacturing environments; and preservative efficacy testing of newly developed products and stability samples.


Reasonable Accommodation


Essential duties, responsibilities, and qualifications of the job can be performed with or without reasonable accommodation and without posing a direct threat to him/herself or others.

Responsibilities

  • Evaluates raw materials, bulk batches, and finished goods for microbial purity, including pathogen screening.
  • Performs PCPC (CTFA) and USP preservative efficacy testing on new formulas and as part of stability.
  • Conducts microbiological surveys in the areas of plant hygiene, air quality, and sanitation efficacy.
  • Validation of testing methods and equipment for the Micro labs, including writing final reports.
  • Maintains the laboratory, equipment, and instruments in conformance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP's).
  • Enters and verifies lab data in computer databases and lab notebooks, generate test reports, and communicate results.
  • Prepares media and orders supplies for the lab while maintaining expenses within budget.
  • Leads investigations into microbial test result excursions and performs microbial identifications.
  • Identify opportunities for increasing lab efficiencies and cost savings.
  • Independently evaluate and summarize data from experiments.
  • Interpret unexpected results or observations and recommend next steps.
  • Communicate results both orally and in writing to supervisor, key project members, and higher level management.
  • Independently take action on project activities, work with other functions and sometimes outside vendors.
  • Demonstrate competency with JDE, MasterControl and other software systems for daily tasks.
  • Ability to independently set up and analyze Design of Experiments (DOE).
  • Help teach less experienced Microbiologists.

Qualifications

  • BS degree in Microbiology.
  • At least 2 years of microbiology experience in OTC pharmaceutical, personal care product, or food industries.
  • Knowledge of instrumentation, media preparation, and standard methods of microbiology.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office.
  • Excellent math skills (add, subtract, multiply, divide, analyze, etc.).
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Positive attitude and role model for Research Assistants.
  • Ability to work under stress.
  • Standing, sitting or walking for duration of shift.
  • Visually read bottles, product, batch numbers, etc.
  • Ability to organize and coordinate projects.
  • Ability to perform the essential duties and responsibilities with efficiency and accuracy.
  • Ability to climb stairs.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 40 lbs.

Why Melaleuca

Melaleuca is one of the leading Health and Wellness companies in the world. We manufacture and distribute nutritional, pharmaceutical, personal care, facial care, home hygiene, and other wellness products and distribute them directly to the consumer through a full-service catalog and Internet shopping system. We carefully craft products used every day with the highest standards of safety, health, and wellness in mind.
This revolutionary system is changing the way hundreds of thousands of people shop by eliminating middlemen and reducing marketing and distribution costs. This enables the company to spend more on research and high-quality, ecologically-sensible ingredients, while maintaining reasonable prices.

Great culture—Flexibility is a must in this position; you'll become a part of a fast-paced team dedicated to a feel-good lifestyle brand dedicated to changing lives. Our employees and their families enjoy company parties and countless discounts around the community. We implement a very real open-door policy, and all employees are on a first name basis—it feels more like a family than a multi-national corporation.

Excellent compensation—in addition to a competitive wage and bonus incentive program, we offer comprehensive benefits for our full-time employees that include all you would expect plus some remarkable surprises, such as a longevity bonus. Right here on-site, we provide childcare, a fitness center, free concierge service, and an employee restaurant.

Research Analyst - (192188)

The opportunity:
We are looking for you or maybe someone you know…
Do you like brands, people, and the intersection of the two? Do you ever find yourself saying “If I could get my hands on the data, I know I could [insert all the things you could do with data]?” Are you looking to take your base knowledge of research to the next level to create informing, breakthrough, and shareable content? Then we may be the place you didn’t even know you were seeking!

We are looking for a full-time Research Analyst, based in our Seattle office, to join a growing team of experienced researchers. You should have previous experience in applied analytics, quantitative research or qualitative research. We are looking for someone who is naturally curious and has a passion for understanding human behavior.

Your potential coming to life:
Joining our team means you will be…
  • Contributing to research projects from start to finish, keeping the project on time and best serving client needs
  • Compiling, synthesizing, and analyzing research collected from internal analytics and social listening tools
  • Telling powerful stories with data to help inform client strategy
  • Creating reports and presentations, including data entry, chart/table creation, and analysis in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Proofing and checking presentations
  • Conducting background research for potential client engagements – issues of importance, companies, institutions, etc.
The team is here for you:
Our team currently includes …
  • Fun first attitudes – because what’s the point of doing great work if aren’t having fun?
  • Career pathing on the mind – whether you plan to stay for 2 years or 20 years we put your development and career goals as a priority
  • Open space floor plan community – the best research happens with collaboration and sometimes that includes input from our non-research co-workers
  • Broader communications exposure – you will get the opportunity to work alongside broader Edelman teams such as Corporate , Brand, Digital, Assembly, and more
  • Open minds for new ideas and methodologies – maybe its not broken, but that doesn’t mean we can’t make it better.
  • Level agnostic – doesn’t matter if you are the boss or an intern, we are all in this together
  • West Coast broader team – you will sit in Seattle, but you also will work with people from our San Francisco office
  • Global Reach – beyond the west coast we have researchers you can tap into around the world

You’re setup for success if:
Qualified candidates have most, if not all, of the following…
  • At least one year of experience in market research or market research role is strongly preferred
  • At least two to three years of experience in applied analytics, data analysis, social listening, media analysis, or a related field in leu of market research experience
  • Experience with Marketing, Advertising, PR, Communications, Consulting, Technology, or Statistics is a plus
  • Quick learner who works well both independently and as part of a larger team
  • Ability to multi-task and work effectively with a variety of team members and projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent PowerPoint skills, with the ability to create slides and charts that convey key research findings
  • Personal accountability, a strong work ethic, and a positive “can do” attitude

Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. BMG is the new model music company founded by Bertelsmann in 2008 as a direct response to the challenges of music’s digital revolution. Key to its innovative approach is the fact it represents the traditionally separate music publishing and recording rights off the same state-of-the-art platform internationally. BMG is already the world’s fourth biggest music publisher and the first new global player in the recordings business in decades. BMG’s pitch is unique – a relentless focus on fairness and transparency and service to its artist and songwriter clients. BMG’s 14 offices across 12 core music markets now represent over 2,5m songs and recordings, including the catalogues of Chrysalis, Bug, Virgin, Mute, Sanctuary, Primary Wave and Talpa Music, as well as literally thousands of artists and songwriters attracted by its fresh approach. About Axle
Axle Informatics is a bioscience and information technology company that offers advancements in translational research, biomedical informatics, and data science applications to research centers and healthcare organizations around the globe. With experts in biomedical science, software engineering, and program management, we focus on developing and applying research tools and techniques to empower decision-making and accelerate research discoveries. We work with some of the top research organizations and facilities in the country including multiple institutes at the National Institutes of Health (NIH).

Purpose
To provide subject-specific research expertise and undertake specific biomedical research work as directed by lead Principal Investigator (PI) or project lead to achieve the goals set forth in the project or protocol.

Responsibilities and Duties
This position requires participation in the research activities of various sections of the Research Technologies Branch of NIAID. Duties could include
  • Performs various media art projects in support of research programs.

Experience/Knowledge
  • Demonstrated significant depth and breadth of subject-level expertise.

Skills
  • Ability to conduct research work and to disseminate results.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize assigned
  • Ability to write research reports and to effectively disseminate outcomes.
  • Excellent oral, interpersonal and written communication skills.
Attributes

Job Brief

Help create new technology and fundamentally improve existing technology that will have a positive impact on the business of the company.

Who We Are

Dyno Nobel is a global leader in the commercial explosives industry. We provide innovative blasting solutions and quality explosives products throughout North America, Australia and selected customers in the Asia Pacific.

Join us in everything that’s great about Dyno Nobel: OUR culture, OUR values, OUR commitment to safety and most importantly our PEOPLE. This combination makes Dyno Nobel a terrific place to work.

Dyno Nobel is a subsidiary of Australian based Incitec Pivot Limited. IPL's 4500 employees also manufacture and market industrial chemicals and fertilizer products & services to customers around the world.


What You’ll Do

You will be the expert in helping create new technology and fundamentally improve existing technology that will have a positive impact on the business of the company. Other duties will include:

  • Provide new and improved products, technology or processes within the Company’s objectives by driving scientific experiments in accordance with company goals.
  • Design and conduct laboratory and pilot-scale testing on new or improved products and processes using efficient and safe experimental techniques.
  • Maintain a disciplined approach to project management and experimentation that enables results to be effectively communicated with management, sales, and marketing, or customers.
  • Participate in management planning to evaluate, coordinate and prioritize projects; use project management software to plan, execute and track progress on projects to ensure timely and cost-effective development.
  • Be capable of designing and running analytical test methods (including relevant data analysis) for scientific instruments, functional and physical analysis, etc., that support technology development within the company.
  • Become knowledgeable about the science of industrial explosives and specifically the technology of Dyno Nobel utilizing literature and patents, interactions and collaborations within Dyno Nobel locally and globally, industry intelligence, site visits, training opportunities, etc.
  • Comply with applicable regulatory health and safety policies and practices in order to ensure personal safety and the safety of all employees, company assets, environment and regulatory compliance to include but not limited to EPA, DOT, ATF, DHS, MSHA.
  • Apply and enforce regulatory health and safety requirements and implement the DNI HSE Management System.
  • Must satisfy the requirement for a "possessor of explosives" as defined by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms

AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Center for Preparedness and Response (CPR), Office of the Director (OD), Client Service Professionals (CSP) in Atlanta, Georgia. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
This position serves as a liaison for various program areas performing program support work including Personnel, Training & Administration, Procurement, Property & Facilities, Records Management and Travel. The employee meets regularly with team leaders, supervisors and managers to provide advice and assistance, resolve business service problems, and identify ways to improve business services.

DUTIES:
[
"As a Program Specialist you will: Provide advice and assistance, resolve business service problems, and identify ways to improve business services. Provide administrative and technical support to the assigned division/programmatic office. Coordinate and prepare request for personnel actions. Monitor, coordinate, and track all on-going and projected actions and continuously update staff. Handle purchases and procurements. Provide advice, assistance and information to staff and management on domestic and international travel procedures, policies, etc." ]

REQUIREMENTS:
US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation may be required. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Research position: No Promotion potential: No Supervisory position: No Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. Public Trust/Moderate Background Investigation (5) is required.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-09 grade level in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in managing research, interpret functions and work processes of administrative or technical programs while making recommendations for improvement in work operations. OR Ph.D. or equivalent doctoral degree or 3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree or LL.M., if related. OR Have a combination of specialized experience and education. When combining education and experience, the total percentage must equal 100 percent to qualify. Documenting experience: In accordance with Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not normally be part of the employee's position is creditable, however, when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignment. The documentation must indicate whether the duties were performed full time or, if part time, the percentage of times the other duties were performed. It is expected that this documentation is included in the employee's official personnel record. In order to receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate documentation of such experience as indicated above.

HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED:

If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. Administrative ManagementCustomer ServiceData CollectionFederal and Departmental Acquisition Policies and Procedures KnowledgeIntegrityOral CommunicationProgram AdministrationProject ManagementWritten Communication

BENEFITS:

HOW TO APPLY:

If you utilize the Alternate Application method, your USAJOBS account will not display this application and you will not receive status updates.

An official transcript from an accredited educational institution is required if you are selected for the position. For Active Duty USPHS Commissioned Corps Officers Submit your latest Personnel Order (PHS-7063) as an USPHS Active Duty Commissioned Officer Failure to submit any of the above mentioned required documents may result in loss of consideration due to an incomplete application package. It is your responsibility to ensure all required documents have been submitted. For Résumé and Application Tips visit: https://help.usajobs.gov/index.php/Tips.

WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT:

About Hive:

Hive is a full stack deep learning platform helping to bring companies into the AI era.

Two Stanford graduate students determined to build practical applications using novel deep learning technologies founded Hive (https://thehive.ai/). From the beginning, we knew that high-quality datasets were critical to creating deep learning models. However, we also knew that the quantity of labeled data also has a huge impact on model performance. With this in mind, we first started by building a data- labelling platform specifically designed to solve machine-learning problems. This platform, Hive Data, is now the world’s largest distributed human workforce for data labelling and produces millions of high-quality annotations every day. Hive Data allows us to label uncommonly large datasets at a fraction of the cost that other data labelling solutions would charge. Once Hive Data was built, we were able to quickly label enormous datasets and rapidly build a suite of machine learning models that now form our core offerings in Hive Predict.
Our Hive Predict team has since built a wide range of custom machine learning models spanning a range of verticals including media, retail, security, and autonomous driving. Drawing on this experience and expertise, we then set out to build a stand-alone analytics platform for TV advertising called Hive Media. Hive Media synthesises our company's fundamental technologies and leverages industry partnerships to deliver a truly revolutionary product. Hive offers the only true, full- stack deep learning platform in the world, assisting clients with data labelling, model building, and the development of full enterprise solutions.

Today, we work with some of the largest companies in the world to redefine how they think about unstructured visual data and together we build solutions that completely transform verticals. We are fortunate to be funded by leading investors like Peter Thiel (Founders Fund), General Catalyst, Formation 8, and others. We have over 160 talented individuals globally, based in our San Francisco and Gurugram offices.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Marketing Research Analyst will be a part of the Hive’s Marketing Research team. Based out of Hive’s Gurgaon office, the analyst will be a part of a centralised team working on the company’s business development research, industry research and competitive analysis activities
  • The role is purely secondary research based and the specialist will be responsible for identifying new prospective clients, industry trends particularly related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning industries, competitive analysis and competitive benchmarking
  • The analyst will be working extensively on pre-sales research; however, will not be involved in the sales activities
  • The analyst will be required to submit research and the consecutive findings to the Hive’s sales team and/or senior executive team depending on the project
  • We are looking out for Proficient professional with sound business logic and ability to structure approaches to answer complex business questions
  • Must be a quick learner and innovator who quickly understands the process and continuously work towards improving the same

Eligibility:

  • MBA (Marketing, international business or research) with maximum up to 3 months of work experience or graduates with 6-18 months of work experience
  • Research orientated with good secondary research skills with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Keen interest in Technology Industry and in learning about emerging technologies
  • Demonstrated success in a competitive environment and you are highly self-motivated and ambitious in achieving goals
  • Strong team player, but can work and execute independently
  • Organised, detail-oriented and can handle multiple projects
  • We are looking out for Proficient professional with sound business logic and ability to structure approaches to answer complex business questions
  • Must be a quick learner and innovator who quickly understands the process and continuously work towards improving the same

What Hive offers you:

  • Extensive resources and exceptional people to work with. We are a group of individuals who are young and determined to make a mark on the world
  • You will be based in Gurgaon, India Office and Hive offers all the standard benefits available in leading startups
  • At Hive, you will have significant career development and learning opportunities
Thank you for your interest in joining Hive!

About us:

Limeade is a software company that elevates the employee experience and helps build great places to work. The Limeade ONE platform offers employee well-being, engagement, inclusion and communications solutions in one seamless user experience. Recognized for its own award-winning culture, Limeade helps every employee know their company cares.

We’re committed to creating a mission-driven, positive culture of improvement made up of the best and brightest people in the business. And we’ve got the awards to back it up: Puget Sound Business Journal ranked us #1 Best Workplace in Washington, and Seattle Business ranked us one of the top three Best Companies to Work for in Washington State. We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in North America (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500™), and Fortune magazine recognized us as a Best Workplace for Women. Learn more at www.limeade.com.

About the role:

Limeade is looking for a Researcher to join Limeade Institute on a full-time basis. This position offers an exciting opportunity to carry out new, primary research, conduct applied research to deliver value to our customers, and partner with teams across the organization to bring this research to life.

In this role, you will have a unique opportunity to see research being used in practice within a short time frame. The researcher will focus on conducting in-depth reviews of literature to inform our research plan and executing primary research on various employee experience topics (e.g., engagement, being a great place to work, well-being, inclusion). You will be creating detailed summaries and general recommendations based on literature reviews and statistical analyses, writing white papers, submitting research to conferences and assisting with publishing articles in peer-reviewed journals. In the process, you will be partnering with the other members of Limeade Institute and teams across the organization (product, content, marketing, customer success) to help them utilize research findings. Finally, you will have the opportunity to work with our customers on custom research projects, delivering insights and recommendations. This person will be reporting to the Director of Research within Limeade Institute.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct a detailed review of literature on a range of employee experience topics, with a large focus on primary research publications
  • Carry out data analyses ranging from simple cross tabs and mean comparisons to more complex multi-level and growth models
  • Assist in designing and planning original research studies
  • Carry out research studies from planning to completion
  • Present findings and recommendations to internal and external stakeholders
  • Author white papers for internal and external use, submit materials for conference presentations and assist with writing articles for peer-reviewed journals
  • Work with teams across Limeade to share our research and help inform product, content, marketing and customer success best practices development
  • Work with our customers on custom projects, share insights and provide recommendations

Requirements:

  • Ability to demonstrate our values in an on-going and consistent way
  • Ability to work independently to find relevant articles and other publications
  • Experience distilling complex research findings into short, easy-to-read summaries
  • Experience planning and carrying out primary research
  • Experience presenting research findings at conferences and to non-academic audiences
  • A Doctoral degree in psychology, sociology, business, such as Industrial/Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, or related fields
  • Experience with data analysis using SPSS, R or similar
  • Experience working with SQL and using basic data queries such as select, sort and simple joins
  • Experience independently running and interpreting statistical analyses such as Logistic Regression, Ordinal Regression, Hierarchical Linear Modeling, Structural Equation Modeling and doing participant matching
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills


Limeade provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Limeade will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Job Title: ADMINISTRATIVE SPECIALIST
Department: Parks & Recreation
Reports To: Recreation Division Manager
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
Job Status: Full-time; Classified
Pay Grade: 106

SUMMARY
Incumbents provide customer service and administrative support for the Parks and Recreation Department. Incumbents assist with the planning and implementation of special events and creation of marketing collateral for the Department to include flyers and recreation brochures, and distribute through print, digital, and social media. Incumbents are responsible for preparing reports, preparing and proofing original correspondence, performing basic accounting, and conducting moderately complex research. This includes performing tasks related to routine day-to-day operations such as registering clients for programs, covering the front desk, assisting with registration software, receiving checks and cash, processing payments, and performing daily reconciliations. Incumbents also handle dues and memberships for the Department, process travel requests and reimbursements, acquire quotes, inventory and order supplies, assist with boards and commissions, and assist with data entry of maintenance records. Hours and days of the week may vary according to season, and may include weekend and evening hours.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The duties listed below are intended only as general illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. Specific statements of duties not included does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position. Job descriptions are subject to change by the City as the needs of the City and requirements of the job change.

  • Provides professional customer service to internal and external customers; represents the Department to the public and outside groups and organizations; responds to a wide variety of questions and comments
  • Reconciles daily cash receipts
  • Prepares and maintains specialized files, documents, and presentations
  • Researches, compiles, and creates reports and presentations where routine analysis or technical data is required; notifies supervisor of potential problems based upon compiled information and data, and recommends potential solutions
  • Coordinates travel arrangements for assigned areas
  • Administers the completion, collection, and processing of a variety of forms, information, registration material, and other related documents
  • Assists with commission meetings by scheduling and confirming attendees, taking and transcribing meeting minutes, and preparing summaries for distribution
  • Promotes Department events and programs by creating and disseminating marketing materials and coordinating quarterly brochure information
  • Creates and executes marketing plan for the Department
  • Works evenings, weekends, and holidays as required
  • Performs the essential duties of the job in the conditions described in the physical demands and work environment sections below
  • Maintains regular attendance and punctuality
  • Performs other duties of a similar nature or level

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
None.

The City of Surprise offers a comprehensive benefit package including annual paid time off and eleven paid holidays. Other benefits include employer paid medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as, a state retirement system.

Position Purpose

The Marketing Specialist directs and manages various digital marketing projects for the Marketing Department. This position fosters the image of the credit union in the community and promotes its products and services to members.

Organization Role and Overall Contribution

This position reports to the AVP Digital Marketing. This position develops targeted marketing campaigns across unauthenticated channels including: email, digital branch signs, LED signs, SEG digital assets, newsletters, and other digital advertising. It has no direct supervisory responsibility, but provides work direction and oversight to select contract personnel and various print media vendors.

Job Scope

This position has no direct revenue responsibility, but clearly impacts revenue potential through the effectiveness of the communications programs produced. This position operates with a high degree of autonomy and has authority to interpret and apply management policies regarding decision associated with management of digital marketing channels and uses discretion and independent judgement in addressing issues and resolving matters.

Expected Contributions

1. DEVELOPS, COORDINATES, AND EXECUTES CAMPAIGNS

Key/Representative Activities:

  • Coordinates the development of email campaigns, internal television programming, social media sites, external branch electronic signs, direct mail, print advertising, internal and external newsletters, annual reports, brochures, Select Employee Group (SEG) packets, SEG marketing materials, etc.
  • Develops content, layout, and graphics utilized in credit union communications
  • Creates design concepts in conjunction with graphic designer
  • Communicates project parameters and needs to the graphic designer and other applicable external vendors
  • Directs analytics-based recommendations across digital channels
  • Recommends content formatting, layout and graphic designs Works with others in marketing to create and maintain content calendars across channels, including, email, advertising, digital signage, newsletters, etc.

2. CONTENT PLANNING AND OPTIMIZATION

Key/Representative Activities:

  • Regularly report metrics across channels and make recommendations for improvements
  • Conduct A/B testing and monitor results
  • Maintains awareness of financial industry advertising standards
  • Develops and maintains relationships with local media/advertising representatives in designated market areas

3. OTHER WORK ASSIGNMENTS, AS REQUESTED

Key/Representative Activities:

  • Manages software tools to deliver applicable digital channel
  • Acts as Administrator for systems to deliver digital media across channel (e.g., email)
  • Researches digital tools and software to optimize costs and/or experience aligned with the business goals
  • Develops and maintains relationships with local partners/vendors

Essential Qualifications & Competencies

Minimum Education Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications or related field required
  • 2-4 years of related experience in marketing communications

Competencies:

  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Fast learner, highly motivated, self-starter and creative
  • Client-centric and service oriented positive attitude
  • Availability to work evenings and weekends
  • In-depth knowledge of marketing theory and practice
  • General knowledge of PCs and applicable software
  • Sufficient manual dexterity for operation of PC keyboard and other standard office equipment

This job description is not intended to provide an all-inclusive listing of related job activities. Associates may be requested by management to perform other related activities in place of or in addition to those representative activities noted in this job description.

We are looking for a Digital Marketing Strategist who will be responsible for developing solutions to meet our clients’ brand objectives based on customer insight and data spotting trends and technologies that play roles in our customer’s lives, as well as familiarity with SEM/SEO/CRM activation strategies.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will also help cross-functional teams develop and evolve ideas to bring together brand goals, objectives and customer needs.


Responsibilities

The Digital Strategist will help our clients optimize the internet to achieve their objectives. They will typically perform an audit of our client’s digital assets and develop a competitive assessment. They will also work closely with our marketing and brand strategists to develop an online strategy (marketing and web). This roadmap will optimize all relevant digital channels and tactics (i.e. websites, content marketing, social media, e-commerce, search and social advertising, SEO, marketing automation, apps, media/blogger outreach, etc.) into one actionable plan. The Digital Strategist will oversee implementation and management of our strategies as well as management of the digital team.

  • Perform detailed research into our customers, and competitors across multiple markets.

Support:

That's Nice LLC is a New York City science marketing agency of 30+ people providing market research, strategic positioning and brand-focused marketing to meet the needs of clients in pharmaceutical development, healthcare and associated segments.

Mark Allen

Strategy Director, Partner

Please no phone calls.


We are seeking a Marketing Writer to write, edit and proofread marketing copy for digital, print, trade show, video and advertising projects serving clients in these technically complex markets. Success on the fundamental level will be defined as taking content projects to client approval without the interjection of existing senior-level writing and strategy staff. This requires ongoing accumulated knowledge of client subject matter and content development that is high quality, appropriate to the objective, and successfully interprets the client’s needs.

The Marketing Writer will need to interpret messaging strategy that either already exists or comes from an internal process completed by our company’s strategy team. In certain instances, the Marketing Writer may be involved in the conceptual development of messaging strategy for clients.

Job Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a writer in agency or corporate marketing, or publishing related to pharma and healthcare.

  • Ability to produce marketing content for various client tactics in diverse markets within pharmaceuticals, biotechnology and broader life sciences.

  • Ability to learn enough information about clients’ subject matter to originate marketing material with technical authority and accuracy.

  • Ability to take industry-specific original material and edit it into appropriate compelling copy relative to the application and audience.

  • Proactive approach in doing their own research to further their understanding of client material.

  • Ability to manage own projects fully, from organization of source material to origination and client approval of content for brochures, sell/tech sheets, animation concepts and scripts, websites, some advertising and direct communications.

  • The ability to take accurate briefs from an account manager or possibly directly from a client – interpreting needs, then communicating internally and working with the full project team, providing ideas and the written aspect of solutions. Understanding of client's subject matter and verbiage is important.

  • Diplomacy to complete marketing content with heavy internal feedback or client direction, absorbing this feedback into the project evolution.

  • Text drafts and ideas should be very organized and delivered in an applicable format (typically MS Word), with no spelling or grammatical mistakes. All documents must be professionally completed to a company template suitable for external distribution.

  • The ability to speak clearly and present ideas to a group in a focused, succinct and structured way. Style should be adapted so that the audience understands the issues being communicated.

  • The role will work with a team of account managers, researchers, designers and other roles. The successful candidate will be expected to integrate and compromise effectively on project development with the common goal of exceeding each client’s needs.

Work Environment

  • The Marketing Writer role is based at our office on Fifth Avenue, near Union Square in New York, NY.

  • This role is office-based, in an open space with other staff, visitors in and out and occasionally music playing, which creates a lively environment. The successful candidate must be comfortable that they can work effectively on content development in these circumstances.

  • The Marketing Writer will need to read, understand and follow standard office practices, procedures and policies.

  • That’s Nice LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Hours, Remuneration & Benefits

  • Basic hours of work are five days per week (Mon-Fri), 9am – 6.30pm, with 1 hour lunch. Additional hours may be necessary at times to complete projects under deadlines.

  • Nine public holiday days across the year are observed with office closure.

  • Bonus: Based on sales performance of content projects over the calendar year.

  • Benefits: Eligibility after 12 weeks probationary period (Aetna health plans, dental plans, vision plans, life insurance, disability plans, AD&D plans, commuter benefit options)

  • Vacation: 15 paid days annually, earned after 12 week probation (pro-rated to calendar year)

  • Sickness: 5 paid days annually, earned after 12 week probation (pro-rated to calendar year)

Job Description

How you'll make an impact
This role investigates, creates, and validates new scientific methodologies used to control raw materials, production intermediates, and final products on highly unique and complex projects. May be involved in pre-clinical, clinical, and/or post-marketing stages of drug development. Works on significant technical/scientific project activities to execute strategies and technical solutions that meet client needs and expectations through broad expertise. Participates in technical discussions with clients with a high level of technical proficiency. Engages in creation of processes and equipment design for clinical, scale up, and/or registration batches, including technology transfer of projects to and from clients. Evaluates and contributes to the design of manufacturing processes and supports problem solving as necessary with leadership and independent judgement. Typically works in a specific scientific area, such as analytical development, cell culture, purification, process validation, formulations, and/or manufacturing technical support. Makes decisions that frequently require developing new options to solve complex problems.

What will you do?

  • Interact with top company leaders to develop scientific strategy. Lead strategic initiatives and solutions. Work closely with site management to optimize requirements of both client and site for portfolio of projects.
  • Lead development and coordination of realistic proposals and timelines. Lead meetings/teleconferences with clients.
  • Lead development of methods and processes that meet or exceed the expectations from clients and provide innovation as necessary.
  • Lead research of industry practices and processes and apply to innovative drug development internally and for client products. Present recommendations internally and to clients.
  • Lead a team over multiple projects; manage team's project timelines and deliverables; may review group's financials.
  • Guide and advise during implementation of new methodologies and processes.
  • Lead resolution of problems related to the conduct of chemical experiments.
  • Liaise with internal scientific, analytical, and laboratory functional areas to meet project and team objectives.
  • Perform all duties in strict compliance with Standard Operating Procedures, Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Laboratory Practices and Safety guidelines. Maintains the necessary compliance status required by company and facility standards.



How will you get there?
Education:
Bachelor’s of Science in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, or related physical science. PhD preferred.

Experience:
Typically requires 12 years of progressive scientific experience, including 9 years in a related life sciences field. If related Master's degree, typically requires 10 years of related experience. If related PhD, typically requires 6 experience. Experience workng directly with clients.

Equivalency:
Equivalent combinations of education, training, and relevant work experience may be considered.

Competencies:
Advanced knowledge of principles, concepts, and practices of various aspects of a specific discipline and growing knowledge of principles and concepts in other relevant disciplines. Expert knowledge of scientific methodology and development as related to the pharmaceutical industry. Thorough knowledge of Good Manufacturing Practices. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Superior critical and logical thinking skills. Effective written, interpersonal, and presentation skills, including managing technical discussions with internal and external clients. Ability to lead multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to develop knowledge and skills in pharmaceutical processes, equipment, instrumentation, and procedures. Ability to maintain expert knowlddge and to keep current with scientific literature and industry trends relating to process technologies. Ability to develop technical solutions.
