Job Description

The Global Development Group (‘GDG’) at SK (affiliated to SK Group) is a U.S.-based global corporate development organization that provides strategy, advisory, execution, and integration management services to existing SK operating companies. GDG is responsible for supporting affiliated companies with new investment opportunities that foster group-wide inorganic growth and overseeing SK’s external affairs activities, including regulatory affairs, public policy, and PR/brand activities in the U.S. GDG’s corporate development activities encompass M&A, equity investment and strategic partnerships. Closely interacting with the senior leadership team in SK Group, GDG proposes a diverse set of investment theses on a regular basis that requires comprehensive research and in-depth analysis. GDG's research work will include market research (industry, company, and competitor analysis), which requires both qualitative and quantitative techniques to interpret the data, present the findings, and produce substantiated recommendations.

The Research Analyst ('RA') will principally be responsible for market research and data collection during the investment thesis building and due-diligence process. The RA will frequently be required to interpret various data, formulate professional reports, and make recommendations based upon the research findings. The RA must be a team player who can communicate well with her/his teammates, a multitasker who can prioritize things and meet deadlines while preparing multiple deliverables, and a self-starter who can work well without detailed supervision.


Qualifications

Responsibilities:

  • Research target industries & companies, and conduct in-depth analyses using traditional and advanced methods
  • Prepare market research and competitive intelligence to identify insights that drive key decisions across the organization
  • Assist peers in preparing a variety of documents and reports including memos/presentations in PowerPoint, Excel, and Word
  • Assist peers in financial analysis and company valuation, developing financial models using in-depth analytical techniques
  • Lead and support various ad-hoc analysis of operational and financial results, as needed, in support of GDG’s strategy

Required Skills:

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Exceptional written, oral, and presentation communication abilities
  • Proficiency in using the Internet and private & public database as a resource for finding information
  • Expertise in PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and other productivity-related applications
  • Ability to perform financial, statistical, and qualitative data analysis of markets

Other Preferred Status/Background:

  • Authorized to work in the US
  • Work experience of conducting extensive market research in consulting firms, investment banking, and corporations
  • MBA graduate or bachelors in business, marketing, finance, economics, or related field
  • Bilingual (English/Korean) communication skills (written/spoken) is a plus, but not a must

About Us

United Genetics Co. has been developing and selling various vegetable seed products since 1990. We specialize in processing tomato, fresh market tomato, melon, watermelon, squash, hot pepper, sweet pepper and cucumber. Throughout the years, United Genetics has successfully grown into a network of sister companies across the globe allowing us to expand our breeding programs to Turkey, Italy, Spain, Mexico, and India. We owe our fast growth and continued innovations to our highest valued products - our people. Our employees across all countries are committed to "New ideas for better seeds," ensuring our products' quality comes before profit, and being true to nature.

Our efforts to become a leading seed company continues to move forward with Kagome acquiring United Genetics Seed Co. in 2016. Our merger and acquisitions further expanded the United Genetics network and gives us a greater opportunity to better serve our customers to deliver the highest quality of seeds.

Position Details

To breed and develop innovative and competitive seeded and seedless watermelon hybrids for priority segments and global markets.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain a well-organized breeding program that provide a continuous competitive pipeline of hybrid watermelon products for priority markets in the USA and Internationally.
  • Implement an effective strategy for 2N and 4N inbred development and hybrid 2N seeded and 3N seedless performance.
  • Undertake evaluation and analysis of product performance in comparison to competitor varieties within the breeding stations and external trial sites. Travel to the locations of the trials for evaluation.
  • Maintain breeder seed of parent lines with maximum genetic trueness, seed quality and adequate inventory. Provide descriptions of parental lines and experimental hybrids, providing support to foundation seed, pre-commercial and production units.
  • Communicate and discuss various breeding strategies with other breeders to achieve breeding goals in the most effective manner.
  • Plan with station manager and other colleagues to achieve breeding tasks with greatest efficiency.
  • Make strategic breeding crosses to enhance germplasm, incorporating multiple key traits and novel traits into existing germplasm for population development, line enhancement or marker development.
  • Design and execute effective biotic and abiotic selection indices. Use of molecular markers to facilitate selection, as applicable. Use fields and greenhouses for other selection, trait and performance validation.
  • Plan and execute crossing blocks to make new hybrids with the combinations of grower and consumer traits to meet watermelon nutrition, production, and market criteria. Set up crossing blocks to maximize efficient use of space and labor considering plant culture, pollination, and seed harvest activities.
  • Perform other incidental and related duties as required and assigned.
  • Interact with product development, marketing and sales personnel, and major customers to evaluate and identify new commercial hybrids.
  • Stay current on new and emerging breeding technologies and genetic resources. Evaluate their relevance, and incorporate them into the breeding program if practical and feasible.

Position Dimensions and Qualifications

Internal Contacts:

Direct contact with Research Director, Breeding Coordinators, CEO, Vice President, all Plant Breeders, Station Manager, Plant Pathologist, Product Development, Sales, and Production, Greenhouse and Field staff and contract laborers

External Contacts:

Customers, Vendors, Industry professionals, Universities and Government institutions.

Educational Level and Focus:

MSc or PhD degree in horticultural science or agronomy with a specialization in applied plant genetics and/or 7-10 equivalent years of experience in plant breeding.

Skills and Abilities:

Interpersonal: Ability to motivate, develop, and coach people as they work, and identify the best persons for the job. Ability to articulate and share information with management and team members by telephone, in written form or in person. Ability to develop and sustain constructive, respectful and cooperative working relationships with others, being aware of different behavior styles that might impact effective working relationships. Ability to act professionally in holding others accountable to agreed upon responsibilities and tasks. Adept at time management of self and others.

Communication: Ability to verbally communicate information and ideas, providing clarity for others to understand, as well as, if in writing. Demonstrate patience and willingness to identify and understand the speech of another person, and be sensitive in cross-cultural communication. Be adept at listening and giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking for clarity as appropriate. Take initiative to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong, and participate in problem solving to the extent of your ability and scope of responsibility.

Technical and Analytical:

Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word; Excel; Outlook and Powerpoint) and plant breeding database applications. Highly skilled at observation, phenotyping and optimizing abiotic and biotic selection pressure, showing ability to adopt cellular and molecular tools to improve selection efficiency, heterosis and quality control. Adept at focusing attention to detail. Ability to balance goals within logistical and budgetary guidelines.

Administrative and Operations:

Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, vegetable farming and seed production methods. Ability to plan and execute to meet deadlines.

Physical Demands:

Participate in constructive feedback. Deal calmly and effectively in a seasonally demanding work environment. Working flexible hours or over-time on short notice may be required. Must be able to work in the office and fields/greenhouses under various ambient conditions, particularly reduced air-quality and in periods of high temperatures possible exceeding 100 degrees F. Must be physically fit to walk, bend, kneel, squat, bend your neck, and lift up to 50 lbs. Agro-industrial and lab chemicals are sustainably used on site in compliance and in accordance to regulations.

Travel:

Domestic and international travel is required, approximately 10% of the time.

Work Environment:

Office, outdoor and greenhouse work with seasonal temperatures close to 100 degrees, walk on uneven surface and within limits, be exposed to chemicals.

Special Equipment Used:

Using computers and computer systems (software) to set up functions, enter data, track or process information.

McKinley Advisors, a leading association consulting firm, has an immediate need for qualitative interviewers. Qualitative interviewers are independent contractors who are able to work, on average, 10 hours per week. McKinley implements a wide variety of project types including marketing research, marketing strategy, communications, branding, pricing, program and product development, market intelligence and analytics, strategic planning, and organizational development. The final product of McKinley qualitative research projects includes an analysis and summary, 5-8 pages in length, with detailed notes of interviews conducted to gather data.

To achieve the final product, the qualitative interviewer is responsible for:

  • Implementing the planning and scheduling of interview projects
  • Conducting telephone interviews with clients’ members (mostly during business hours)
  • Providing transcriptions of interviews and bullets on key findings
  • Summarizing and analyzing overall themes and audience-specific findings
  • Communicating with internal team to provide regular updates on progress of interviews, noticeable key themes, and timelines

In order to deliver a successful product, the qualitative interviewer should have the following:

  • Previous qualitative research experience
  • Superior verbal communication and listening skills
  • Flexible approach to the changing nature of work
  • Familiarity with trade/professional associations or societies
  • Advanced skills in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize information into written reports
  • Ability to handle multiple projects at a time
  • Creative problem solving abilities
  • Deadline driven and very strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and in teams
  • Professional demeanor and cooperative spirit
  • Ability to work offsite while proactively communicating with other project staff

Most work will be done virtually but there are times when meetings may take place in our DC office and candidates must have the flexibility to attend these occasional in-office meetings. As such, candidates located in the Maryland, Northern Virginia, and DC Metro area are preferred. In addition, most interviews take place during the day and candidates must have the flexibility to conduct interviews during normal business hours.

In order to apply for this independent, contracted role, email resume and examples of previous work to resumes@mckinley-advisors.com. Please include “Qualitative Interviewer Position” in the subject line.

For more information on McKinley Advisors, visit mckinley-advisors.com.

Management Structure and Reporting

Report directly to our Partnership Marketing Manager, Tad Dooling. You will work hand in hand with the rest of the wider PR team as well to grow your skills and be an involved member of the content department. Apply directly to tad.dooling@powerdigitalmarketinginc.com!

Serve as an account marketer to implement a marketing strategy for government defense accounts. Work with a range of business leaders and business development staff to help position the firm through marketing activities. Produce campaigns that are digital and non-digital with a digital first approach. Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.

We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

Are you curious by nature with a desire to understand the needs of others? Looking for a place where a dedicated team is committed to continuous learning and nurturing talent? We are seeking a Research and Insights Generalist to join a small team elevating the experience of our products through customer data. We make connections between various data sources, peeling the layers back to diagnose business opportunities and build internal equity as the subject matter experts of all customer experience data within the company. The ideal candidate will be naturally inquisitive, have strong project management skills, hands on research experience and demonstrate strong strategic and critical thinking skills.

Here’s what you can expect in this role in the coming year:

  • Use a mixed methods approach to qualitative research in order to identify customer needs; this can include interviews, observations, and open-ended responses such as reviews.
  • Lead in-depth interviews with customers and work with the team on documentation, note-taking, and transcription for these interviews.
  • Build and write reports of research finding for internal stakeholders.
  • Working across teams on management of Voice of the Customer (VOC) process to product documentation of key insights and determine areas for drill-down focus.
  • Program and lead online qualitative research studies using platforms such as Dscout and TryMyUI

There are many challenges and opportunities associated with our roadmap projects. You will continue to develop your professional skills working with a team that is deeply rooted in creating our customer-centric culture. We have a passionate group of stakeholders and we need equally passionate team members that are always looking to push for the best experiences for pets and their owners.

What you need:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology, Research, or related work field
  • Experience synthesizing qualitative consumer information from various sources into clear, actionable recommendations

AEG Worldwide is the world’s leading sports and live entertainment company with operations in the following business segments:

  • AEG Facilities, which with its affiliates owns, manages or consults with more than 120 venues
  • AEG Presents, which is one of the largest live music companies in the world dedicated to live contemporary music performances, including producing and promoting global and regional concert tours, music events and world-renowned festivals
  • AEG Sports, which is the world’s largest operator of sports franchises and high-profile sporting events
  • AEG Global Partnerships, which supports each of AEG’s divisions through worldwide sales and servicing of sponsorships including naming rights, premium seating and other strategic partnerships
  • AEG Real Estate, which develops major sports and entertainment districts worldwide

With offices on five continents, the company uses its global network of venues, portfolio of powerful sports and music brands, ticketing and content distribution platforms and its integrated entertainment districts to deliver the most creative and innovative live sports and entertainment experiences that inspire athletes, teams, artists and fans.

Position Summary:

The Manager Marketing is responsible for all marketing assets for shows on calendar. This position will work in conjunction with artist management, Radio/TV, and marketing team to create and develop an effective marketing plan that will reach the correct demographic and target customers appropriate for each show. The Marketing Manager will develop graphic content used to inform the general public of shows for the purpose of gaining ticket sales. This position will also be responsible for maintaining and tracking budgets to make sure funds are allocated correctly. The Marketing Manager will oversee social media accounts and ensure they are up to date with engaging material.

Essential Functions:

  • Responsible for development and execution of marketing and promotional plans. Collaborates with tour directors, talent buyers, and marketing director to plan and oversee the marketing spend. Develop and roll out long-term marketing initiatives with assistance of marketing team. Create and manage digital cross-promotional opportunities and partnerships.
  • Generate and adhere to marketing budget. Book and account for all advertising and media ensuring funds are allocated to correct partners. Prepare advertising settlements for each show.
  • Oversee, design, build and maintain social media presence, research current trends and apply current promotions. Run point for setting up account access with artists. Keep up with current social trends to insure social strategy remains current. Develop ad copy; implement ad schedules to appeal to a specific demographic and target customer.
  • Oversee and evaluate show performance market-by-market, making adjustments to meet marketing strategy in changing market or competitive conditions. Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals KPIs and ROIs. Manage Content Management System (CMS) which supports the management of content of web pages, DoubleClick by Google, etc.
  • Supervise publicity, advance press interviews, secure and coordinate artist availability for promotions with management, label and public relations agencies.
  • Collaborate with agencies and vendor partners like Ticketmaster and AXS on marketing opportunities for shows, emails, banners and promotions. Develop promotional, advertising partnerships with websites that can reach targeted demographics. Research new technological companies and develop personal relationships with them.
  • Develop and pitch promotions to media outlets. Contact radio and schedule radio time and set up giveaways. Negotiate rates and contracts with various media outlets. Buy ad space via the internet/aps (YouTube, Google, Yahoo, Pandora, Spotify, etc.) for shows, festivals, venue advertisements and tours.
  • Develop additional marketing opportunities to increase ticket sales when needed. Keep up with current marketing and social media trends to brainstorm new ideas and concepts for assets and promotions to market events.
  • Work with marketing team and artist management to strategize new ways to market shows and reach the correct audience. Create graphics for ecards, banners, posters, social media post, radio station needs and e-mails.
  • Recruit, interview, hire and train marketing staff. Offer guidance/mentorship regarding all show marketing needs, content asset creation, contesting and responding to customers and clients. Schedule and approve hours worked and time off requested for marketing staff.
  • Coordinate efforts with street the team to make sure they have materials needed and are marketing to the right audience. Oversee the hiring, training and delegating to department interns
  • May be responsible for other duties day of show including but not limited to overseeing house photographers, direct management of venue websites, live updates on social media day of show, escort media, coordinate meet and greets and guest list.

Required Qualifications:

  • A minimum education level of: Bachelor of Arts/Sciences Degree (4-year) in Marketing/ Business Communications or a related field

  • 5 years of related work experience

  • Exceptional written, verbal and listing communication skills with a can do attitude


  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to work in a fast paced environment.

  • Knowledge of social media and online marketing initiatives and strategies

  • Creative, detail-oriented person who can juggle multiple tasks

  • Computer savvy with knowledge of MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Google AdWords, Rubicon, CMS, Photoshop

    AEG reserves the right to change or modify the employee’s job description whether orally or in writing, at any time during the employment relationship. AEG may require an employee to perform duties outside his/her normal description.

The University of Florida Lastinger Center for Learning is currently accepting applications for a Research Scientist to serve as its Chief Operating Officer (COO), a member of the executive leadership team. In collaboration with the Lastinger Center Director, the COO will provide management oversight for the Center, insight into serving Public Administrators within education systems, and vision for the early learning portfolio. S/He will provide financial, contractual and client oversight, fundraise, develop strategic partnerships, and serve as an executive sponsor for early learning projects within the Lastinger Center for Learning. The work of the COO will support and align with the core mission and function of the Center, supporting the work of the Director. The COO will manage the client management and business services aspects of the Center and work closely with product management, content developers, implementation, marketing, and evaluation and research across the Center. In addition, the COO will serve as the executive sponsor on early learning contracts, providing substantive contributions and project oversight to these projects.

As the Public Administration principal, the COO will build effective partnerships at the state and national level with key industry partners as well as state and federal offices operating birth through secondary school programs. The COO will support the work of the Director as the early learning and federal resource as the Director assesses strategic initiatives and their alignment with the Center’s standards and objectives; identifies major changes in the education landscape; defines actionable courses (i.e., via public policy, research, business, or other industry impacts); and defines adjustments to the strategy, business lines and/or fund development plans as needed to support the organizational mission. The COO will support the work of the Chief Academic Officer, providing support to the content and implementation teams and the Chief Strategy Officer, providing support to the product management and research and design teams. The COO will also work with the Center’s Senior Advisor in Mathematics to ensure that its mathematics portfolio is strategically and sufficiently supported. The COO will work closely with the Director and be tasked to respond to the direction of the Director as needed on operational priorities of the Center.

Given the focus on Public Administration, this 12-month position will be affiliated with the School of Human Development and Organizational Studies in Education (HDOSE).

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Works in support of the Director and Advisory Board to develop and maintain the operational and early learning strategies and early learning portfolio for the organization.
  • Oversees the operations of the Center inclusive of client management and business services.
  • Facilitates the execution of the early learning strategy by working collaboratively with other executive team members and ensuring that the early learning strategy is communicated and easily understood by all throughout the organization. Ensures that strategic actions are completed at various levels to achieve desired results.
  • Ensures that appropriate metrics are in place to measure performance across all projects and progress toward early learning strategic goals.
  • Serves as a subject-matter expert in public administration and early learning, supporting the development, management, and implementation of Center initiatives, projects, and core business functions.
  • Provides leadership on the Center’s early learning agenda, supporting the CSO’s product management efforts and maintaining productive, positive relationships with key stakeholders as well as state and national experts who serve as resources. Supporting the CAO on content and implementation and the Director’s strategic and operational priorities.
  • Manages working relationships with the Center’s early learning consultant(s) and partners to deliver high quality services that are on budget and on deadline.
  • Engages external business and industry experts to learn and influence business strategies, remaining alert and forward-thinking about opportunities and risks.
  • Acts as lead staff liaison with operations offices and to the early learning community.
  • Maintains positive, close working relationships with key partners to advance system development initiatives and public policy that improves student success and alignment of education programs.
  • Builds new partnerships to expand awareness, increase engagement and support for the Center’s initiatives.
  • Monitors emerging needs and interests among key stakeholders, government, and philanthropy.
  • Represents the Center on relevant committees and task forces, as well as at speaking engagements, conference panels and trainings.
  • Manages and mentors staff to further develop capacity.

Company Overview

AllianceBernstein is a leading global investment management firm with approximately $600 billion in assets under management. We offer high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 3,500 investment professionals with expertise across asset classes, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.

AB is committed to be a responsible corporation and a responsible investor. Environmental, social and governance considerations, alongside issuer engagement, are integrated into our actively managed strategies. We also provide clients with a platform of Portfolios with Purpose that incorporate responsibility with their financial goals.

Responsibilities

The ESG Research Associate is a member of the Responsible Investment Team. The candidate will play an integral role in a variety of initiatives related to proxy voting, ESG research and integration, engagement with AllianceBernstein investment teams and company management, and developing policy.

Proxy voting is the sole focus of this role from March through June of each year (proxy season).

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Gain a thorough understanding of AB proxy voting policy and procedures.
  • Independently monitor the proxy meeting workflow and process vote decisions daily. Evaluate information provided and conduct additional research if needed.
  • Ensure all proxy voting is being done accurately and timely while identifying and managing risks.
  • Research, analyze and monitor ESG issues across portfolios for reporting to investment teams on material risks and opportunities, and in preparation for engagements.
  • Generate and prepare ESG and proxy reports as needed.
  • Develop a strong working knowledge of ESG tools and platforms in order to obtain, analyze and synthesize data for ESG research projects and deliverables.
  • Liaise with other professionals including the Head of Responsible Investment, CIOs/PMs, Analysts, Legal/Compliance, Sales/Marketing, and Investment Operations
  • Engage with issuers, fellow shareholders, proxy solicitors, and third-party interest groups on proxy issues and proposals.
  • Contribute to enhancing the firm’s approach and policies on proxy management and ESG.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree with at least two years’ industry related experience preferred such as finance and capital markets. Investment, research or legal experience a plus.
  • Critical thinker with the ability to assess large amounts of disparate information, apply our policies, and construct thoughtful recommendations and decisions.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Collaborative and team-oriented with strong interpersonal skills
  • Must be able to manage critical deadline driven workflow, particularly during the peak time of proxy season.
  • Strong competency in MS Office suite, especially Excel.

At dōTERRA we encourage all employees to seek out opportunities that will expand their skill set. We strive to help achieve personal career goals by providing opportunities of growth and movement throughout the company.

Job Description:

This is a technical position that reviews and evaluates scientific literatures and supports multiple departments/business units and national and international markets. The incumbent will create product supporting documentations that base on research findings, regulatory standards and guidance, and expert opinion. These activities will require the ability to identify and assess published information on dietary ingredients and plant oils, regulatory and safety reviews of dietary ingredients, analytical data, regulatory standards and guidance. The successful may contribute to product development ideation, the development of claim supporting study design and the preparation of publication draft.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Review scientific literature and maintain technical database to support R&D and other business units;
  • Develop/define dōTERRA product features and claims that are compliant with current scientific evidence, expert opinion and regulatory standards and guidance;
  • Create product supporting documentations related to technical background, safety and recommendation;
  • Perform reviews on marketing, educational and product identity materials;
  • Provide technical support to product development groups collecting, summarizing research findings, and proposing ideation;
  • Perform other responsibilities as directed

Basic Qualifications:

  • MSc or Bachelor’s degree in life sciences, chemistry, physiology or allied field;
  • Candidates must have experience in literature reviewing, developing study proposal, conducting bench work and collecting and analyzing data;
  • Ability to review, analyze and interpret study findings from various settings such as in vitro, animals and humans;
  • Ability to manage projects/tasks in a timely manner with minimal direction.
  • Ability to adapt change. Trainable, willing to learn, strong organizational and interpersonal skills and strong knowledge of MS Office and related products.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in study data collection, report and statistical analysis.
  • Strong personal interest in dietary supplements, essential oils and nutrition.

AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Injury Prevention and Control (NCIPC) located in Atlanta, GA. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
The incumbent will conduct studies of the behavioral aspects of public health issues and problems, and develop strategies to address those issues. Also they will apply professional knowledge of the behavioral sciences and related social and health sciences in the control and prevention of diseases.

DUTIES:
[
"As a Behavioral Scientist you will: Provide advice in dealings with the behavioral aspects of public health issues. Design, conduct, and lead studies to isolate and define the behavioral aspects contributing to public health issues and problems. Develop strategies to assess and monitor the behavioral component of public health issues, including surveillance strategies. Collaborate with other staff in the design of public health programs, to incorporate behavioral aspects in an integrated approach to disease or injury prevention. Evaluate the effectiveness of public health programs by measuring and assessing the extent of behavioral change." ]

REQUIREMENTS:
US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation is required. E-Verify: If you are selected for this position, the documentation that you present for purposes of completing the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 will be verified through the DHS "E-Verify" System. Federal law requires DHS to use the E-Verify System to verify employment eligibility of all new hires, and as a condition of continued employment obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is an E-Verify Participant. Direct Deposit: All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Recruitment Incentive may be authorized: No Annual Leave for non-federal service may be authorized: No Research position: No Promotion potential: Yes, This position has promotion potential to GS-13. Promotion to the next grade level is at management's discretion and is based on your meeting qualifications and time-in-grade requirements, demonstrated ability to perform the higher level duties, the continuing need for the higher level duties, and administrative approval. Promotion to the next grade level is not guaranteed and no promise of promotion is implied. Supervisory position: No Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. Current or Former Political Appointees: Agencies must seek prior approval from the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) before they can appoint a current or recent political appointee to a competitive or non-political excepted service position at any level under the provisions of title 5, United States Code. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, or Non-career SES employee in the executive branch, you MUST disclose that to the Human Resources Office. Failure to disclose this information could result in disciplinary action including removal from Federal Service. Current or Former Political Appointees: Submit SF-50. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
Basic Qualifications for GS-12/13:
I have a degree in behavioral or social science or related disciplines appropriate to the position; OR I have a combination of education and experience that provided me with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field; OR I have four years of appropriate experience that demonstrated that I have acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field. Minimum Qualifications for GS-12: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-11 in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in applying behavioral analysis of public health issues and formulation of policy or program development and evaluation.. Minimum Qualifications for GS-13: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-12 in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in designing, conducting, and leading studies of behavioral aspects contributing to public health issues and problems.

AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Emerging and Zoonotic Infectious Diseases (NCEZID), Multiple Locations.1 vacancy in Atlanta, GA and additional selections may be made in Fort Collins, CO, and San Juan, PR.
Salary may be adjusted to include a Cost of Living Allowance (COLA) of 3.29% for Puerto Rico. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
Perform senior level scientific work involving studies of the functions, environmental response, biological activities and/or processes of humans and animals and their component parts.

DUTIES:
[
"Provide expert scientific advice, consultation and leadership in designing, coordinating and maintaining scientific project goals, objectives and priorities.", "Design, oversee, and implement biological scientific surveys/studies or projects to identify and solve problems.", "Apply new methods, approaches, and technology to new and unusual situations and these methods have broad applications in the field.", "Collaborate with and provide scientific advice to all organizational levels within the agency, as well as with various state health agencies, and partner organizations, both nationally and internationally." ]

Applicants should describe any previous experience or responsibilities which could be used in relation to the supervisory requirements of this position. 5-Public Trust/Moderate Background Investigation (5) is required.

OR Combination of education and experience: Courses equivalent to a major, as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include designing, overseeing, implementing, and conducts biological scientific surveys/studies or projects to identify and solve problems.

Description

Under moderate supervision and with moderate latitude for independent judgment, support the operations of the department of Mathematics and Science by: coordinating and communicating with faculty involved in research; setting up and managing research operations; monitoring budgets related to research and centers/initiatives; and coordinating research-related events for the department.


Job Duties:

  • Coordinate daily office activities related to research, including but not limited to:
    • generating purchase orders
    • setting up and maintaining spreadsheets
    • processing reimbursements
    • initiating appropriate payroll/payment actions as directed (including stipends for research activities)
    • overseeing research expenditures
    • working with campus Budget Office and Dean’s Office to ensure appropriate documentation and tracking of expenditures
  • Oversee and maintain department budgets related to research, grant-funded projects, and departmental centers/initiatives; prepare annual and year-end or roll-over budgets.
  • Work in conjunction with the directors/coordinators of departmental centers/initiatives to establish organizational structures to support research projects
  • Set up departmental events (including workshops and department-sponsored conferences), including coordinating publicity, room scheduling, and reservations for outside speakers, refreshments, etc.
  • Research and book rooms and spaces throughout the institute.
  • Work with facilities and institutional management to access and manage project spaces and infrastructure needs.
  • Facilitate access and collaboration with intradepartmental and external collaborators.
  • Document and share departmental research projects by creating print, web, and social media content and interfacing with Pratt’s Office of Communications and Marketing.
  • Act as liaison to the Provost’s Office, Dean’s Office and other Institute offices and services, including communicating with the Dean and Associate Provost for Research and Strategic Partnerships about research-related activities.
  • Perform all other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferred.

Experience: At least 2 years’ related experience, preferably in an office environment in an academic setting.

Skills:

  • Thorough knowledge of word processing and spreadsheet applications required.
  • Knowledge of statistical data analysis a plus.
  • Communication design experience, including photography, copy writing, videography, social media, and graphic design a plus.

Other:

  • Must have excellent written and verbal communications skills as well as superior interpersonal and organizational skills and be able to juggle multiple tasks.

Summary

Conducts market, product, and competitor research to be used in the development of new products. Collects and analyzes market data and provides management with reports.


Description

  • 30% Manages multiple projects which involve coordination of benefit set up, eligibility feeds, process improvements, coordination of deadlines, launch tracking, etc. Responsible for third party monthly invoicing, tracking, and reporting.
  • 25% Conducts qualitative and quantitative market research relating to current and future products, customer satisfaction, marketing testing, and other measures to improve quality and sales within marketing. Researches and resolves member facing issues.
  • 20% Works with the product development process to include market surveillance, market testing, pricing strategy, naming selection, launch initiatives, quality control measures, and promotional initiatives. Reviews, maintains, and enhances quality of proposal text.
  • 15% Monitors market to recognize market trends, competitor strategies and outlook, unmet customer needs, and other issues that impact marketing. Reviews and analyzes product offerings, competition, gaps, market research objectives and projects in order to improve quality of portfolios. Researches and analyzes the value of BlueCross products and services and adjusts to keep in line with market.
  • 10% Presents account specific information to client. Provides promotional support and marketing materials. Provides training to accounts prior to launching new products.

Required Education:

  • Bachelor's degree Marketing, Business Administration, Statistics, or related field

Required Work Experience:

  • Four years marketing support and/or sales; 3 of the 4 in market research/data analysis.

Preferred Work Experience:

  • Product Development and Vendor Management experience
  • Telehealth/Virtual Health Technology/Virtual Care Delivery

Required Skills and Abilities:

  • Knowledge of the marketing principles, techniques, and the marketplace.
  • Good judgment skills.
  • Analytical or critical thinking and presentation skills needed to develop methodologies/processes in gathering/analyzing data.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in spelling, punctuation, and grammar skills.
  • Ability to persuade, negotiate, or influence others.
  • Ability to handle confidential or sensitive information with discretion.

Required Software and Other Tools:

  • Microsoft Office Suite including Excel

HCA TriStar Division
StoneCrest Medical Center
Marketing Manager

Are you looking for a company that places integrity over their bottom line? Here at HCA, our everyday decisions are founded on compassion. Apply today and join a team that is dedicated to serving others in need.

HCA’s TriStar Division is a leading healthcare provider supporting over 911,000 patients and over 730,000 emergency room visits annually in Middle Tennessee, Southern Kentucky, Chattanooga, Tennessee, Northwest Georgia and Northeast Atlanta.

The division operates 19 hospitals with 3,320 licensed beds and related care areas. HCA TriStar Division affiliated facilities offer residents and businesses the clinical excellence, innovation, convenience, comprehensive care and support services they deserve.

About our Facility:

TriStar StoneCrest proudly serves Rutherford County Tennessee and surrounding communities. Our 109-bed hospital offers complete medical care for adults and children, including emergency, surgical, maternity, imaging, cardiology, neurology, orthopaedic, physical medicine, sleep medicine and oncology services. Our medical staff of about 500 physicians includes more than 45 specialties. Many of our physicians have offices on or near the hospital campus. Our entire staff is committed to providing quality and safe patient care while offering compassion and comfort in our modern facility.

Job Summary: Develops and implements internal and external communication strategies/plans related to product lines, facility concerns and issues. Directs the marketing efforts of hospital. Responsible for budget development and reconciliation. Works with other departments as needed. Other projects as assigned by VP of Marketing and Facility CEO.

Major Responsibilities:
  • Plans and initiates an expanding, influential and significant Marketing/Advertising strategy as well as Public Relations program annually.
  • Develops and supervises implementation of marketing plans for product lines to include creative supervision, community education, screenings, collateral materials, etc.
  • Analyzes business growth related to marketing strategies. Accepts accountability for success/failure of strategies and adjusts plans as dictated by financial/market indicators.
  • Manages the production and distribution of internal communication pieces (employee newsletter, intranet, etc.).

Qualifications

Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in journalism, public relations, marketing, business, communications or a related field from an accredited college or university. Demonstrated leadership, management and communications skills. Ability to analyze market research data. Health care experience in marketing, strategic planning, public relations, research, sales, communication and interactive (internet/web) strategy necessary to understand and direct efforts.


What we offer:
  • Industry Leading Clinical Training and Professional Academy - Emerging Leaders
  • Tuition Reimbursement and Student Loan Forgiveness Programs
  • Generous PTO Plan
  • 401k (3%-9% match based on tenure)
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan
  • Full Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Financial Fitness Program with a Certified Financial Planner
  • Any many, many more!

Job Ad

Vans: Be a Part of the Original

“It was never about waving the brand like a flag, it was always about the people” – Paul Van Doren

Vans is the original action sports footwear company rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, Vans has thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through Vans’ four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the expressive creators within our company and community as they bring new and innovative perspectives to help shape and transform the future of our business.

At Vans our culture sets us apart and it influences everything we do. Everything we do supports creativity and we are driven by our five values.

1. We are determined .

2. We are connected to our consumers and to each other.

3. We are inclusive .

4. We are expressive and Fun .

5. And most of all, we are a family.

Vans is a subsidiary of VF, the world’s largest apparel and footwear company comprised of over 30 brands. We are the leading drivers of retail as our global footwear, apparel and accessory brand is available in 170 countries worldwide. As we continue to expand, we take great measures in developing and growing our people.

Vans is founded on a culture of learning. We take great pride in our ability to facilitate learning opportunities by providing the resources and tools necessary to support each individual’s pursuit of growth to achieve future goals. In order to prioritize career growth within our company, Vans offers courses on topics such as leadership, communication, collaboration and technical skills to ensure our employees are self-motivated and developing to the pace of our rapidly growing business.

By joining the Vans family, you will be immersed into an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work very hard across a multitude of large initiatives to bring the Van Doren spirit to life. We live for what we do.

Global Brand Marketing , Music Coordinator: Become the Newest Member of the Vans Family

Be a part of Vans’ legacy in music and creative culture. As the Music Coordinator in Global Brand Marketing, you will assist in the development and execution of the global music strategy. In this role, you will utilize marketing and music industry acumen to uplift Vans in the music space. You will assist the Global Music Marketing Manager in partnership with Global Brand Communications, Creative, Content, and regional Lifestyle Marketing teams at remaining on the forefront of artist relationships and industry trends while upholding the Van Doren spirit.

How You Will Make a Difference:

1. Assist the Music team in maintaining the master database

2. Research and report general music industry trends and competitor music initiatives, propose new and developing musicians and monitor upcoming music festivals, events, and performance charts

3. Partner closely with the Global Brand Communications team to help execute and log priority music seeding, and monitor and record ROI for all music product placements

4. Assist in coordinating branded playlists, developing their release schedule, and creating new content ideas for each respective streaming platform

5. Assist with all global music production and activations–––creating call sheets and social assets, coordinating performers’ seeding, fulfilling performance riders, and aligning messaging with regional counterparts

6. Track and manage all music expenses associated with production costs, performance fees, seeding and misc music costs

7. Coordinate and track vendor and artist payments

8. Develop event and campaign recaps to measure and track overall highlights

9. Compose monthly Vans global music activity reports

Skills for Success:

Years of Related Professional Experience: 3-5 years

Suggested Education and Expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Must have a minimum of 3-5 years’ general work experience in Marketing, Artist Relations, or Journalism within the Music industry

Role Description
----------------

Dropbox has over 500 million users worldwide, and the Lifecycle Marketing team builds email and notification programs to educate, engage, and retain these users at scale. We're looking for a Lifecycle Marketing Manager to build intelligent programs to help educate users about key Dropbox features and nurture them towards higher levels of engagement. You'll work with analytics and product teams to understand key moments in the user experience and build campaigns to address friction and reduce user churn. As the expert in this stage of the user lifecycle, you'll also be responsible for optimizing existing programs that are significant drivers of retention and user engagement here at Dropbox.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

  • Develop lifecycle marketing strategies for Basic users at key engagement and retention touchpoints
  • Build and execute campaigns across email, in-product messaging, and mobile
  • Work with growth and marketing analytics teams to measure our initiatives and maintain performance of large-scale, automated programs
  • Partner with user research, messaging, and growth product teams to ensure the creation of thoughtful user experiences across campaigns and in-product touchpoints
------------
Requirements
------------

  • 3+ years cross-channel CRM marketing (email, mobile, in-product) for large user or customer bases
  • AB testing or growth marketing savvy
  • Experience using CRM platforms like Responsys or Salesforce Marketing Cloud to build scaled, evergreen lifecycle programs
  • Analytical thinker with experience in tools like Google Analytics and/or SQL databases
------------------
Benefits and Perks
------------------

  • 100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
  • 401k + company match
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
  • Wellness Reimbursement
  • Generous vacation policy
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Volunteer time off
  • Company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Why should you considering joining us? Because Precision for Medicine, Oncology & Rare Disease is not your typical CRO. As a member of our thriving team, opportunities to work with leading subject matter experts who understand the rare disease patient mindset and experience will surround you. We help translate science into success for rare disease patients with a targeted, patient-centric approach over a wide geographic area. We are specialists who take on unusual problems in our detailed approach throughout every phase. From the beginning, we have nurtured a culture where patients’ needs and the needs of our valued clients come first. We focus in an environment where the quality of our work is the best, and where our employees can thrive, while still having fun and giving back to the patient community.

We welcome your voice and opinions and provide you with the ability to truly make an impact on drug development. Are you ready to be part of a close-knit clinical trial team that is passionate about saving the lives of patients every single day? Then look no further, we’d like to help you take your career to the next level. If the duties below sound like a fit, we’d love to hear from you!

Enough about us, let's hear more about you.

About you:
You don’t like to just sit back and have decisions made for you. You follow your instincts and actively make decisions that help move along to completion. You are an excellent communicator and want your voice to be heard in order to impact change. You aren’t afraid to take ownership of a project and look forward to seeing it thrive. You’re a teammate who doesn’t mind stepping outside of your job description to make sure our company and client goals are met and exceeded.

As the Manager, CRA Services, you will be responsible for the management and career development of our Clinical Research Associate (CRA) workforce. You will independently lead, manage and motivate a team of CRA's to a standard consistent with Precision for Medicine's values and overall focus on quality.

Be part of a team that allows you to thrive. Be an empowered employee and help make the changes you want to see for patient care.

What you can expect day to day:
Generate action plans and provide developmental/strategic oversight to optimize CRA services, with a focus on high quality delivery of individual/team/departmental goals
Assist with project resourcing to ensure proper level and allocation of resources for each project (with respect to project phase)
Develop, mentor, manage and coach CRA staff to progress their skills so that the organization's quality standards are maintained. Advocate individual career development, and individual responsibility/accountability
Perform accompanied site visits to assess CRA skills and developmental needs, as well as assist CRAs with project specific issues
Build effective development programs for clinical staff

Qualifications:
Minimum Required:
Graduate, postgraduate, 4-year college degree, or equivalent experience ideally in a scientific or healthcare discipline

Other required:
At least 7 years or more in clinical operations, data management or related discipline either in CRO or Pharmaceutical industry with a minimum of 5 years onsite monitoring experience
Monitoring experience includes use of electronic data capture systems as well as paper and electronic medical records
3-5 years of direct supervisory experience managing CRAs is expected for this position
Experience developing evaluation processes, performing gap analysis, and ensuring all clinical staff are properly trained to perform their duties consistent with Precision for Medicine quality standards
Ability to drive and availability for domestic and international travel including overnight stays, with an expectation of travel approximately 25%

Precision Medicine Group is an integrated team of experts in fields from advanced lab sciences to translational informatics, clinical trial delivery, and regulatory affairs, payer insights to marketing communications. Together, we help our pharmaceutical and life-sciences clients conquer product development and commercialization challenges in a rapidly evolving environment.

The Marketing Filmmaker is responsible for all aspects of filmmaking from pre to post production, primarily for marketing and promotion with some storytelling involved. He/She will develop ideas for projects, create/shoot new video footage, research and acquire existing video, and execute the editing process.

“We are innovators who make purpose-built gear for life's most demanding missions.”

Our ethos defines our culture – Trusted, Responsive, Accountable and Committed.

5.11 Tactical has established itself as the fastest-growing and most well-known brand of tactical apparel, gear and functional products in the world. Through a commitment to operator-led product innovation, quality and compelling value, 5.11 has developed a loyal following among some of the most demanding and discerning end-users of apparel and gear.

At our Operations Center in Manteca and Development Center in Irvine, we leverage our deep relationships with Law Enforcement, Special Forces Operators and First Responders to gain unique insights. The results are products that break new ground combining ruggedness, speed, range of motion and ultimate comfort in professional duty, tactical training, adventure, women’s tactical, fitness and industrial professionals.

POSITION SUMMARY:

We are looking for an Influencer Marketing Strategist to help build, grow, and manage our influencer program and ambassador relationships. This person will be responsible for the day to day management of all influencer partnerships across all tiers including; ambassadors, retail influencers, brand advocates and local experts. This person will execute influencer programs and campaigns that achieve brand marketing’s KPIs. The ideal candidate will have a broad understanding of the influencer marketing space, is an extremely effective communicator, and has a passion for networking and building relationships with other people.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage all influencer processes from start to finish, including recruiting, onboarding, content approval process and performance tracking, as well as, routinely analyzing internal processes to make the influencer program more efficient.
  • Maintain all influencer tools, documentation, and databases.
  • Assist in developing core KPIs and build reporting dashboards to track, optimize, and report on partnerships and campaign’s performance.
  • Research and collaborate with marketing team members and district/store managers to identify new ambassadors, influencers, local experts and retail influencers.
  • Assist in drafting all proposals, contracts, and additional forms as needed.
  • Coordinate, schedule, and assist with contract negotiations.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with influencers, as well as, manage the day to day communication.
  • Partner with content strategy, PR, media, and brand marketing teams to craft influencer marketing strategies and tactics that support brand marketing campaigns and product launches.
  • Maintain influencer marketing calendars in collaboration with brand marketing.
  • Identify relevant influencers for events, campaigns, giveaways, and other programs that maximize ROI and achieve campaigns KPIs.
  • Clearly communicates influencer calendar, campaign releases, and reports any changes to all stakeholders and marketing teams in a timely manner.
  • Work closely with social team to support growth of our own channels through influencer content, takeovers, contests, etc.
  • Monitor alerts and influencer streams for activities, overall sentiment, and potential brand damaging activities.
  • Keep abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and influencers strategies.
  • Book travel arrangements and accommodations, as well as, assist with expense reporting as needed.
  • Other duties may be assigned to accomplish company or department objectives.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in English, Communications, Public Relations, or Marketing.
  • 2-3 years’ experience preferred in influencer marketing and/or public relations roles.
  • Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills.
  • Strong time management, organizational skills and ability to coordinate multiple projects/activities.
  • Quantitative skills to analyze and assess the success of your influencer marketing efforts.
  • Experience working with various tech platforms and social listening tools.
  • Exceptional attention to detail.
  • Enjoys working with people.
  • Self-starter, highly collaborative, true team-player.
  • Ability to be flexible based upon evolving priorities and objectives.
  • Ability to travel weekends, evenings and overnights as needed, or requested.
  • Values the tactical lifestyle, an outdoor enthusiast, and/or is a person who pushes the limits of personal endurance and strength is a plus!

ETHOS:

At 5.11 Tactical, everyone has the opportunity to be a leader and perform in an exceptional manner. We strive to uphold our Ethos which defines our culture – Trusted, Responsive, Accountable and Committed.

  • Trusted
    • Strive to create trust in everything we do, starting with self-trust and relationship trust. We work on the components of integrity, intent, capability and results.
  • Responsive
    • Listen to the needs of our end-user Professionals, then develop, produce and deliver solutions to their problems. Each of us chooses to be a leader and takes charge of what is within our circle of influence.
  • Accountable
    • Seek to achieve results with a bias for action. We like to compete and be measured against the most demanding standards to ensure our continued success.
  • Committed
    • Overcome obstacles to accomplish our goals and support our team members when challenges arise. We complete commitments and seek to ‘over-deliver” relative to expectations.

5.11’s practice is to hire at 18 years of age and older only

Opportunity Overview

Is this you?
You've had a video game controller in hand since you could walk. You've witnessed the evolution of games from Mortal Kombat and Street Fighter, to Call of Duty and League of Legends and finally the epically popular Fortnite. You’ve played them all and could recite players, levels, challenges, strategies and even top streamers for almost every game like it's your home address. When someone asks, "what're you doing Friday?" You already know. It's an ELEAGUE night and the Rocket League world championship is on. What can you say? It's your passion. And each morning – sleep deprived from too much Twitch – you head to your boring job. BUT WHY? Why not combine your passion for esports and gaming with your job?

That's where we come in.

We're hiring for a Social Media Coordinator to join our Emmy award-winning Turner Sports Social Team, focused on the ELEAGUE property in Atlanta, Georgia. In this hourly role, you'll be the expert when it comes to the gaming community. You'll help plan and execute social media campaigns around on-going events and marketing objectives on platforms like Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and even Reddit and Discord. Familiar with Tiktok? Awesome. Let's build out that strategy and run with it. This is your opportunity to combine your years of social media experience with your passion and knowledge of gaming and esports.

The Daily
  • Assist with the day-to-day management of ELEAGUE social properties helping to develop social strategies, tactics and editorial calendars for short and long-term brand growth, taking into account platforms, content and competitive landscape.
  • Implement and monitor social platforms across shows and talent making sure goals are aligned, creative is engaging, messaging is consistent, content is strategically distributed and sponsorship requirements are met.
  • Make sure our social media copy is on-brand, consistent in terms of creativity, style, quality, and tone of voice; reviews and routes creative assets to appropriate stakeholders.
  • Manage relationship with the product team, producers, talent, internal/external stakeholders as gaming expert on the team
  • Work alongside the social media and product team to apply, research, and deliver emerging best practices across social platforms
  • Apply data and insights learnings to the content plan.

  • Something to note-Tournaments, matches and shows typically take place on the weekends and well into the early morning hours. You gotta be comfortable with spending your Friday nights plugged in with the ELEAGUE team covering live events. Don't worry, though, work/life balance is incredibly important to us and we're flexible when it comes to schedules.

Who You Are
  • You have EXPERT knowledge of multiple gaming titles, esports brands and the overall gaming community
  • You're no newbie when it comes to familiarity with the games on ELEAGUE
  • You have 1+ years of social media experience managing social content marketing campaigns
  • It's great if you have a Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Digital Media, Advertising, Marketing or related field
  • It's a plus if you've been known as the social media guru and know the ins and outs of all things FB, Insta, Twitter, TikTok etc., and what content does well on which platforms
  • You have amazing communication and copywriting skills and are able to sell an idea to both management and colleagues
  • It's a plus if you have experience with Photoshop, After Effects and Premiere
  • You've received accolades for how exceptional your project management, organizational and multi-tasking skills are
  • You are a self-starter and strong teammate who can work independently, collaboratively and responsibly.
  • You have solid judgment, problem solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills
  • You're a creative who rocks a positive attitude and has a high level of professionalism
*APPLICATION TIPS*
Your day job might be as a production assistant, accountant, writer, etc., but at night and on the weekends you're known as the EXPERT in gaming and esports brands. Think about how you can TAILOR your resume/cover letter to reflect that gaming knowledge. If you simply only reflect your non-relevant job experience, then we won't be able to see all your awesome experience when it comes to gaming. BE CREATIVE!

The Perks!
  • Full-time position (40+ hours/week)
  • Eligible for full benefits package (medical, vision, dental) + retirement benefits (401k matching!)
  • Fantastic paid time off package (includes vacation, sick and personal days, plus holidays)
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer
  • 2018 Best Company for Working Mothers AND Dads
  • An industry leading in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career
  • Working for incredible WarnerMedia brands like HBO, CNN, WB, TBS, TNT, Turner Sports, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim and more!

The Team
Content may be king, but the fan comes first. In this spirit, social media is woven into every aspect of content creation and distribution at Turner Sports. We want to be the leader of the industry in creating mobile-first, social-by-design content with the distribution strategy to match. Join us as we continue to build this groundbreaking team that’s committed to being first, being the best and driving real business results from our social media channels.

We Are WarnerMedia
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Position Description

Advertised Job Summary

The Coordinator of Marketing and Communication will report to the Assistant Director of New Student Orientation’s in regard to the internal and external marketing efforts of the Office of New Student Orientation. Duties include, but aren’t limited to graphic design, printing, creation of videos, photography, advertising, social media, special events, promotional items, merchandise orders, etc. This position is responsible for managing the planning, production, and delivery of assigned marketing and communications projects. The Coordinator supports marketing projects of the office by developing creative content, from concept to production, for logotypes, promotional items, advertisements, fliers, posters, brochures, booklets, and signage. In addition, the Coordinator will assist in communication efforts such as email campaigns and inquiries; social media campaigns, publications, and assisting with development and implementation of multimedia tools.

Minimum Qualifications (Classified and Unclassified positions)

Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of experience related to the development and dissemination of informational material.

Preferred Qualifications

  • A degree in visual arts, graphic design, marketing, public relations, advertising, or journalism is preferred.
  • Experience in and/or understanding of new student orientations is preferred.
  • Previous graphic design experience is highly desirable.
  • Previous marketing experience is highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated success and proficiency desired for various forms of social networking sites/media and other means of online communication is desired.
  • Desktop publishing, editing, and design experience using Mac platform is preferred.
  • Familiarity with AP style and Extensive knowledge of Adobe Creative suite is preferred.
  • Photography skills are a plus.
  • Knowledge of marketing strategies and tactics and familiarity with digital tactics such as key word placement, SEO , email marketing and web analytics.
  • Experience aligning multiple brand strategies and ideas as well as handling multiple projects by prioritizing and managing time effectively.
  • Ability to consistently meet tight deadlines.
  • Understanding of print and graphic design terminology as well as photojournalism.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Must possess keen knowledge of mass communication and graphic design principles, printing industry terminology, and copy editing style. Graphic design skills are critical in this role. Must handle multiple unrelated tasks simultaneously and prioritize projects in a fast paced

environment where both quality and delivery timing directly impact the success of the office’s events.

Must understand budgetary impact of design decisions and provide appropriate guidance during project production to maximize quality output solutions that are also cost effective.

Must be able to work independently, while also knowing when to seek guidance. Must be a self-starter and adaptive. Must demonstrate superior attention to detail. Must have a portfolio of work demonstrating graphic design and branding. Must be able to think strategically and gauge effects of actions/initiatives before implementation. Must be able to handle confidential or sensitive situations with poise and professionalism. Must relate well to people, have an engaging personality, and be able to speak with confidence before groups. Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Requires proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; InDesign; Photoshop; Illustrator and Dreamweaver. Must possess and maintain a positive, customer-friendly attitude. Must be able to cultivate and manage key relationships with internal and

external constituents and develop marketing projects collaboratively with key stakeholders.

Experience with online digital marketing tools like dashboards and constituent relationship management software is desired. Knowledge of emerging trends related to social media tools is desired.

Must represent the University effectively when counseling families. Must be able to interact with new students, and families with empathy, tact, and discretion. Must be able to speak and write clearly, professionally, and with confidence. Must possess excellent organizational skills and be able to handle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously. Must be able to operate a personal computer. Must be able to make public presentations to groups, counsel individuals, and maintain confidentiality of student credentials.
