Welcome To

Welcome to Lahey Hospital & Medical Center, part of Beth Israel Lahey Health. Lahey Hospital & Medical Center is a world-renowned tertiary medical center known for its innovative technology, pioneering medical treatment and leading-edge research. A teaching hospital of Tufts University School of Medicine, the hospital provides quality health care in virtually every specialty and subspecialty, from primary care to cancer diagnosis and treatment to kidney and liver transplantation. It is a national leader in a number of health care areas, including stroke, weight management and lung screenings, among many others. Lahey also helps to advance medicine through research and the education of tomorrow's health care leaders.

About the Job


Position Summary:

The Administration Fellowship prepares professionals to be leaders of tomorrow’s health care institutions. During this one-year fellowship, appointees develop skills which are fundamental to the operations of an academic and community-based medical center.

The program is based at Lahey Hospital and Medical Center, the tertiary center for the Lahey Health System. The group practice model of LHMC provides the fellow a unique learning opportunity in a dynamic healthcare market.

The program is a distinctive and unique learning opportunity. Through project-based and rotation based learning, guided by senior management, the fellow focuses on effective ways to bridge the worlds of medicine and administrative management. Fellows pursing administrative roles gain understanding of the clinical aspects of healthcare as well as the principles of management, operations and finance.

Under the mentorship of a senior administrator, the opportunities for study include:

  • Hands-on exposure to clinical work, including physician and nursing rounds, observing clinical procedures and quality rounds;
  • Experience in management, finance, operations, marketing and community relations;
  • Experience working within an integrated health care system of academic and community-based hospitals;
  • Participation in meetings of senior leaders and assignments to special projects under their guidance.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:

  • Take initiative in designing or implementing a project or assignments as needs arise during fellowship.

  • Attend all scheduled meetings (i.e board meetings, senior management team meetings, department, or medical staff meetings).

  • Provide professional, quality work.

  • Seek guidance when needed by Executive Sponsor or Program Director.

  • Comply with the policies and procedures of the organization.

  • Help coordinate the planning, recruiting, interviewing, hiring, and onboarding for the next fellow.

Organizational Requirements:

Maintain strict adherence to the Lahey Health Confidentiality policy.

Incorporate Lahey Health Standards of Behavior and Guiding Principles into daily activities.

Comply with all Lahey Health Policies.

Comply with behavioral expectations of the department and Lahey Health.

Maintain courteous and effective interactions with colleagues and patients.

Demonstrate an understanding of the job description, performance expectations, and competency assessment.

Demonstrate a commitment toward meeting and exceeding the needs of our customers and consistently adheres to Customer Service standards.

Participate in departmental and/or interdepartmental quality improvement activities.

Participate in and successfully completes Mandatory Education.

Perform all other duties as needed or directed to meet the needs of the department.

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Master’s degree required (MHA, MHP, MPH, MPP, or MBA).

Licensure, Certification, Registration: none

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities: none

Experience: none

About Us

Beth Israel Lahey Health is an integrated system providing patients with better care wherever they are. Care informed by world-class research and education. We are doctors and nurses, technicians and social workers, innovators and educators, and so many others. All with a shared vision for what healthcare can and should be. We are committed to attracting, developing and retaining top talent. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the communities in which we work and serve. With a team approach to care, we encourage learning and growth at all levels and offer competitive salaries and benefits.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

Overview

People who work for themselves fuel our economy. In the US, small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs. Often times the odds are stacked against them with 50% failing in the first 5 years.

Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) is devoted to creating solutions to meet the needs and improve the chances of success for these entrepreneurs with a portfolio of solutions ranging from mileage tracking to invoicing, payroll to accounting, payments and capital.

SBSEG is looking for a Director of Global Brand Development with a passion for content, strategy and innovation to help us revolutionize the world of work for our customers.

The Director of Global Brand Development will report to the Head of Global Marketing for SBSEG and is based in Mountain View, CA.

This leader will manage a large Global Brand Development team consisting of marketing professionals accountable for Global Brand Equity, Strategy and Performance, Integrated Marketing Communications, Global Branded Content (Social, SEO - QuickBooks Resource Center, Community, events) and Digital Experimentation. The team is mostly centered in Mountain View with a small presence in our key markets (UK, Canada & Australia).

Responsibilities

  • Lead work on our global brand evolution and strategy as we continue on our journey moving from an accounting software to a connected suite of business tools (applies to all markets where QuickBooks is present across the world from US to France, UK, Canada, Australia, Brazil, Mexico) to deliver growth.
  • You will be the thought leader on the positioning and brand strategy behind the extension of the QuickBooks brand into new segments and spaces.
  • Lead the US E2E Brand Campaigns from brief to execution across all of our business segments (amplified by heavy media support from the US market) to drive awareness and consideration of QuickBooks’ products and services.
  • Lead the relationship with our Agency of Record
  • Lead our global branded content from strategy to execution work inclusive of social, SEO articles, Community and more.
  • Serve as the thought leader on brand health across the world in collaboration with Market Research team.
  • Drive global media strategy partnering with our media agencies around the world.
  • Excite and inspire internal and external partners as we champion the brand together across all touchpoints and experiences.
  • Manage a high performing team empowering them to beat their best to drive excellent strategy to execution. Coach our all-stars on their personal and professional development growth areas.
  • Deliver on annual customer and revenue growth numbers.
  • Monitor business performance across communications and campaigns globally and triangulate these as well as media and brand strategy to brand health. Identify root causes for performance, recommend changes and adapt strategy and comms as needed.

Qualifications

  • 15+ years of marketing experience with an emphasis on brand development/management and global communications
  • Experience bringing large scale integrated campaigns to life and launching innovations through communications on paid and owned channels ( PR specific experience not required but a plus)
  • Experience crafting brand and content strategy to deliver rapid growth on expected results.
  • Proven success driving media strategy across the customer funnel for large scale brands or product lines especially across online media.
  • Data driven: understands and has experience leveraging data to create delightful end to end customer experiences that are aligned from communications to conversion and product.
  • Demonstrated exceptional leadership, management of large team, strategic thinking and communication skills.
  • Experience operating in a matrixed organization: demonstrated superb influencing skills and partnership with key internal and external stakeholder teams: senior leadership, country marketing teams, product marketers, marketing channel leaders, analytics, procurement, finance etc.

Position Summary

Note: Some changes were made to the position summary. As a result the review date has been extended to 12/19/2019.

The University of Arizona’s Department of Intercollegiate Athletics is seeking an experienced sports marketing professional for the position of Marketing and Fan Engagement Coordinator. This position will be responsible for serving as the marketing lead for Soccer, Softball, and Arizona KidCats.

The successful candidate must be team-oriented, highly motivated, a self-starter and organized. This is a full-time, annually appointed position, reporting to the Director of Marketing and Fan Engagement. Candidates should expect to work evenings, weekends and some holidays based on sport competition schedules.

The University’s strength in undergraduate education and scientific research is paralleled by its excellence on the playing fields, courts and other venues of its 21-sport Intercollegiate Athletic Program. The Arizona Wildcats compete in the tradition-rich Pac-12 Conference, “The Conference of Champions.” For a more comprehensive view of what makes working in our department unique, please visit our website at: www.arizonawildcats.com.

Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!

The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocations services, please click here.

The University of Arizona is in the process of creating a new classification and compensation architecture. This University Career Architecture Project (UCAP) will revolutionize the way we think about professions and manage compensation at the UA. It is a two-year initiative that will replace the current classified staff and appointed professional categories of employment with market-based job functions and families. As an applicant, UCAP will create clearer career paths and opportunities and will help you make more informed pay decisions. To learn more about this project, please visit ucap.arizona.edu.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Coordinate the implementation of digital marketing initiatives for the Department of Intercollegiate Athletics, including, but not limited to the following:
  • Serve as the marketing lead for the following UA Athletics sport programs: Soccer, Softball
  • Serve as lead for Arizona KidCats Club with a goal to increase memberships and revenue as well as retain current KidCats Club members
  • Develop and implement marketing plans for assigned sports; review and evaluate plans after each season
  • Maintain production schedule of promotional materials including posters, pocket schedules, digital ads and print ads for assigned sports
  • Assist with the development of digital strategies for assigned sports, including social media, e-mail and demand side platform
  • Work with ticket sales department to develop revenue and attendance generation strategies for assigned sports
  • Communicate regularly with head coach of assigned sports (or an appointed staff member such as a Director of Operations)
  • Responsible for communication pertinent marketing information internally to ICA staff.
  • Management of marketing budget for assigned sports
  • Assist with the day-to-day responsibilities related to the marketing internship program and SMA (Student Marketing Association)
  • Assist with the research, development, and execution of the football sales and marketing plan
  • Assist with game presentation for every home football game (responsibilities could include Fan Fiesta, KidCats Den, on-field promotions manager)
  • Assist with the planning and implementation of special event marketing, such as pep rallies, meet the team events and the Arizona Road Tour
  • Serve as lead on branding street banners on a year-to-year basis
  • Work evenings, weekends and some holidays based on sport competition schedules
  • Other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Two years of experience working in college athletics or professional sports marketing
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Experience and working knowledge of design programs and layout (i.e. Adobe Creative Suite)
  • Knowledge of and compliance with NCAA, Pac-12 Conference, and institutional rules that relate to this position
  • Personal computer proficiency in the following applications: Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions
  • Ability to multi-task with frequent interruptions
  • Dedication and motivation to initiate, lead and support value-added projects
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented, and has a positive demeanor
  • Demonstrated organizational skills, including the ability to plan, establish priorities and successfully manage multiple priority projects
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain positive interpersonal relations
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with individuals at all organizational levels, and project a positive, professional attitude
  • Must be available to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s Degree in Sports Administration or Business Administration/Marketing from accredited university

Mint House is a tech-enabled hotel company for high-end business travelers providing a unique experience that offers the feel of a high-end hotel, with all the comforts and conveniences of your own home – all packaged and delivered via technology. Overview

Solenis is a leading global producer of specialty chemicals for water-intensive industries, including the pulp, paper, oil and gas, chemical processing, mining, biorefining, power and municipal markets. The company’s product portfolio includes a broad array of process, functional and water treatment chemistries as well as state-of-the-art monitoring and control systems. These technologies are used by customers to improve operational efficiencies, enhance product quality, protect plant assets and minimize environmental impact. Headquartered in Wilmington, Delaware, the company has 41 manufacturing facilities strategically located around the globe and employs a team of approximately 5,200 professionals in 120 countries across five continents. For additional information about Solenis, please visit www.solenis.com |Twitter | LinkedIn.

Solenis is staffed with great minds and powered by ingenuity. When you join the Solenis team, you become part of a global community of 5,200 experts who work together to provide advanced process and water treatment solutions. Our team members take pride in their ability to think dynamically and help solve our customers’ unique challenges. If you’re interested in becoming a part of our elite team, please explore our current career opportunities.

Description

The Research Scientist uses water soluble polymer and industrial enzyme competencies to develop novel solutions for pulp and paper customer problems. Work may include development of enzyme formulations, dry strength, wet strength, and retention / drainage chemistries based upon water-soluble polymer technology.

Responsibilities:
  • Reviews patent and other literature in area of expertise.
  • Performs hazard reviews and maintains compliance with all lab safety requirements.
  • Plans, conducts, and analyzes data from laboratory experiments.
  • Documents and reports findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
  • Interacts with marketing, applications, and commercial teams to develop commercial evaluation plans.
  • Participates in commercial trials.
  • Works jointly with other team members and may direct the day-to-day activities of one or more technicians.

Qualifications

  • M.S. minimum, Ph.D. preferred with polymer and biochemistry academic focus including synthesis and characterization
  • 5-10 years industrial research experience - water-soluble polymers and enzymes
  • Pulp and paper applications background preferred
  • Thorough understanding of industrial application of enzymes.
  • Experience in polymer synthesis and characterization techniques
  • Ability to apply fundamental science to successfully develop new products and application technology in complex aqueous pulp and paper systems
  • MS Office tools
  • Statistical experimental design and data analysis

At Solenis, we understand that our greatest asset is our people. That is why we offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and numerous opportunities for professional growth and development. So, if you are interested in working for a world-class company and enjoy solving complex challenges, whether in the lab or the field, consider joining our team.

Solenis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer, including Minorities / Women/ Veterans / Disabled.

Solenis is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for providing scientific expertise to routine laboratory service clientele, contract research customers, and FSNS personnel. Has regular communication and interaction with each of these parties. Assists with evaluation of new or improved methods for analyzing food products and environmental samples for continual expansion and enhancement of laboratory service offerings. Carries out all aspects of contract research services including proposal generation, budgeting, coordinating, executing, reporting results, and billing of contract research projects. Provides on-site client assistance for troubleshooting purposes or contract research projects as needed.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintains a high degree of technical competence by reading scientific journals, attending professional workshops, and being aware of food industry regulations, issues, and trends.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) with evaluation of new or improved food and environmental testing methods to ensure that the most up-to-date technology is provided to clientele.
  • Travels to scientific meetings and industry trade shows to stay abreast of current scientific, industry, and regulatory trends and to interact with clientele.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) with preparation of technical writing pieces for periodicals and newsletters.
  • Prepares and delivers scientific and technical presentations.
  • Demonstrates excellent customer service skills and the ability to understand and resolve scientific issues, answer questions, and gain customer confidence for both routine laboratory services and contract research services.
  • Plans, proposes, and communicates with clients regarding contract research services.
  • Coordinates and executes contract research services.
  • Prepares and/or approves reports for said contract research services.
  • Prepares associated budgets for said contract research services.
  • Prepares billing for said contract research services.
  • Interacts directly with operational staff and clients to discuss food safety concerns, regulatory guidance, testing needs, and results.
  • Assists Chief Science Officer and Principal Scientist(s) to develop proficient and manageable programs for new contract research service business resulting in company growth and profitability, by assisting with development and improvement of marketing materials, client visits, and sales presentations.
  • Willing to support all other departments in the lab as needed based on business demands.
  • Travels for and assists with in-plant investigations and troubleshooting for FSNS clients.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ph.D. in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Chemistry, or related field preferred
  • Minimal educational requirement is M.S. in Food Science & Technology, Microbiology, Chemistry, or related field
  • Working knowledge of aseptic sampling technique, automated lab equipment, and acceptable methods and procedures
  • Familiarity with USDA MLG, FDA BAM, CMMEF, APHA, and AOAC methods and procedures
  • Broad knowledge of concepts, practices, and procedures of a food testing laboratory
  • Or equivalent combination of education and experience

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard and mouse and to handle other communications/computer components.
  • Potential exposure to odors, fumes, airborne particles, hazardous chemicals, and microbiological pathogens.
  • Noise level varies from quiet to loud.
  • Temperature varies from hot to cold.
  • Interactive and fast-paced team oriented tasks.
  • Overnight travel may be required at the discretion of management.
  • Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Merit Medical Systems, Inc., an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V is a dynamic, progressive and innovative company with a strong global presence. COMPANY HISTORY

Merit Medical Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ, MMSI) was founded in 1987 by Fred P. Lampropoulos. Merit develops, manufactures and markets single-use medical devices primarily for diagnosing and treating cardiovascular and vascular disease. Merit has been successful in introducing and marketing innovative, high-quality products through its expertise in new product design and its capabilities in injection and insert molding of plastics; the application of its proprietary electronic and sensor-based technologies; and wire, extrusion and catheter technologies. Merit also develops and markets embolotherapeutic products for the treatment of uterine fibroids, hypervascularized tumors, and arteriovenous malformations. Embolotherapy procedures are primarily performed by interventional radiologists and use bioengineered microspheres to create targeted vascular occlusion and drug delivery. The Company is utilizing its competitive advantages and technologies to develop and offer products that address a wide range of needs related to cardiology and radiology procedures performed in hospitals. Sales are made primarily to U.S. hospitals through a direct sales force. The Company markets its products in over 60 countries worldwide, utilizing a direct sales force in Europe, and distributors for the remainder of the world.

Overview

This seasoned specialist works as a part of a collaborative international team to contribute to advancing organizational knowledge and programmatic effectiveness. This specialist leads complex program effectiveness research studies to support Compassion's child development programs, leadership decision-making and marketing platforms. At this career level, the incumbent generally takes primary responsibility for running research studies or related projects across the globe, but also participates and takes initiative as an active team member for larger initiatives and team growth. He or she may coach and oversee the work of other program effectiveness research specialists.

Essential Job Functions

Responsibilities
  • Maintains a personal relationship with Jesus Christ. Is a consistent witness for Jesus Christ, maintains a courteous, Christ-like attitude in dealing with people within and outside of Compassion, and faithfully upholds Compassion’s ministry in prayer.
  • Acts as an advocate for children. Understands and advances Christ's mandate to protect children. Raises awareness of the needs of children and takes active steps to help protect against neglect, abuse, and exploitation of children. Promotes the dignity, respect, positive treatment, potential of children in all circumstances. Encourages the involvement of others in helping children in need. Reports and appropriately supports responses to incidents of harm of children if they occur.
  • Informs, plans and leads new and on-going advanced quantitative and qualitative research studies on a variety of topics as assigned, using appropriate and rigorous approaches to generate reliable, timely and meaningful information to stakeholders. Includes stakeholder engagement, development of research questions, literature reviews and country-level contextualization, sample and participant selection, quantitative methodology development, in-depth analysis using the necessary data analysis tools, report writing and presentation to multiple audiences and forums. Includes conducting studies that have previously been developed and taking initiative to suggest innovations for methods, questions, and data collection of these studies.
  • Draws on field exposure to advise program managers, field office staff, and leadership on relevant programmatic issues when requested and through contribution to and/or leadership of multi-departmental project, creative thinking and analysis teams.
  • Interfaces with other Compassion departments and individuals who collect information and data (e.g., marketing, auditing and quality assurance, business intelligence, and management) in order to minimize duplication of effort, build cooperation and support the growth of quality information gathering across the organization.
  • Presents research findings to small and large audiences in a consumable way for expert and lay stakeholders.
  • May coach and provide expertise to other professionals and support staff in the program effectiveness discipline.

Qualifications

Faith
  • Has a personal relationship with Jesus Christ.

Culture
  • Accountable for supporting, upholding, and engaging in Compassion's core "Cultural Behaviors" in all internal and external communication and relationships.

Education
  • Master's degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics or related discipline.

Work Experience
  • Three years experience working in a quantitative research position including the use of advanced statistics.

*** Equivalent education, training and/or certification may be substituted for experience and education shown above ***

Working Environment: Office – Standard Office Environment

Physical Demands: Sitting, standing, and/or walking for up to 8 hours per day

Travel Requirements: May be required to travel up to 25% of normal schedule

Research coordinator for the technical evaluation of new ingredient and formulation technologies (Grains, Fruit & Vegetable and Dairy).

  • Supports interaction and linkage to key Discovery programs across Beverage & Food categories to ensure program alignment and technology transfer to Regional teams.
  • Leverages external partners to source new ingredients and technologies. Assesses technology applicability in nutrition-based products and delivers proven solutions to product development teams.
  • Creates, oversees and executes research programs to deliver technical solutions to improve the flavor and compositional profile of nutrition-based products, leveraging strong expertise in food physical chemistry and food ingredient functionality.
  • Analyze experimental data, interpret results and communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Primary accountability focused on delivering flavor tools used in nutrient dense foods and beverages such as products with sugar reduction, sodium reduction, and/or high nutrient contents.
  • Leverages strong partnerships with external and internal experts (analytical, sensory, academia) to resolve key technical challenges
  • Performs basic economic evaluations on ingredients, ingredients suppliers, and product formulations to assess viability
  • Participate as an active member of cross-functional teams comprised of individuals from a variety of disciplines, including Regulatory, legal, Marketing, Purchasing, Engineering and other groups.

Qualifications/Requirements

Basic Skills & Qualifications required

  • BS Food Science & Technology / Food Chemistry or related field (MS / PhD preferred)
  • 3+ yrs of experience, preferably in the Food or Flavor Industry
  • Proven expertise in utilization of scientific method and critical thinking to drive robust research programs and deliver results
  • Understanding of product formulation and development, ingredient technology, food safety and quality systems.
  • Functional knowledge of analytical test methodologies and data interpretation
  • Proven ability to make significant technical scientific advances utilizing internal and/or external resources.
  • Demonstrated fundamental understanding of the incorporation of business need into technical programs
  • Detail-oriented individual with proven ability to independently lead multiple projects and work streams simultaneously, leveraging project management tools.
  • Self-starter with superior oral and written communication and presentation skills, the ability to work with various personalities and work styles, and proven influence management skills.
  • Strong personal leadership skills and the ability to work effectively in cross-functional and global teams.
  • Positive learner-highly creative individual with desire to gain and apply knowledge to new products.
  • Willingness to travel.

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable

About Civitas Learning:
Civitas Learning helps colleges and universities harness the power of their student data to improve student success outcomes. We embed actionable intelligence in workflow tools so higher education can focus their student success strategies, deliver proactive care, inspire holistic advising, and quickly measure what’s working for whom. With our platform, software and services, our customers empower leaders, advisors, faculty, & students to measurably improve enrollment, persistence, and graduation outcomes.

Today, we work with 375 colleges and universities, serving nearly 8 million students. Together with our growing community of customers, we are making the most of the world’s learning data to help graduate a million more students per year by 2025. For more information, visit: www.civitaslearning.com.

Civitas Learning is located in the heart of downtown Austin, directly across from Lady Bird Lake and the Austin Hike and Bike Trail. Civitas offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, disability insurance, onsite paid parking, 401-K Program and a flexible paid time off policy. Civitas Learning is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Job Description:

Job Description:

Manage and optimize Cobrand Card sales through clients’ digital channels including web, mobile, email, and organic search. This position will have two key responsibilities within the Cobrand Digital Sales Integration team: 1) support campaign marketing efforts for top Cobrand clients across digital channels to ensure flawless execution of digital offers and report out on performance. 2) team lead for third party digital marketing channels (social, search, display, affiliate, etc.). As lead, establish strategies, process steps and serve as consultant across Card LOB for third party digital marketing channel efforts. Knowledge of the various digital sales channels, especially third party paid advertising channels, is a critical component of this role to readily assert oneself as a subject matter expert with clients and lead discussions with ecommerce teams and vendors. Familiarity with credit card product sales and marketing, and in particular Cobrand Card sales is a plus, to identify opportunities while navigating the financial products risk framework.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support digital campaign marketing efforts for top Cobrand (Affinity) clients partnering with Digital Sales Integration, ACE (Affinity Campaign Execution team), Segment Marketing and Digital Sales and Digital Marketing teams
  • Oversee development and approval of digital marketing creative and campaign components
  • Ensure campaigns are tested before production and validated post production
  • Ensure all digital offers adhere to regulatory and compliance requirements
  • Report out on digital campaign performance
  • Partner with Clients’ and bank’s social and paid advertising teams to develop a cohesive online third party marketing strategy to drive channel growth while mitigating risk
  • Establish processes for approval and execution of third party digital marketing tactics
  • Monitor key channel performance indicators and portfolio metrics to identify opportunities to improve or expand
  • Influence the integration of Card product offers across clients’ digital channels
  • Develop and drive continuous improvements to the digital customer experience to improve sales conversions and customer satisfaction
  • Manage complex digital campaigns to time and to budget
  • Identify best demonstrated practices for digital Card sales and providing consulting and recommendations across clients
  • Influence the development of new digital capabilities, features and functionality to drive growth and enhancements
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and channels; providing thought leadership and perspective for adoption when appropriate

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years of card experience
  • Experience with paid digital advertising including search, social and display campaigns
  • Detail oriented and highly organized with a strong ability to quickly identify and resolve complex issues
  • Ability to establish relationships and work effectively across the company and with partners
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple efforts with varying deadlines effectively
  • Ability to effectively navigate and influence internal partners, client organizations and vendors
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to wide and varied audiences
  • Strong knowledge and experience with Excel and PowerPoint

Desired Skills:

  • Proven working experience with financial or travel product marketing
  • Card product experience, including Cobrand/Rewards industry acumen
  • Understanding of financial industry’s regulatory oversight and attention
  • Digitally curious with the appetite to research, recommend and help develop solutions
  • Understanding of Bank of America’s card marketing and governance provisioning processes
  • Deep and thorough understanding of success drivers of consumer credit card business

Shift:

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Why should you considering joining us? Because Precision for Medicine, Oncology & Rare Disease is not your typical CRO. As a member of our thriving team, opportunities to work with leading subject matter experts who understand the rare disease patient mindset and experience will surround you. We help translate science into success for rare disease patients with a targeted, patient-centric approach over a wide geographic area. We are specialists who take on unusual problems in our detailed approach throughout every phase. From the beginning, we have nurtured a culture where patients’ needs and the needs of our valued clients come first. We focus in an environment where the quality of our work is the best, and where our employees can thrive, while still having fun and giving back to the patient community.

We welcome your voice and opinions and provide you with the ability to truly make an impact on drug development. Are you ready to be part of a close-knit clinical trial team that is passionate about saving the lives of patients every single day? Then look no further, we’d like to help you take your career to the next level. If the duties below sound like a fit, we’d love to hear from you!

Enough about us, let's hear more about you.

About you:
You don’t like to just sit back and have decisions made for you. You follow your instincts and actively make decisions that help move along to completion. You are an excellent communicator and want your voice to be heard in order to impact change. You aren’t afraid to take ownership of a project and look forward to seeing it thrive. You’re a teammate who doesn’t mind stepping outside of your job description to make sure our company and client goals are met and exceeded.

As the Manager, CRA Services, you will be responsible for the management and career development of our Clinical Research Associate (CRA) workforce. You will independently lead, manage and motivate a team of CRA's to a standard consistent with Precision for Medicine's values and overall focus on quality.

Be part of a team that allows you to thrive. Be an empowered employee and help make the changes you want to see for patient care.

What you can expect day to day:
Generate action plans and provide developmental/strategic oversight to optimize CRA services, with a focus on high quality delivery of individual/team/departmental goals
Assist with project resourcing to ensure proper level and allocation of resources for each project (with respect to project phase)
Develop, mentor, manage and coach CRA staff to progress their skills so that the organization's quality standards are maintained. Advocate individual career development, and individual responsibility/accountability
Perform accompanied site visits to assess CRA skills and developmental needs, as well as assist CRAs with project specific issues
Build effective development programs for clinical staff

Qualifications:
Minimum Required:
Graduate, postgraduate, 4-year college degree, or equivalent experience ideally in a scientific or healthcare discipline

Other required:
At least 7 years or more in clinical operations, data management or related discipline either in CRO or Pharmaceutical industry with a minimum of 5 years onsite monitoring experience
Monitoring experience includes use of electronic data capture systems as well as paper and electronic medical records
3-5 years of direct supervisory experience managing CRAs is expected for this position
Experience developing evaluation processes, performing gap analysis, and ensuring all clinical staff are properly trained to perform their duties consistent with Precision for Medicine quality standards
Ability to drive and availability for domestic and international travel including overnight stays, with an expectation of travel approximately 25%

Precision Medicine Group is an integrated team of experts in fields from advanced lab sciences to translational informatics, clinical trial delivery, and regulatory affairs, payer insights to marketing communications. Together, we help our pharmaceutical and life-sciences clients conquer product development and commercialization challenges in a rapidly evolving environment.

What makes Microsoft a great place for marketers? We have amazing products used by billions of people. We have an incredible diversity of businesses. From incumbent brands to challenger brands, and from established markets to emerging markets, we have some of the strongest consumer and enterprise products and services in the world. With an unparalleled depth and breadth of career opportunity and the ability to make a worldwide impact, you can design a career path that is hard to match anywhere. In addition, Microsoft regularly evaluates and evolves the marketing discipline to ensure these roles are designed to increase Microsoft's marketing impact and efficiency while helping our marketing professionals build expertise.

Do you want to work on a meaningful and impactful project and make a difference? Are you willing to learn from others and open to new ideas? Do you want to support others to succeed and operate in a highly-collaborative and global environment? If this sounds like you, Microsoft would like to invite you to come join us as you are, where you can find more than just a job. Read on to learn more about opportunities and apply online!

Applications to these opportunities are considered for all available Marketing MBA roles including the ones described below. To be considered as a student or recent graduate, you should be within 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 6 months.

Marketing Communications Manager


You always have the big picture in mind. You are adept at working with team members across business groups and agencies to deliver a global integrated marketing communication plan.
The Marketing Communication Manager embraces our company’s Marketing principles, is a Microsoft Brand Steward, and drives ongoing improvements in maximizing marketing spend and driving marketing efficiency, and marketing impact.

Partner/Channel Marketing Manager


As a Partner/Channel Marketing Manager you will shape the strategy and manage the execution of programs that drive partner profitability. Partner profitability programs accelerate partner cloud practice development by helping the partners build business plans, develop cloud offers, create go-to-market channels, form new business opportunities, increase partner satisfaction, and strengthen partner loyalty.

Product Marketing Manager


You are the key to global marketing. You determine marketing strategy for your area and communicate through marketing plans, product content, and internal and external evangelism.
The Product Marketing Manager understands, orchestrates, and influences campaigns and marketing activities, develops integrated marketing campaigns, and delivers product, solutions and customer campaign feedback to the business. An essential aspect of the role of the Product Marketing Manager is to align the content, timing and delivery of marketing messages and outreach to Microsoft’s customers and partners.

Responsibilities

Marketing Communications Manager


As a marketing communications manager, you will manage annual marketing communications priorities and success metrics. You will direct priorities for events and media, public and analyst relations. You will oversee production and deployment of advertising and drive the strategy and execution of digital and social media. You will determine the optimal mix of engagement vehicles for your product, service, or geography. You'll need to be a strategic thinker to ensure execution, risks, and global alignment are optimal.

Partner/Channel Marketing Manager


This role bridges internal and external stakeholders to develop and drive channel marketing plans. You will engage directly with partners to drive execution, hold partners accountable for meeting business results, and adapt plans and investments accordingly.
You own the partner ecosystem and channel strategy. We need creative, analytical, and broad thinkers who collaboratively engage with partners to identify and achieve mutually beneficial results. As needed, you will incubate new partner models and deliver a partner gap analysis. You own the partner campaign, program activity delivery, and sales pipeline support.

Product Marketing Manager


You play a role throughout the marketing cycle: from positioning, messaging and storytelling to determining and orchestrating global launch plans and identifying market research needs. You also own monitoring our competition and building competitive positioning and response plans.

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in an MBA Degree program within 12 months of graduation or graduated within the last 6 months.
  • Inspired by the continually evolving craft of marketing.
  • Proven aptitude for seeking creative solutions to multi-faceted problems.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Thrive and deliver results in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment.
  • Ability to influence, inspire, and lead from any role.

As a Clinical Research Associate (CRA) at Stryker, you will assist the Clinical Study Manager (CSM) or Clinical Project Manager (CPM) in the development and implementation of clinical studies, including Investigational Device Exemption, post-approval, post-market surveillance, feasibility and/or marketing studies. The CRA is also responsible for ensuring operational aspects of the studies such as documentation, payments and other systems are being conducted in accordance with GCPs, Food and Drug Administration regulations and department Standard Operational Procedures .

  • Support CSM/CPM in development and maintenance of study records
  • Perform center activation tracking ensuring receipt of proper study documentation
  • Support CSM/CPM in preparation and maintenance of patient recruitment and retention strategies
  • Actively participate in the design, development, and testing of the Case Report Forms (CRFs) and database.
  • Support clinical team on study management and reporting
  • Prepare monitoring visit materials
  • Prepare training materials for clinical studies
  • Assist the CSM/CPM with scheduling site visits and training of site personnel
  • Perform investigational device tracking process
  • Coordinate pre and post-monitoring activities for monitors
  • Review monitoring visit reports and follow up on observations
  • Perform monitoring and co-monitoring as required
  • Review completed CRFs for consistency and produce queries to site for corrections
  • Review adverse events forms and report observations to CSM/CPM
  • Assist CSM/CPM with periodic mailings to sites for data issues and study communication
  • Assist CSM/CPM on study development and management activities for assigned studies and/or develop and manage assigned studies
  • Assists CSM/CPM with study closure activities
  • Assist CSM/CPM with and/or manage facilitation of publishing study results in peer reviewed journals
  • May identify and support research sites within the region
  • Serve as liaison between clinical personnel, site personnel, and Stryker field personnel
  • Process and track Investigator payments and patient reimbursements
  • Set up filing, documentation management and tracking systems

What you need

  • Bachelor's degree; Health science or technical discipline preferred
  • 1 or more years of experience with clinical study administration or related experience
  • Basic knowledge and experience with Clinical Research either from an investigative site, Institutional Review Board (IRB), or sponsor
  • Working knowledge of Good Clinical Practices (GCPs)
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication, organization, and planning skills
  • Team based work experience preferred
  • Working knowledge of personal computer systems and desktop office applications

Work From Home: Not available

Travel Percentage: 10%

REHAU is the premium worldwide brand for polymer-based innovations and systems in construction, automotive and industry. You encounter our systems every day, without noticing them. The Furniture Solutions Summer Intern would put their video production into practice coordinating B2B and B2C video projects for the Kitchen and Bath industry to target both manufacturers of kitchens as well as the end consumer (home owner) for an existing portfolio of products. The ideal candidate will be able to execute from concept to full production, the responsibilities would include storyboard, scope, script writing, shooting and editing.

  • Analyze market trends and report findings to evaluate best video solution

Editorial Assistant – Riverhead Books


Penguin Random House is seeking an Editorial Assistant to provide editorial and administrative support to the Riverhead Books imprint. The Assistant will report to two executive editors, working closely with them on a range of literary fiction and nonfiction.


Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

  • Helps editors track and evaluate submissions; writes reader’s reports and rejection letters; researches competitive titles and creates basic P&Ls on prospective titles.
  • Reads projects under contract and provides editorial feedback to editors upon request.
  • Helps shepherd projects and authors through the publication process, from acquisition to finished book, ensuring that authors and others have and provide needed materials in timely fashion.
  • Drafts copy and information about titles for a variety of in-house and consumer-facing use; monitors and updates key information and metadata.
  • Works closely with other departments (marketing, publicity, rights, sales) to provide needed materials and other assistance.
  • Assists editors with mailings, expense reports, and other administrative tasks.


Essential Qualifications/Requirements:

    • Prior office experience or related internship preferred
    • Excellent organizational skills
    • Strong communication skills
    • Strong writing skills
    • Ability to think analytically
    • Ability to multi-task
    • Attentive to detail
    • Strong follow-up skills
    • Strong PC skills (Microsoft Word and Excel)
    • Knowledge of social media
    • Interest in and enthusiasm for book publishing, particularly adult nonfiction publishing


Salary for this position is $40,000. Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Please apply using our online application process.

  • Works alongside the Market Intelligence Analyst to perform research to provide insights in regards the market, trends, competitors, potential and customers and compares it to Rieke’s current & future portfolio.

  • Assists in securing and analyzing comprehensive market intelligence data from both internal and external data sources. Provides such information to the Market Segment Management team (plus Global Marketing Director) as a key input into the marketing portfolio planning process.

  • Coordinates the distribution of internal and external marketing literature, training, product knowledge, customer intelligence data.

  • Ensure that all relevant market information is conveyed to the global sales and customer care teams to enable them to be more effective in their roles.

The Research and Innovation Marketing and Communications Specialist is responsible for strategic outreach, marketing, and communications for the division of Research and Innovation. The specialist develops and executes comprehensive and integrated communications and marketing plans leveraging multi-communication channels (traditional and online) including branding strategy, public relations plans, stories, news releases and promotional materials such as but not limited to brochures, fact sheets, and newsletters – with meta goal of advancing the impact and outreach of the research, innovation and entrepreneurship activities of SJSU. The specialist manages all digital/online presence for the Division of Research and Innovation such as but not limited to websites and social media channels. The specialist creates, analyzes and recommends marketing and communication strategies based on metrics established and analyses, and return on investment reporting as well as scorecards. The specialist collaborates and partners with Strategic Communications and Marketing team, division of Research and Innovation, and other communications/marketing leads in other areas of the university.

You are: a marketing whiz - an expert in Google Ads, paid search and SEO and also a skilled media strategist that is always searching for the next marketing innovation and not afraid to negotiate. You pride yourself in being an early adopter of new media and technologies and you're comfortable working across multiple projects at the same time. You're ready to grow in a role that will challenge you intellectually and leverage your skills in project management and your entrepreneurial spirit. We are: the School of Professional Studies at top-ranked Northwestern University. We are changing the face of higher education through our dedication to leverage the most innovative technology to support the needs of working professionals that are seeking to grow their careers, enhance their skills and take on new educational and professional challenges.

As a Marketing Planning Strategist at the School of Professional Studies, you will drive the marketing strategies for several programs across the SPS portfolio; responsible for the development, implementation, optimization, and ongoing management of marketing campaigns for several programs across the School of Professional Studies portfolio. You will be part of a team of marketing strategists, each of whom is the strategic cross functional marketing lead across marketing, creative, advising and product development (academic) teams for your program portfolio.

Our team is located on the downtown Chicago campus of Northwestern University, next door to both Northwestern Law and Northwestern Feinberg School of Medicine. We are right off of Michigan Avenue, in an exciting and supportive office environment. In addition to joining a collaborative team that values personal growth and team collaboration, Northwestern University employees take advantage of excellent healthcare, education, and retirement benefits, as well as generous paid time off and great views of Lake Michigan.

Specific Responsibilities:

Assume primary responsibility for planning strategic marketing plans for SPS graduate, undergraduate and certificate programs in the offline and online environments:

  • Develops strategic marketing plans, with a focus on integrating digital media with traditional media (e.g. online and offline efforts), to launch and grow SPS programs using marketing data and research
  • Develops a strong understanding of his/her assigned programs in order to inform effective marketing plan development
  • Translates marketing plans for all programs into media schedule including, but not limited to, digital, print, broadcast, outdoor, sponsorship, events, email and direct mail
  • Researches new audiences and media channels, bringing creativity and innovation to marketing plans
  • Monitors the competitive landscape and stays current with marketing trends, testing new approaches and adopting best-practice strategies
  • Communicates requirements and audience elements to email and direct mail list vendor and evaluates and purchases suggested lists
  • Manages lists, ensures accuracy with order or mailing, and prepares lists and mailing instructions for email partner or mail house
  • Liaisons with mail house to ensure timely and cost-effective fulfillment of all promotional and communication direct mailings
  • Ensures clear, accurate communication of marketing plans in visual and written formats
  • Supports Assistant Director of Marketing and Communications in marketing for school—ensures that plans are coordinated and advertisements are optimized
  • Meets regularly with Assistant Director of Marketing and Communications to present and discuss campaign performance—implements enhancements/corrections

Media Negotiation and Execution:

  • Independently negotiates and executes media buys vendors; manages day-to-day media spending as defined by marketing plan budget
  • Works with manager on negotiating annual contracts with high-volume vendors
  • Reconciles incoming invoices with services contracted/delivered and follows-up on discrepancies
  • Ensures make-good and future deliverable for unfilled contracts
  • Resolves major problems or inconsistencies and reports to manager

Performance Analysis and Measurement:

  • Reviews CRM performance analytics through internal CRM system to make strategic media decisions and optimizations
  • Monitors campaigns on a daily basis ensuring fulfillment of services and making adjustments as necessary
  • Reviews campaign performance analytics (lead source, web traffic, campaign reports, et. al.) and tweaks online campaigns and email communications based on analytics
  • Continually evaluates channels and lists to ensure reach of defined audience; ensures marketing investment is producing satisfactory return

Cross-functional leadership in developing program knowledge and in the execution of marketing plans:

  • Liaisons with academic departments to stay informed of program updates, conference participation for marketing support and develop ongoing knowledge of programs and evolving target audiences
  • Integrates closely with Creative/Content team, Digital Marketing Strategist, Enrollment Advising teams, CRM team, and event coordinator(s)

Professional Awareness and Engagement:

  • Represent SPS and enrollment management at select state, regional and national meetings, conferences and programs as budget allows.
  • Provide model leadership, participation, guidance and information when serving on university-wide and School academic and operational committees

Miscellaneous

  • Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
  • 2-3 years experience media planning

Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.)

  • Demonstrated capacity for developing and executing marketing plans
  • Basic accounting skills, attention to detail and ability to maintain and reconcile a budget
  • Ability to evaluate media outlets
  • Experience with digital media, SEO and paid search
  • Intermediate-level skills with Microsoft Excel
  • Solid writing and editing skills
  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong quantitative and qualitative research skills
  • Ability to multi-task at a high level in fast-paced environment
  • Strong relationship-building and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Strong follow-up skills
  • Strong negotiating skills
  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
  • Collaborating with agency teams and clients, the strategist is forward-thinking and considers the big picture and minute details and how they all coalesce to build brand image and perception

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in marketing or related field
  • 3+ years of work experience in marketing, with digital marketing expertise
  • Previous experience marketing to adult learners
  • Experience working with lead generation and lead cultivation

Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities)

  • Excellent oral communication skills
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Research and market analysis skills
  • Proficient in current technology including email formats and tracking, landing page creation and use, search engine optimization, pay-per-click and other digital marketing options
  • Strong aptitude for determining the optimal way to position programs in the market
  • Experience determining and demonstrating ROI from marketing programs
  • Demonstrated understanding of the big picture and goals of enrollment management

We are hiring a Research Associate to join our Home and Personal Care Applications team. Successful candidates will work in our Palo Alto laboratories to design, develop, and deploy DuPont Nutrition and Biosciences’ Home and Personal Care products.

THE ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

Your key responsibilities:

  • Utilize Biology/Biochemistry/Biotechnology/Chemistry expertise to support existing applications (Technical Service) within the Nutrition and Biosciences Home and Personal Care Business Unit and to develop new applications using commercially (or near commercially) available products.
  • Generate technical data and provide bioanalytical and applications support for customers as required by the Home and Personal Care sales team.
  • Understand experimental objectives, develop an effective work plan to accomplish those objectives, execute the experimental work plan, analyze the experimental results, and effectively communicate those results to team members, management and/or customers.
  • The technical work will also be the basis for new intellectual property filings, peer reviewed journal articles and commercialization data packages.
  • Interface with the Home and Personal Care sales team and their customers worldwide and deliver presentations for internal and external customers at scientific and marketing conventions.
  • Self-starter, driving interactions across technical, sales and marketing functions.
  • Interface with other Applications Technical Personnel, R&D technical staff and Nutrition and Biosciences management in the Americas region.

Job Qualifications

Your qualification profile:

  • B.S. in Biology, Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Biochemical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry.
  • Job requires some travel (10%).
  • Experience with a wide range of bio-analytical equipment and biochemical assays.
  • Knowledge of proper experimental design and data analysis.
  • Demonstrated presentation skills and technical writing capabilities.
  • Strong modern analytical skills preferentially with experience in the analyses of detergent components is a strong plus.
  • The successful candidate must be motivated, creative, have strong problem solving and critical thinking skills, and be capable of working independently or in a collaborative setting.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the desire and ability to work within a multidisciplinary team are also required.

Location: Washington D.C. (Arlington), San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boston, Atlanta or Philadelphia

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With 469,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

People in the Corporate Function career track contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.

Job Description:

The candidate for this role of Talent Research Specialist – to be based in (San Francisco, New York, Chicago, Boston, Metro DC, Atlanta, or Philadelphia) should exemplify a deep understanding of and interest in the talent space and the impact HR and organizational design has on companies across multiple industries with a focus on emerging future of work research topics. Candidates coming from academia will be considered a plus.


The Talent Research Specialist would help design and execute research projects working with others across Accenture Research, even outside North America, and clients. The candidate would also influence key internal stakeholders and decision-makers by providing actionable insights related to our talent research agenda.


Accenture Research and the leadership of the Talent & Organization Practice have been working closely together to design and execute a world-class research agenda to help C-suite executives make better talent decisions while also positioning Accenture as an undisputed thought-leader on talent topics.


Specifically, the Talent Research Specialist will:

  • Collaborate in raising awareness and understanding of talent-related research tools, surveys, and outputs in Accenture and Accenture Research and continuously interact and collaborate with Accenture and external experts on the topic of talent.

  • Look to share knowledge and thought leadership on the topic across the global research team and with counterparts in marketing and with the Innovation Architecture as Accenture (e.g. organizing learning activities and create x-pollination opportunities).

  • Partner with members of the Talent and Organization Practice to understand the pipeline of research needs, ensure the appropriate resources from the research team are focused on priority projects, manage the pipeline, taking responsibility any resourcing issues, ensuring quality and seamless communications throughout

  • Seek out opportunities to constantly innovate, create and invent new ways to enhance what research brings to the Innovation Hubs and to apply the best, most unique advances in research.

  • To integrate value-adding research skills related to Design Thinking to most effectively co-create with clients and other partners of the Innovation Architecture (see a description of Accenture’s Innovation Architecture as listed below)

  • Serve as an ambassador and advocate for research at the Hub internally and externally, including the appropriate use of social media

About Accenture Research

Accenture Research shapes trends and creates data-driven insights about the most pressing issues global organizations face. Combining the influence of innovative research techniques with a deep understanding of our clients’ industries, our team of 300 researchers and analysts – including more than 50 in North America alone - spans 20 countries and publishes hundreds of reports, articles and points of view every year. Our thought-provoking research – supported by proprietary data and partnerships with leading organizations such as MIT and Singularity – guides our innovation and allows us to transform theories and fresh ideas into real-world solutions for our clients. Visit us at www.accenture.com/research and follow us on https://twitter.com/AccentureRSRCH

About Accenture’s Innovation Architecture

Accenture is always looking ahead to anticipate what’s next. The Accenture Innovation Architecture uses and innovation-lead approach to help our clients develop and deliver disruptive innovations and to scale them faster. From research, ventures and labs to studios, innovation centers and delivery centers, we help companies imagine the potential of the future and bring it to reality. To find out more about the partners of the Innovation Architecture, please visit: www.accenture.com/us-en/innovation-architecture


Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum of 2 or more years of work experience
Preferred Qualification:
  • Post-graduate degree, with solid evidence of research experience. Knowledge of talent, leadership and organizational psychology & behavior areas would be considered a significant advantage, especially in terms of executed related primary and/or secondary research in that regard.
  • Any additional certificates related to people analytics or data science would be a plus but not required.
  • Experience with data science and visualization and design thinking as well as public speaking
    • Worked with a start-up, global / large private corporation or institution, research think tank or recognized research provider or design company
    • Presented to senior stakeholders

Passionate about a career in Marketing with ambitions of leading a growing global business? Join us as a Pioneer to develop your leadership potential, benefit from executive mentoring, and immerse yourself in a rotation to another region of the world.

“Pioneer” is the name of Hempel’s Global Graduate Programme. As a leader in the industrial coatings market, Hempel is looking to inspire top talent to join our growing global company early in their careers. Over a period of 18 months, you will get a deep understanding of our business, our values and our way of leading people. Your intensive on-the-job experiences are combined with training, personal development and mentoring from a senior manager – to help you become the best you can be.



Here’s what you can look forward to in this role
We are looking for a talented, ambitious and motivated marketing profile with a global mindset and a passion for collaborating closely with our business units to drive the Commercial Excellence agenda globally. You will get hands-on experience with global and regional marketing, and be involved in a wide variety of marketing projects and tasks within product management, product marketing, market intelligence, business analytics, marketing communications and digital marketing.

  • Market & customer insights incl. market research, customer surveys and competitor intelligence

  • Business analytics incl. customer classification, data analyses and marketing metrics

  • Digital marketing including website, e-commerce and digital analytics

  • Supporting product and portfolio management with new solutions development and assortment management

  • Planning of product marketing and communication programmes

  • Development, implementation and execution of product launch campaigns incl. concept development, sales tools, promotional material, advertising and events such as conferences, exhibitions and seminars.

  • Support global marketing initiatives, collaborating with colleagues across regions and cultures

Your home base will be at our North America regional headquarters in Conroe, Texas, just north of Houston. During your 18-month graduate period, you will also be spending a 6-month period abroad.


What are we looking for?

If becoming a leader in a global company is on top of your career aspirations, and if you are keen to ‘fast track’ your development, then our Pioneer Programme is for you.

  • We’re looking for graduates who want to take a leading role in a truly global and multicultural company with an ambitious growth strategy.

  • You have graduated with a Master’s degree within the last two years or will graduate from university or business school no later than 1 September 2020.

  • Experience from living, working or studying abroad will be a plus

  • You have a collaborative and inclusive mindset, and are eager to build strong relationships across a global organisation.

  • Most importantly, you’re ambitious and possess the drive to become a future leader. You’re motivated by making a difference - and by making other people shine.


Global career possibilities

In Hempel we offer a variety of global career possibilities and many cross functional and cross cultural working relationships. We strive to create the right conditions for personal and professional development.

Our aim is that you continue your career with us after completing the Pioneer programme and accelerate your readiness towards taking on future leadership positions within Hempel.


Application and further information

To apply for this position, please submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system by clicking the link ‘Apply for position’ at the top-right corner.
Final deadline for applications is 14 February 2020.



For further information about the job, please contact People and Culture Pioneer, Ashley Gehsmann, at (936)523-6079.

For further information about the Pioneer Programme please go to https://www.hempelgraduate.com/

Located along New Jersey's northern coastline, Monmouth University is a top-tier, private comprehensive institution that is home to innovative academic programs, expert faculty, and nationally ranked Division I athletics. The University enrolls approximately 6,200 students in nearly 60 undergraduate and graduate degree programs, including two doctoral programs.

Small classes geared toward individual attention and immersive learning experiences that extend beyond the classroom, define the student experience at Monmouth. The University's dynamic learning environment empowers students to become active participants in their education while fully preparing them for life after graduation. Monmouth's faculty, experts in their respective disciplines and industries, foster student growth by collaborating with undergraduates and graduates in their research and scholarship.

Approximately one hour from New York City and Philadelphia, Monmouth University sits at the heart of a vibrant culture rich in history, the arts, technology, and entrepreneurship. The University's 168-acre coastal campus has been named one of the most beautiful in the world, and blends the classic elegance of National Historic Landmarks with state-of-the-art facilities. Recent updates include a $47 million renovation to the Edison Science Building and construction of a $16 million stadium, which hosts more than half of the University's student-athletes.

A multitude of experiences is available just outside the campus gates. Access Asbury Park's legendary music scene and diverse cultural opportunities supported by an active LGBTQ community. Enjoy Red Bank's lively theater and dining hub and Long Branch's redeveloped waterfront with recreational and upscale shopping offerings.

Founded in 1933 as Monmouth Junior College, the institution became Monmouth College in 1956 and received its university charter in 1995. Today, Monmouth University is listed in U.S. News & World Report's “Best Colleges,” The Princeton Review's “The Best 382 Colleges,” and Money magazine's “Best Colleges for Your Money.”

Monmouth University is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Marketing Manager, Global Strategic Marketing, Trauma located in West Chester, PA or Zuchwil, Switzerland.

DePuy Synthes Companies of Johnson & Johnson is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes Companies offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials. Building on the legacy and strengths of two great companies, more agile and better equipped to meet the needs of today’s evolving health care environment. With a focus on activating insights to develop innovative, comprehensive solutions, we are inspired to advance patient care in greater ways than either company could accomplish on its own.

DePuy Synthes Trauma is the worldwide leader in the development of products to treat orthopaedic trauma and other bone deformities. The company is headquartered in West Chester, PA and Zuchwil, Switzerland and employs over 1,000 people worldwide. This position is responsible for the worldwide marketing of products within the company’s global marketing team.

Position Duties & Responsibilities of the position include but are not limited to:
  • Commercial Results - Achieve worldwide business plan objectives of sales, net income, gross profit, inventory and price on an annual basis. Manage expenses within budget. Increase company’s leadership position in trauma market.
  • Brand Strategy - Contribute to the development of global brand strategies for products, services, programs and other key initiatives, including establishment of value proposition, targeting & segmentation, positioning, global branding, product launch and lifecycle management.
  • Product Launch - Responsible for leading and executing impactful worldwide product launches. Specific responsibilities include the development of brand strategy, marketing materials for all key stakeholders (salesforce, surgeons, hospitals, patients, payers, etc.), price strategy, promotional plan, product training plan (salesforce & surgeons), product forecasting, inventory roll-out plan, sales tools, etc. Lead coordination with Regional Marketing teams and other key stakeholders.

Partner with R&D and Strategic Alliance counterpart to lead product development programs. Responsible for contributing to product scope, providing design inputs, validating product design, and development of launch messaging and materials, set configurations, etc. Leverage strong understanding of product development process and functional areas (quality, regulatory, etc.) to ensure on-time launches.
  • Business Development – Identify external partners to target for acquisition or strategic partnership to fill gaps in the portfolio or create competitive differentiation. Develop business cases to gain internal support for proposed partnerships/acquisitions.
  • Customer Insights and Analytics - Partner with Business Insights & Strategic Marketing to execute market research initiatives around customer needs and product validation. Provide technical expertise to assist in their execution. Stay connected with market needs through frequent interaction with customers (co-travel with sales consultants, attendance at industry meetings, review medical journals, etc.)

Collaborate with other functional areas to execute plan. Apply understanding of the sales process to develop well positioned market messaging that can drive customer behavior. Partner with the sales force and field marketing to effectively deploy.
  • People Management - Position typically does not involve management of direct reports, but will provide direction and mentorship to junior members of the DePuy Synthes team. The position involves extensive interaction with external partners requiring collaboration and management of the partner resources and development processes.
  • General Business Support - Develop strong relationships with surgeon customers and key targets. Partner with Professional Education & Tradeshow groups to build promotional plans around key events and provide on-site support. Partner closely with Regional Marketing and Sales Teams to gather input on customer needs and ensure strong alignment with product and company strategy. Be responsive in responding to requests from customers and sales consultants. Work collaboratively with functional areas and Strategic Partners to ensure business issues are addressed.

Key Job Responsibilities
