We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation, and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.

How we LEAD:

We are seeking a Tour Events Manager for our Republic Records office located in LA. In this role, you will liaise with other departments within the label, as well as artist’s teams, talent agencies, concert venues, and production companies. You will develop and maintain key relationships with others in the industry, including box office personnel, junior staff with agencies and promoters, artist managers, tour managers, and label staff.

How you’ll CREATE:

  • Support ticketing and guest list process for western region shows and special events through the creation of budgets, putting tickets on hold with box offices, building out solicit emails, as well as distributing tickets and appropriate VIP/AAA passes in a timely manner.
  • Opening purchase orders, tracking promotional budgets,
  • Processing invoices, maintaining internal contact databases,
  • Answering phones, scheduling
  • Complete expense reports.
  • Update the internal tour data system with all domestic tour dates and distribute appropriate show updates
  • Marketing information to all relevant internal and external teams.
  • Facilitate and distribute artist promo and touring schedules plus artist travel itineraries
  • Assist in the production and execution of label artist showcases, listening sessions & events as required
  • Research new lifestyle marketing ideas, showcase/event spaces, travel vendors, etc.

Bring your VIBE:

  • 4+ years of work experience in the music industry, either record label or talent agency
  • Interested in live music and knowledge of touring
  • You have a strong ability to multitask, thrive under pressure, and juggle priorities and deadlines. From booking travel to finding a lost drumkit to getting the right venue for the afterparty, no challenge is too big!
  • Be available to attend local shows, events, and concerts regularly (this is an essential part of the job!)
  • A proactive, organized, self-starter who has strong problem solving, social, and interpersonal skills
  • Must be able to work independently but be a team player and flexible
  • BA or BS degree (or equivalent)
  • Proficient in MS Office - Excel, Word, PowerPoint

Perks Playlist:

  • Competitive Compensation Package including Salary, Benefits and Generous 401k Savings Plan
  • Paid Time Off – Paid Holidays, “Gift Week”, Summer Fridays
  • Student Loan Repayment Assistance
  • Employee Developmental Support
  • Annual Gym Reimbursement Package
  • Pet Insurance, plus much more!

Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Search Marketing Specialist is the day-to-day coordinator of marketing acquisition including SEM, SEO, paid media acquisition and e-commerce marketing support. This role will help identify new audience segments within our existing user base to target, as well as new audiences to reach and connect with. They’ll be an audience expert, using in-depth knowledge to propose and implement experiments and improve existing retention acquisition and retention efforts. The role requires someone who is part data analyst, part technical analyst and part strategist. He or she must be a critical thinker who is creative in coming up with new, relevant ways to plan, measure and optimize performance marketing.


Essential Job Functions:

  • Planning, developing, and implementing comprehensive audience growth strategies to drive direct response and new user acquisition for the Monster Energy portfolio.
  • Developing direct response advertising strategies to drive sales revenue and/or qualified leads.
  • Creating and managing paid search accounts/campaigns via various paid search marketing platforms including but not limited to: Google, Bing, Yahoo, Amazon, Criteo, etc.
  • Conducting industry research and establishing bidding strategies to meet / exceed brand KPIs and benchmarks.
  • Creating and implementing campaign A/B test experiments to identify optimal campaign settings.
  • Using available data inputs and analytics tools to develop insights and action items intended to improve paid search performance and meet brand goals.
  • Forecast spend and manage budget allocations, optimizing based on performance.
  • Analyze competitor and industry trends.
  • Audit tracking and ensure measurability.
  • Be idea generator/thought leader on how to increase acquisition rates through non-traditional and/or innovative execution.
  • Communicating with cross-functional Marketing teams, primarily the Brand, International and Customer Marketing teams to regularly discuss goals and deliver results.
  • Partner with CMO and VP, Digital Marketing to develop the international digital growth capabilities and resources to best meet the needs of our global strategy and our regional business units.

Position Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing-related fields such as Communications, Media Studies, Marketing and Advertising, Business or other.
  • Minimum 2-3 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on performance marketing generating acquisition and conversion such as SEM, SEO, CRM, affiliates and re-marketing.
  • Experience with key platforms and channels such as Google, Amazon, Criteo, etc.
  • Deep knowledge of the SEM industry and the paid search advertising model, including experience with keyword research tools and web analytics tools, as well as how to use these tools in media campaigns.
  • Strong skills in data management such as Excel, pivto tables and databases (e.g. SQL).
  • A strategic thinker, practitioner, and excellent collaborator with experience building and leading analytics and managing agile workflows, including experience working with teams to successfully implement recommendations to drive business growth.
  • Must be proactive and focused, detail-oriented, self-motivated, results-driven, and able to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to think creatively, critically, in order to clearly present ideas and communicate with leadership.
  • Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills.
  • Digital media certifications a plus: Google, Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • HTML/CSS experience a plus.

Elsevier is a global information analytics business that helps institutions and professionals progress science, advance healthcare and improve performance for the benefit of humanity. We help researchers make new discoveries, collaborate with their colleagues, and give them the knowledge they need to find funding. We help governments and universities evaluate and improve their research strategies. We help doctors save lives, providing insight for physicians to find the right clinical answers, and we support nurses and other healthcare professionals throughout their careers.Elsevier provides digital solutions and tools in the areas of strategic research management, R&D performance, clinical decision support, and professional education; including ScienceDirect, Scopus, SciVal, ClinicalKey and Sherpath. Elsevier publishes over 2,500 digitized journals, including The Lancetand Cell, more than 35,000 e-book titles and many iconic reference works, including Gray?s Anatomy. Elsevier is part of RELX Group, a global provider of information and analytics for professionals and business customers across industries. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization.

Customer Consultant – Research Intelligence

Are you looking for a new challenge?

Do you have experience in a customer facing role with a proven track record of maximizing customer satisfaction? Eager to act as a trusted adviser to the customer; ensuring the customer adopts, uses, and gains maximum value from our solutions? Are you sales oriented and love science and research. Do you have experience working within research at an academic institution? Our Customer Consultant (CC) position for our Research Management could be your next challenge!

Through a carefully planned implementation and on boarding process the CC will ensure that the fully realizes the return on their investment of Elsevier content tools & software. Continual engagement with the customer will ensure the solutions continue to meet the needs of the client, thereby ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and maximizing revenue for Elsevier.

Working Together

In order to be successful, the Customer Consultant will have a deep understanding of user’s research workflow. You will be an integral part of the sales team, working closely with sales, global customer service teams, marketing and product teams.

Your Team

You will become part of the Research Solutions Sales Team, a group of enthusiastic professionals responsible for calling on Academic and Government institutions in the territory to support the sale of our research tools and analytical services. You will focus on providing information, support and training on our Research Intelligence products: Scopus, SciVal, Pure, data assets and analytical services. You will be expected to travel approximately 50 percent within the region.

Your responsibilities:

  • You are responsible for customer satisfaction and for ensuring value and use of the Elsevier research Intelligence solutions portfolio for renewal revenue growth and maximizing customer retention.
  • Drive successful implementation and adoption of the solution portfolio in your territory.
  • Act as a trusted adviser to the customer by providing in-depth product training, support and guidance directly aligned to the specific research workflow and customer objectives to ensure our solutions positively impact their research decisions and outcomes.
  • Uncover, analyze, and upsell opportunities at the account, plus support the account team with the preparation of tailored renewal value stories, including demonstration of product value and ROI.
  • On-going monitoring of customer to ensure increasing value and minimize attrition risk.
  • Bench mark, set targets, and systematically monitor usage with the customer, develop an action plan where usage is not meeting targets.
  • Ensure successful implementation and adoption of solution at customers; ensure delivery of appropriate training in line with customer engagement plan.
  • Identify, support and develop champions and advocates within the customer environment. Ensure that they communicate the impact our solutions on the research outcomes.
  • Help to improve product and solutions by giving feedback and getting involved in the product development process.

Our Requirements:

  • An advanced degree in any science, or bioinformatics
  • Knowledge of regional or national research programs, collaboration networks and university administration is a plus; knowledge of bibliometrics is helpful
  • Experience working within a research environment, academic or commercial is helpful
  • Background working in a complex matrix of internal and external stakeholders is helpful
  • Experience using complex enterprise software tool would be desirable.
  • Background in customer engagement and driving customer adoption
  • Strong communication (verbal including on-line delivery and written), presentation skills, and analytical skills
  • A passion for customer engagement, drive; enthusiasm and energy is a must!

We offer:
We are the leading provider of scientific, technical and medical information and tools in the world that help our customers improve scientific and healthcare outcomes. We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment offering great opportunities to develop yourself.

  • Competitive base salary
  • Generous Commission plan based on performance
  • Medical, dental and 401K benefits
  • All expenses and travel fully paid
  • Excellent hands-on training program and a team to support you
  • Numerous online resources to assist with self development and career progression

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Marketing Coordinator will work cross-functionally to drive marketing initiatives. This position will be responsible for becoming a probiotic expert by learning the industry and identifying market trends. With this knowledge, the Marketing Coordinator will develop strategic campaigns for social media, tradeshows and further marketing material. This role is ultimately responsible for the building and maintenance of the UAS Labs brand through cross-functional marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate is organized, detail oriented, a self-starter and a strong communicator.

RESPONSIBILITIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty. Essential job functions and duties include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Research and understand probiotic trends and their influence on the market

  • Manage the company’s social media campaign (strategy and posting)
  • Copyright for blog, web, literature and miscellaneous marketing content

  • Other services as needed


The appropriate knowledge, skills and abilities required for this position are achievable through the following combination of education, work experience and training:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 1-3 years of experience in marketing, sales or management
  • Ability to effectively manage projects
  • Excellent verbal & written communication skills
  • High attention to detail and excellent organization skills
  • Proficiency with Microsoft office suite including Microsoft Teams
  • Prior experience with HubSpot, WordPress, Magisto, Envoy, Smartsheet and/or design software is preferred
  • Estimated travel of 10%-15%
  • Based in Madison, WI

Overview

People who work for themselves fuel our economy. In the US, small businesses employ 60% of the workforce and create 80% of new jobs. Often times the odds are stacked against them with 50% failing in the first 5 years.

Intuit’s Small Business and Self-Employed Group (SBSEG) is devoted to creating solutions to meet the needs and improve the chances of success for these entrepreneurs with a portfolio of solutions ranging from mileage tracking to invoicing, payroll to accounting, payments and capital.

SBSEG is looking for a Director of Global Brand Development with a passion for content, strategy and innovation to help us revolutionize the world of work for our customers.

The Director of Global Brand Development will report to the Head of Global Marketing for SBSEG and is based in Mountain View, CA.

This leader will manage a large Global Brand Development team consisting of marketing professionals accountable for Global Brand Equity, Strategy and Performance, Integrated Marketing Communications, Global Branded Content (Social, SEO - QuickBooks Resource Center, Community, events) and Digital Experimentation. The team is mostly centered in Mountain View with a small presence in our key markets (UK, Canada & Australia).

Responsibilities

  • Lead work on our global brand evolution and strategy as we continue on our journey moving from an accounting software to a connected suite of business tools (applies to all markets where QuickBooks is present across the world from US to France, UK, Canada, Australia, Brazil, Mexico) to deliver growth.
  • You will be the thought leader on the positioning and brand strategy behind the extension of the QuickBooks brand into new segments and spaces.
  • Lead the US E2E Brand Campaigns from brief to execution across all of our business segments (amplified by heavy media support from the US market) to drive awareness and consideration of QuickBooks’ products and services.
  • Lead the relationship with our Agency of Record
  • Lead our global branded content from strategy to execution work inclusive of social, SEO articles, Community and more.
  • Serve as the thought leader on brand health across the world in collaboration with Market Research team.
  • Drive global media strategy partnering with our media agencies around the world.
  • Excite and inspire internal and external partners as we champion the brand together across all touchpoints and experiences.
  • Manage a high performing team empowering them to beat their best to drive excellent strategy to execution. Coach our all-stars on their personal and professional development growth areas.
  • Deliver on annual customer and revenue growth numbers.
  • Monitor business performance across communications and campaigns globally and triangulate these as well as media and brand strategy to brand health. Identify root causes for performance, recommend changes and adapt strategy and comms as needed.

Qualifications

  • 15+ years of marketing experience with an emphasis on brand development/management and global communications
  • Experience bringing large scale integrated campaigns to life and launching innovations through communications on paid and owned channels ( PR specific experience not required but a plus)
  • Experience crafting brand and content strategy to deliver rapid growth on expected results.
  • Proven success driving media strategy across the customer funnel for large scale brands or product lines especially across online media.
  • Data driven: understands and has experience leveraging data to create delightful end to end customer experiences that are aligned from communications to conversion and product.
  • Demonstrated exceptional leadership, management of large team, strategic thinking and communication skills.
  • Experience operating in a matrixed organization: demonstrated superb influencing skills and partnership with key internal and external stakeholder teams: senior leadership, country marketing teams, product marketers, marketing channel leaders, analytics, procurement, finance etc.

The following are the duties of this position at the CN-53(Broadly equivalent to the GS-13). If you are selected at a lower grade level, you will have the opportunity to learn to perform all these duties, and will receive training to help you grow in this position.

  • Establish and continuously refine the processes and procedures for the Bureau’s Events Management Team. Assess resource needs and recommend plans to address a high touch, customer focused service delivery model to managing events.
  • Support the strategic direction, planning, execution and management of all Bureau sponsored events including those hosted at Bureau offices and at offsite, non-CFPB locations including: Bureau and division all hands, diversity and inclusion events, events hosted in the multi-purpose/training rooms, Consumer Advisory Board meetings, Symposia, Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC) meetings, Field engagements, and other applicable events.
  • Coordinate with offices across the Bureau to implement policies, processes, and checklists to ensure the efficient and effective organization, coordination and logistics of Bureau events.
  • Research and secure venues, plan menus and audio-visual equipment, book sleeping rooms and provides guidance to vendors and other personnel before and during events, plan and manage the events' calendar, negotiate service level agreements with vendors, assist with event marketing, monitor timeframes and budgets, networks, and deliver on event objectives.

Travel Required

Occasional travel - 1-5 nights per month.

No

PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people.

PointClickCare is looking for a dynamic, hands-on leader to develop and manage a new Industry Advisor team.
Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Product, the Director is chartered with building a team of 4 - 6 industry experts and outside advisors, each of whom deeply understands and represents a key senior care operating role across senior care market segments (skilled nursing, senior living and home health).

The Industry Advisor team has a unique three-pronged “enablement” charter:
1. Market/Function Educator
Work with PointClickCare’s corporate learning team to educate & certify Product & Engineering staff on:
o The markets PointClickCare serves (Skilled Nursing, Senior Living, Home Health) and the organizations that comprise these markets
o Key roles that exist in these organizations and the functions/workflows these roles perform (e.g. Nurse, Aide, Attending Physician, Marketing/Admissions Director, Billing Manager, CEO, CIO & CFO)
o Similarities & differences in how each of these roles operate across these different markets.

2. Community Liaison
Establish formal & informal network(s) of potential & current users as well as PointClickCare SMEs that Product Leaders can access quickly to conduct market research, socialize new ideas, source feedback on product concepts, etc.
o Develop & manage a system for effectively requesting & scheduling time with users
o Leverage internal systems and teams to evaluate and confirm list of identified users
o Ensure proper visibility and sharing of user insights and intelligence with the rest of the organization (sales, customer success, etc.)

3. Evangelist / Champion
o Participate in public forums, industry groups and standards bodies to gauge the broader market perspective on various topics and to help promote and communicate PointClickCare’s strategies and objectives.
o With Product Marketing, publish articles, blog postings etc. to help establish, maintain and grow PointClickCare’s thought leadership position

Key Responsibilities:
With the above team charter in mind, the Director, Industry Advisors responsibilities include:
  • Hire and manage a dedicated team of Industry Advisors
  • Establish, cultivate, and maintain contract-based relationships with part-time Advisors
  • Set priorities, objectives and key results for all full-time & part-time advisors
  • Ensure Industry Advisor team members are working well together – both as a team and through a Community of Practice
  • Serve as player / coach – i.e. is an Industry Advisor to the organization as well as manages the team
  • Maintain overall budget responsibility for the Industry Advisor team (salaries, contracts, T&E, industry memberships, etc.)
  • Serve as a key member of the Product Leadership management team.
  • Evolve the role of the Industry Advisor group over time to serve additional PointClickCare departmental needs.
  • Drive results through effective communication by building rapport, anticipating and preparing for questions, communicating calmly under pressure and being an effective listener
  • Ensures scalability and sustainability of results by focusing on consistently and effectively collaborating with internal and external stakeholders and team members
  • Represents PointClickCare with a high degree of knowledge, integrity and professionalism
Required Experience
  • Extensive leadership experience working within the Senior Care industry
  • Proven expertise managing both on-site and virtual teams of highly professional experts
  • Experience influencing without authority and navigating effectively through organizational ambiguity and complexity
  • Experience (and ideally current participation) working with 2 or more industry standards groups or industry working groups
  • Familiarity with Healthcare IT and the core systems/applications that serve the industry (EHRs, HISs, HIEs etc.)
  • Advanced degree in a healthcare-related related field of study
  • Consulting experience preferred

In 1952, Dan Edelman established a new kind of company in Chicago, one that would redefine the public relations industry. Over 60 years later, our firm is still strongly rooted in Chicago as the firm’s co-headquarters and we continue to innovate and push the boundaries of our profession by expanding our capabilities to include world class research, creative, strategy, planning and production talent. Edelman’s Chicago office has grown to more than 600 employees and is home to industry-leading experts in food, retail and consumer brand marketing, as well as prominent corporate, health and digital practitioners. Our independence keeps us nimble, thoughtful and resourceful and allows us to invest heavily in specialized experts throughout the firm. Edelman Chicago represents not only our company’s history, but also our future.
Edelman has an exciting in-house opportunity for a marketing professional in the Chicago office. We are seeking a confident, entrepreneurial-minded senior account executive to drive external marketing efforts for Edelman Chicago, with a specific focus on supporting the Corporate practice. This self-starter will be responsible for helping to drive the marketing plan forward through external events, strategic sponsorship efforts, IP rollouts, social media outreach, media relations and more.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Play a major role in the research, planning and execution of all marketing initiatives and events
  • Demonstrate proficiency in writing, editing and proofreading communications materials ensuring quality and consistency with AP writing style
  • Work directly with the office president, management team and Corporate practice leadership to coordinate external marketing opportunities
  • Drive proactive pursuit efforts for Corporate practice
  • Demonstrate tactical proficiency in media relations, including creating and driving outreach plans, message development and effective pitching
  • Demonstrate practical and advanced understanding of social media and the digital landscape and proficiency in community management of Edelman’s social channels
  • Manage various civic and industry partnerships for Chicago office
  • Proactively seek out opportunities to leverage our Subject Matter Experts and increase Edelman’s visibility in the marketplace
  • Plan and execute marketing initiatives in key markets when applicable
  • Build network of industry connections and participate in relevant professional organizations and networking activities that will grow Edelman brand recognition and your own reputation
  • Proactively propose improvements to our process and capabilities
  • Commit to continuous learning through Edelman University and other training opportunities
  • Demonstrate behaviors consistent with Edelman’s values (Quality, Integrity, Respect, Entrepreneurial Spirit, Mutual Benefits, Citizenship) and Code of Ethics and Business Conduct

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field and at least two years of relevant experience in public relations and/or marketing. Additionally, the candidate must have excellent interpersonal and communications skills, the demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects at once and the confidence to work independently and with senior level executives with little supervision. Interest in marketing and PR is a must.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Solid grasp of the public relations industry as well as strong research, writing and editing skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Demonstrated ability to delegate tactical assignments and accurately judge and edit the work of others at or below his/her level.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop traditional and digital media relations’ recommendations and have previous exposure and knowledge of managing social media accounts
  • Proven ability to manage large projects as well as planning and executing mid-to-large scale events
  • Excellent organization and communication skills and composure to adapt to changing deadlines
  • Must be a self-starter, confident and adept at relationship building
  • Proactive, independent and dedicated to consistently providing quality work


About Us

Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Intelligence (research) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).

You're the brains behind our work.
You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the trading floor, and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it’s honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can’t come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team, and establish a long-term career here. Citi is looking for Summer Analysts to join the Markets and Securities Services: Markets team in North America. As part of Markets and Securities Services, your work can make an immediate impact. From providing financing solutions to the world’s leading corporations, governments, and institutional investors to offering a robust range of products and services, you will gain varied and thorough knowledge in this diverse rotational program. Our Markets Analyst Program is unlike any other on Wall Street. It is a highly competitive and selective program that gives you the opportunity to actively participate in the research, trading and marketing of securities to our institutional client base. In addition, as a Summer Analyst, you will be given the opportunity to rotate across both product and function, to gain a well-rounded experience over your 10 weeks.

Overview

Fuel your intellectual curiosity and professional growth. Forrester is an idea company, where smart, motivated, curious people bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on ideas that change the course of business. Most of all, bring a point of view; here, every voice has value. At Forrester, you’ll work with innovative clients at emerging and established brands; these are the business and technology leaders we inspire and who inspire us. The Forrester experience is built on a singular, powerful purpose: to challenge thinking and lead change.

About This Role:

Are you an experienced product marketing leader with a passion for product, solution, industry, or services marketing? Have you spent time thinking about how to take a strategic approach to launch, enabling sales with knowledge and using buyer insights for audience-centric marketing? If so, you could be the next addition to our team.

We're looking for a Research Director to join our research and advisory service team within the SiriusDecisions product line. In this role, you’ll help clients with initiatives such as go-to-market strategy, buyer personas and insights, messaging and content, bringing offerings to market, and functional design and development. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage your exceptional writing and speaking skills as you advise clients on best practices and impact their strategy, execution, and growth.

Responsibilities

  • Research generation. Prepare and write key SiriusDecisions product line advisory deliverables, including briefs, core strategy reports, client select practices/case studies, and blogs.
  • Thought leadership. Create new SiriusDecisions product line models and frameworks, tools, templates, assessments, etc., for our clients.
  • Client interaction. Communicate on the phone or in person with SiriusDecisions product line clients to review published research and data and discuss business-related problems/issues.
  • Event support. Conceptualize and make presentations as part of client and prospective client events for the SiriusDecisions product line, including annual summits, forums, roadshows, and webinars.
  • Sales support. Tap prospective SiriusDecisions product line advisory clients via phone or in person and introduce them the demand marketing service, research topics covered, and key areas of expertise. Demonstrate the value of the service by sharing client examples, research, data, and other deliverables.
  • Data gathering. Contribute to data gathering and benchmarking efforts via question/response creation for both quantitative and qualitative surveys.
  • Benchmarking delivery. Assist with the review and delivery of benchmarking findings to portfolio marketing clients.
  • Other client-facing activities. Assist with SiriusDecisions consulting projects as needed to support portfolio marketing coverage areas (e.g., go-to-market strategy, bringing offerings to market, and portfolio messaging and content).

Qualifications

  • Ten-plus years of experience as an advanced portfolio marketing leader (or some combination of product, solution, industry, and/or services marketing experience).
  • Excellent writing and analytical skills as well as exceptional customer-facing skills (someone who is a strong presenter, is at ease with an executive-level audience, and can identify issues/needs through effective questioning).
  • Experience in transforming a business from product-centric to audience-centric using go-to-market strategies.

POSITION SUMMARY:

This role will create and drive the long-term strategic vision and plan for Team Uniforms, with a sharp focus on building the most innovative, consumer-centric product in the industry. Daily work will revolve around managing the full product life cycle - from seasonal strategy and line planning, through design and development process, to production and delivery. In addition, research of markets and cross-functional collaboration (design, tech design, production, sports marketing, sales, etc.) will be expected to drive athlete needs and insights into commercialized assortments.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Build and manage the Women’s uniform business from concept to commercialization. This is inclusive of, but not limited to writing briefs, managing integrity of all data inputs, working collaboratively with design and tech design to bring product to market on time and at cost, etc.
  • Be the Consumer and sport expert – voice of the consumer. Be the lead POV on category, influencing category direction as the product and consumer advocate.
  • Create the strategic vision and plan for the category. Align on product needs required to service different and unique profit and promotional channels.
  • Define seasonal product assortment strategy and roadmap. Actively contribute to overall long-range product strategy with focus on line architecture, lifecycle management, and pricing strategies.
  • Manage product, assortment, and pricing direction with third-party licensees by facilitating the relationships with product development and internal UA product creation teams.
  • Partner with innovation and materials & trims teams to test and validate uniform concepts. Responsible for direction on wear testing concepts and maintaining material innovation pipeline for the category.
  • Act as the product detail lead for activation of uniforms on the online uniform customizer
  • Facilitate the data integrity and the system data load for the Women’s uniform category on uniform builder and Armoury.
  • Manage photoshoots and maintain master data and catalog.
  • Build and deliver presentations at all relevant milestones.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Strong presentation, time management, collaboration and influencing skills. Team Player Attitude
  • Required experience managing Full Product Life Cycle
  • Strong Presentation and Collaboration skills
  • Experience mining consumer insights & translating into product solutions

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum 3 years of product line management – Uniforms experience highly preferred.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Travel – 30-35%, including both domestic and international

The Research Project Advisor (RPA) will be responsible for operating and managing the Imaging and Image Analysis Division of the Biobank and Translational Research Core. The BTRC core operates a number of imaging platforms including confocal microscopes, a lightsheet microscope, a laser capture microdissection platform, and slide scanners. The RPA will be the point person for these, and additional imaging platforms, and be expected to offer training as well as be proficient in the use of all of these instruments. Organizing the maintenance and service contract schedules for all imaging instrumentation within the core will be part of the RPA’s responsibilities. Developing and implementing SOPs will also be required.

A key role of the RPA is to offer imaging expertise to the research community at CSMC; meeting with investigators to understand their needs and developing pipelines for completion are core responsibilities for this position. Interfacing with the BTRC histology and IHC/IF staining teams for developing pipelines will also be critical for successful operations.

Additional duties will include assisting users with image analysis projects; these will include, but not be limited to, both single plex and multiplex staining and for both IHC and IF applications. The RPA will be expected to aid investigators with instrument scheduling, track instrument usage through iLabs, and aid in billing for these projects. The RPA will be expected to review the image analysis needs of the CSMC research community and become the point person for developing new image analysis approaches that can become core services.

The RPA will actively market the Imaging core services through seminars, presentations, electronic marketing, etc. The RPA will work closely with the BTRC leadership (Director, Associate Director) to develop the imaging core, both in terms of expanding instrumentation and services offered, but also with regard to outreach strategies.

The RPA may be required to supervise and train junior staff of the BTRC in operating the imaging equipment.

Additional duties, administrative or otherwise, at the discretion of the BTRC Director/Associate Director.

ABOUT IEG

IEG is the premier global consultancy in partnership strategy, evaluation and measurement for leading sponsor brands and rights holders. IEG helps brand and property clients navigate the complex universe of sponsorship and engagement marketing to optimize the value of brand partnerships for all stakeholders: sponsor, rights holder and audience. Our insight reflects the depth of our practical experience, disciplined approach and ground-breaking points of view.

In 2018, Engine Shop, the award-winning engagement marketing agency, acquired IEG, uniting IEG's premier sponsorship valuation, research, measurement services and thought leadership programming with Engine Shop's modern approach on connecting brands to consumers through multi-channel engagement marketing.

Our new Research Associate will need to be a multitasker who is detail oriented, extremely organized, collaborative, motivated, with a constant "no job is too small" attitude. This person must be able to identify potential challenges, create solutions on their own, consult with clients and agency partners. We are looking for someone who can keep up with the fast pace of this work and the challenges it provides.

FUNCTIONS + RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Update and maintain IEG's sponsorship intelligence database
  • Support content creation for IEG's thought-leadership website – sponsorship.com
  • Support IEG consulting group client team(s) for internal and external projects. Additional support to other client teams and consulting work, which may include:
  • Participating in brainstorming and strategy sessions
  • Creating competitive intelligence reports and conducting primary and secondary research
  • Analyzing information and updating marketing and research databases
  • Monitoring industry sources
  • Researching trends in special interest areas of marketing/sponsorship
  • Learning IEG's valuation methodology and conduct valuations of sponsorship opportunities
  • Other related duties as reasonably assigned
REQUIRED SKILLS + EXPERIENCE:
  • A recent or soon to be college graduate with a bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, business, sports management or a related field
  • A self-described "self-starter" with a passion for sports and entertainment looking to break in to the world of marketing research and data analysis with the desire to actively contribute to a variety of projects
  • Basic to intermediate Excel and PowerPoint skills (i.e. working knowledge of pivot tables, formatting, functions, etc.)
  • Some research skills including utilizing Internet/Google Search, internal databases and or industry/publications
  • Superior communication skills and ability to work independently and be self-directed
  • Great attention to detail and strong commitment to accuracy
  • Willingness and open-mindedness to learn, especially about sponsorship marketing and related industries
  • General knowledge of marketing and current trends
COMPENSATION/BENEFITS

  • Limited 6-month term
  • Competitive Salary
  • Medical and dental benefits
  • Flex vacation policy

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

As a Research and Development Scientist in the Diagnostics and Genomics Group, you will contribute to the development of cutting-edge target enrichment solutions for Next Generation Sequencing. You will work with a cross-functional team to create new products and applications for cancer research and diagnostics. In this key role you will use your extensive molecular biology expertise to plan and execute NGS target enrichment and analysis workflows. You will be expected to contribute to projects requiring coordination with other functions, including R and D, marketing and manufacturing. You will be expected to address a broad range of scientific problems of varying scope and complexity. Laboratory expertise should include Next Generation Sequencing, RNA and/or DNA sequencing and hands-on molecular biology. Ability to work with large datasets and perform basic bioinformatic analysis is a plus.

AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH), Health Effects Laboratory Division (HELD), in Morgantown, West Virginia. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
The incumbent will serve as the Deputy Director, supervisor, and senior technical advisor for a multi-disciplinary division that scientifically establishes causes and mechanisms of disease and injury in the workplace.

DUTIES:
[
"Provide technical advice on scientific studies/surveys or projects to internal and external stakeholders.", "Assist in the establishment of guidelines, policies, and the development of recommendations for studies and analyses.", "Plan, develop, evaluate and manage the overall scientific and technical management of the research program.", "Demonstrate support for the CDC Affirmative Action Plan for Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO)" ]

REQUIREMENTS:
US Citizenship is required. Public Trust/Moderate Background Investigation (5) is required. Federal law requires DHS to use the E-Verify System to verify employment eligibility of all new hires, and as a condition of continued employment obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is an E-Verify Participant. Direct Deposit: All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses: May be authorized Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Recruitment Incentive: May be authorized Annual Leave for non-federal service: May be authorized Promotion potential: No Supervisory position: Yes, since this is a supervisory position, candidates must also have demonstrated or shown the potential to develop the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities. A supervisory probationary period may be required. Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Injury Prevention and Control (NCIPC) located in Atlanta, GA. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
The incumbent will conduct studies of the behavioral aspects of public health issues and problems, and develop strategies to address those issues. Also they will apply professional knowledge of the behavioral sciences and related social and health sciences in the control and prevention of diseases.

DUTIES:
[
"As a Behavioral Scientist you will: Provide advice in dealings with the behavioral aspects of public health issues. Design, conduct, and lead studies to isolate and define the behavioral aspects contributing to public health issues and problems. Develop strategies to assess and monitor the behavioral component of public health issues, including surveillance strategies. Collaborate with other staff in the design of public health programs, to incorporate behavioral aspects in an integrated approach to disease or injury prevention. Evaluate the effectiveness of public health programs by measuring and assessing the extent of behavioral change." ]

REQUIREMENTS:
US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation is required. E-Verify: If you are selected for this position, the documentation that you present for purposes of completing the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Form I-9 will be verified through the DHS "E-Verify" System. Federal law requires DHS to use the E-Verify System to verify employment eligibility of all new hires, and as a condition of continued employment obligates the new hire to take affirmative steps to resolve any discrepancies identified by the system. The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is an E-Verify Participant. Direct Deposit: All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Recruitment Incentive may be authorized: No Annual Leave for non-federal service may be authorized: No Research position: No Promotion potential: Yes, This position has promotion potential to GS-13. Promotion to the next grade level is at management's discretion and is based on your meeting qualifications and time-in-grade requirements, demonstrated ability to perform the higher level duties, the continuing need for the higher level duties, and administrative approval. Promotion to the next grade level is not guaranteed and no promise of promotion is implied. Supervisory position: No Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. Current or Former Political Appointees: Agencies must seek prior approval from the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) before they can appoint a current or recent political appointee to a competitive or non-political excepted service position at any level under the provisions of title 5, United States Code. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, or Non-career SES employee in the executive branch, you MUST disclose that to the Human Resources Office. Failure to disclose this information could result in disciplinary action including removal from Federal Service. Current or Former Political Appointees: Submit SF-50. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
Basic Qualifications for GS-12/13:
I have a degree in behavioral or social science or related disciplines appropriate to the position; OR I have a combination of education and experience that provided me with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field; OR I have four years of appropriate experience that demonstrated that I have acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field. Minimum Qualifications for GS-12: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-11 in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in applying behavioral analysis of public health issues and formulation of policy or program development and evaluation.. Minimum Qualifications for GS-13: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-12 in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in designing, conducting, and leading studies of behavioral aspects contributing to public health issues and problems.

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Television Network

JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff

JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time

JOB LOCATION: Las Vegas, NV

ABOUT US:

CBS was established in 1928, when founder William Paley purchased 16 independent radio stations and christened them the Columbia Broadcast System. Today, with more than 200 television stations and affiliates reaching virtually every home in the United States, CBS's total network lineup was watched by more than 110 million people a week during the 2017/2018 season. CBS has been the #1 network in primetime for 10 consecutive seasons. The network has the #1 comedy/scripted program, THE BIG BANG THEORY; #1 newsmagazine, 60 MINUTES; #l late night program, THE LATE SHOW WITH STEPHEN COLBERT and #1 daytime drama, THE YOUNG AND THE RESTLESS. Its programming arms include CBS Entertainment, CBS News and CBS Sports.

DESCRIPTION:

Responsible for preparing, managing, and executing qualitative and quantitative projects at all stages from methodology/effective survey and discussion guide design to moderating focus groups and Individual interviews and providing concise but comprehensive results for internal and external clients.

  • Gather insights through varied methodologies including focus groups, individual interviews and guest surveys in a fast paced live recruit environment
  • Create discussion guides, screeners, and surveys
  • Help facilitate the respondent selection process
  • Analyze data prior to live focus groups and provide pre-group suggestions for discussion
  • Conduct focus groups in a timely matter while extracting as much useful information as possible from respondents
  • Provide analytical debrief of results to client, as needed, after completion of groups. Delivers in a concise but comprehensive brief.
  • Prepares detailed reports using Microsoft PowerPoint/Word
  • Ensure overall client satisfaction and help manage client relationships generating repeat business

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • § Previous background in leading group/individual discussions in marketing or consumer research

§ Must possess strong writing and analytical skills

§ Must be able to demonstrate strategic and intelligent thinking

§ Must be able to establish and maintain positive and professional relationship with supervisors, managers and clients

§ Have the ability to handle requests, suggestions and complaints in order to establish and maintain goodwill within the organization, clients and guests

§ Ability to analyze situations & respond quickly to deliver effective solutions

§ Work effectively individually and in a team environment;

§ Maintain a "can do" attitude and participates in joint problem solving

§ Must be highly motivated, enthusiastic, self-reliant and possess a self-starting approach to meet job responsibilities

§ Should possess a working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

EEO STATEMENT:

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Asuragen is seeking multiple outstanding undergraduates, recent graduates, and/or Master students in the biological sciences for 2020 summer internships focused on developing innovative nucleic acid or protein-based technologies. These research positions will address early-stage projects relevant to Asuragen’s molecular diagnostics portfolio that currently influences over 15 million patient management decisions each year.

Projects will advance technologies or molecular assays that can help determine disease state which could lead to better diagnostics and informed patient treatments. The projects focus on interrogating biomarkers with precision medicine applications. Each intern works with a team on a specific project led by a Senior Asuragen scientific mentor; projects are scoped to produce defined outcomes within the internship period. Additional opportunities include interacting with team members across other departments (e.g. Marketing, Manufacturing, and IT) and participate in meetings (e.g. technical, department, companywide, and journal club).

We are looking for academically accomplished, highly motivated, and collaborative individuals with a strong interest in industrial R&D. Previous research experience is preferred, particularly experience with molecular techniques such as DNA or RNA isolation, PCR, capillary electrophoresis, sequencing (short- or long-read next-generation sequencing), and/or protein-based methods such as protein extraction/purification, western blotting, or ELISA assays. Proficiency with routine data analysis, management, and presentation tools such as and Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is expected.

Additional information:

  • Expectations are 40 working hours/week. Ideal start date is May 26, 2020
  • Technologies of interest will vary by project, but typical examples include PCR methods (including quantitative and digital PCR), fragment analysis using capillary electrophoresis, multiplexed array systems, and/or next-generation sequencing
  • Diagnostic disease applications span neurogenetics (such as Huntington’s disease, myotonic dystrophy, fragile X and autism spectrum disorder), and oncology (liquid and solid tumors)
  • Visa sponsorship is not available for this position

About Asuragen

Asuragen is a molecular diagnostic product company changing the way patients are treated in genetics and oncology. Asuragen’s diagnostic systems, composed of proprietary chemistry and software, deliver powerful answers using broadly installed instrument platforms. They are simple to adopt and expand the ability to serve patients. Asuragen is a product foundry rapidly and efficiently addressing current and emerging clinical needs, including cancer diagnosis and monitoring, reproductive health and aging, serving laboratories across a patient’s lifespan with its best in class diagnostic tests. For more information, visit www.asuragen.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Asuragen is an E-Verify Employer in the United States.

Job Ad

Vans: Be a Part of the Original

“It was never about waving the brand like a flag, it was always about the people” – Paul Van Doren

Vans is the original action sports footwear company rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, Vans has thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through Vans’ four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the expressive creators within our company and community as they bring new and innovative perspectives to help shape and transform the future of our business.

At Vans our culture sets us apart and it influences everything we do. Everything we do supports creativity and we are driven by our five values.

1. We are determined .

2. We are connected to our consumers and to each other.

3. We are inclusive .

4. We are expressive and Fun .

5. And most of all, we are a family.

Vans is a subsidiary of VF, the world’s largest apparel and footwear company comprised of over 30 brands. We are the leading drivers of retail as our global footwear, apparel and accessory brand is available in 170 countries worldwide. As we continue to expand, we take great measures in developing and growing our people.

Vans is founded on a culture of learning. We take great pride in our ability to facilitate learning opportunities by providing the resources and tools necessary to support each individual’s pursuit of growth to achieve future goals. In order to prioritize career growth within our company, Vans offers courses on topics such as leadership, communication, collaboration and technical skills to ensure our employees are self-motivated and developing to the pace of our rapidly growing business.

By joining the Vans family, you will be immersed into an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work very hard across a multitude of large initiatives to bring the Van Doren spirit to life. We live for what we do.

Global Brand Marketing , Music Coordinator: Become the Newest Member of the Vans Family

Be a part of Vans’ legacy in music and creative culture. As the Music Coordinator in Global Brand Marketing, you will assist in the development and execution of the global music strategy. In this role, you will utilize marketing and music industry acumen to uplift Vans in the music space. You will assist the Global Music Marketing Manager in partnership with Global Brand Communications, Creative, Content, and regional Lifestyle Marketing teams at remaining on the forefront of artist relationships and industry trends while upholding the Van Doren spirit.

How You Will Make a Difference:

1. Assist the Music team in maintaining the master database

2. Research and report general music industry trends and competitor music initiatives, propose new and developing musicians and monitor upcoming music festivals, events, and performance charts

3. Partner closely with the Global Brand Communications team to help execute and log priority music seeding, and monitor and record ROI for all music product placements

4. Assist in coordinating branded playlists, developing their release schedule, and creating new content ideas for each respective streaming platform

5. Assist with all global music production and activations–––creating call sheets and social assets, coordinating performers’ seeding, fulfilling performance riders, and aligning messaging with regional counterparts

6. Track and manage all music expenses associated with production costs, performance fees, seeding and misc music costs

7. Coordinate and track vendor and artist payments

8. Develop event and campaign recaps to measure and track overall highlights

9. Compose monthly Vans global music activity reports

Skills for Success:

Years of Related Professional Experience: 3-5 years

Suggested Education and Expertise:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Must have a minimum of 3-5 years’ general work experience in Marketing, Artist Relations, or Journalism within the Music industry

Position:
Harvey & Company is searching for Research Analysts who are looking to get started in their professional career by joining an established firm to build research and general business skills that will serve them well in any business career. Company Overview :
English

Elsevier is a global information analytics business that helps institutions and professionals progress science, advance healthcare and improve performance for the benefit of humanity. We help researchers make new discoveries, collaborate with their colleagues, and give them the knowledge they need to find funding. We help governments and universities evaluate and improve their research strategies. We help doctors save lives, providing insight for physicians to find the right clinical answers, and we support nurses and other healthcare professionals throughout their careers.Elsevier provides digital solutions and tools in the areas of strategic research management, R&D performance, clinical decision support, and professional education; including ScienceDirect, Scopus, SciVal, ClinicalKey and Sherpath. Elsevier publishes over 2,500 digitized journals, including The Lancetand Cell, more than 35,000 e-book titles and many iconic reference works, including Gray?s Anatomy. Elsevier is part of RELX Group, a global provider of information and analytics for professionals and business customers across industries. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization.

Customer Consultant – Research Intelligence

Are you looking for a new challenge?

Do you have experience in a customer facing role with a proven track record of maximizing customer satisfaction? Eager to act as a trusted adviser to the customer; ensuring the customer adopts, uses, and gains maximum value from our solutions? Are you sales oriented and love science and research. Do you have experience working within research at an academic institution? Our Customer Consultant (CC) position for our Research Management could be your next challenge!

Through a carefully planned implementation and on boarding process the CC will ensure that the fully realizes the return on their investment of Elsevier content tools & software. Continual engagement with the customer will ensure the solutions continue to meet the needs of the client, thereby ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction and maximizing revenue for Elsevier.

Working Together

In order to be successful, the Customer Consultant will have a deep understanding of user’s research workflow. You will be an integral part of the sales team, working closely with sales, global customer service teams, marketing and product teams.

Your Team

You will become part of the Research Solutions Sales Team, a group of enthusiastic professionals responsible for calling on Academic and Government institutions in the territory to support the sale of our research tools and analytical services. You will focus on providing information, support and training on our Research Intelligence products: Scopus, SciVal, Pure, data assets and analytical services. You will be expected to travel approximately 50 percent within the region.

Your responsibilities:

  • You are responsible for customer satisfaction and for ensuring value and use of the Elsevier research Intelligence solutions portfolio for renewal revenue growth and maximizing customer retention.
  • Drive successful implementation and adoption of the solution portfolio in your territory.
  • Act as a trusted adviser to the customer by providing in-depth product training, support and guidance directly aligned to the specific research workflow and customer objectives to ensure our solutions positively impact their research decisions and outcomes.
  • Uncover, analyze, and upsell opportunities at the account, plus support the account team with the preparation of tailored renewal value stories, including demonstration of product value and ROI.
  • On-going monitoring of customer to ensure increasing value and minimize attrition risk.
  • Bench mark, set targets, and systematically monitor usage with the customer, develop an action plan where usage is not meeting targets.
  • Ensure successful implementation and adoption of solution at customers; ensure delivery of appropriate training in line with customer engagement plan.
  • Identify, support and develop champions and advocates within the customer environment. Ensure that they communicate the impact our solutions on the research outcomes.
  • Help to improve product and solutions by giving feedback and getting involved in the product development process.

Our Requirements:

  • An advanced degree in any science, or bioinformatics
  • Knowledge of regional or national research programs, collaboration networks and university administration is a plus; knowledge of bibliometrics is helpful
  • Experience working within a research environment, academic or commercial is helpful
  • Background working in a complex matrix of internal and external stakeholders is helpful
  • Experience using complex enterprise software tool would be desirable.
  • Background in customer engagement and driving customer adoption
  • Strong communication (verbal including on-line delivery and written), presentation skills, and analytical skills
  • A passion for customer engagement, drive; enthusiasm and energy is a must!

We offer:
We are the leading provider of scientific, technical and medical information and tools in the world that help our customers improve scientific and healthcare outcomes. We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment offering great opportunities to develop yourself.

  • Competitive base salary
  • Generous Commission plan based on performance
  • Medical, dental and 401K benefits
  • All expenses and travel fully paid
  • Excellent hands-on training program and a team to support you
  • Numerous online resources to assist with self development and career progression

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Come join a diverse and collaborative team of researchers who work directly with product design to make the best social platform for Facebook's billion+ users. Our work ranges from formative to evaluative, ethnography to usability. For this position, we are looking for a range from qualitative specialists to methodological generalists, with broad skills in qualitative and design research methods and an understanding of quantitative concepts. The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about UI design, passionate about social computing, comfortable in a flat, fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate, and focused squarely on impacting the design of Facebook.
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Work closely with product teams to identify research topics
  • Design studies that address both user behavior and attitudes
  • Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs
  • Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods and a subset of quantitative methods, such as surveys
  • Work cross-functionally with design, product management, content strategy, engineering and marketing
  • Communicate results and illustrate suggestions in compelling and creative ways
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience conducting applied product research, and/or focus on directly relevant research topics
  • Knowledge of quantitative, behavioral analysis and statistical concepts
  • Communication experience
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
  • Currently has or is in the process of obtaining a Masters, PhD degree or completing a postdoctoral assignment in the field of Applied Statistics, Computer Information Science, Economics, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Mathematics and Statistics, Political Sciences, Psychology, or Social Science
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful questions

Marketing Strategist

The Chicago Bulls are looking for a Marketing Strategist to join our growing Marketing team. The Marketing Strategist will work to capture and provide data-based insights that drive brand equity and deepen our relationship with fans across Chicagoland. They will also need to utilize industry knowledge and trends to provide recommendations that influence marketing efforts in fan experience verticals across ticketing, food & beverage, retail, membership benefits, youth development, grassroots events and seasonal offers.
