Research and Evaluation Coordinator
Research and Evaluation, KIPP Foundation

KIPP
Great education transforms lives. KIPP, the Knowledge is Power Program, is a non-profit network of 242 college-preparatory, public charter schools educating nearly 100,000 early childhood, elementary, middle, and high school students. KIPP schools are tuition-free, public charter schools open to all students. KIPP schools, KIPP regions, and the KIPP Foundation – are united by a common mission, a commitment to excellence, and a belief that if we help children develop the academic and character strengths they need for college and choice filled lives, they will be able to build a better tomorrow for themselves, for their communities, for us all.

The non-profit KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP schools, provides tools, resources, and training for excellent teaching and learning, promotes innovation, and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas within the KIPP network and with partners including: other charters, districts, colleges and universities, and non-profit organizations across the country.

Why work at KIPP?
By working for the KIPP Foundation, you help more students across the country receive the high-quality education they deserve.
  • Support KIPP leaders, teachers, and staff on the Network Leadership Development, KIPP School Leadership Programs, Teaching and Learning Labs, KIPP Through College, or Knowledge Sharing teams
  • Ensure smart growth and great results on the Network Growth and Sustainability, Strategy, Research & Evaluation, or Insights and Analytics teams
  • Broaden our impact on the Government Affairs, External Impact, Marketing, Development, or Talent teams
  • Keep us connected and operational on our IT or Finance team

If you believe all children deserve great schools and programs where they can gain the knowledge, skills, character, and habits necessary to achieve their dreams while making the world a better place, join us!_______________________________________
Position Overview
The Research and Evaluation Coordinator will join a team (Research and Evaluation – R&E) that supports the collection, validation, and application of high quality data on KIPP schools, regions, teachers, leaders, students, families and alumni. R&E’s work ensures stakeholders can make data-driven decisions to ensure KIPP delivers on its mission. The Research and Evaluation Coordinator will play a critical role in supporting our growing efforts to research the life outcomes of KIPP Alumni to help us better understand which KIPP interventions and strategies are working to support their success. Specific tasks will include project managing data collection activities, supporting partnerships with researchers and vendors, and coordinating with multiple stakeholders across many teams to move projects forward.

This role will also support collecting feedback and data from other key stakeholders, include KIPP teachers, students and families through KIPP network surveys. The Research and Evaluation Coordinator will be responsible for building and testing network surveys, managing project plans to ensure surveys are created and launched on schedule, communicating with network leaders to plan administration and improve response rates, and ensuring that network leaders can access their survey reports. This staff member may engage in everything from network stakeholder support, data collection, quality assurance, and leading training on how to administer survey and utilize survey data.

He/she/they is a member of the Research and Evaluation Team, and works collaboratively with the Information Technology, Insight and Analytics, KIPP To and Through College and External Impact teams.

Key Responsibilities and Duties
Support KIPP Alumni Research and Data Collection:
  • Work with KIPP Foundation and network stakeholders to support all data collection processes related to alumni
  • Support R&E’s Sr. Project Manager with the end-to-end process around the creation and delivery of Alumni Surveys
  • Write and manage communications to network stakeholders on survey timing, purpose, and resources
  • Work with Insight and Analytics on survey strategies to improve survey response rates
  • Build, test, and launch surveys to KIPP Alumni

Lead Project Management for Major Research and Evaluation Projects, focused on Alumni Research:
  • Create and manage project plans for several critical Research and Evaluation projects involving third party researchers and vendors
  • Manage the request-for-proposals process to evaluate data collection tools and inform vendor selection
  • Work with stakeholders across the KIPP Foundation, and externally, to meet deadlines and deliverables
  • Intake research requests to KIPP Foundation and our regions, ensuring timely follow-up and tracking of ongoing research on KIPP
  • Support the design and creation of quarterly network communications to share relevant research findings

Manage creation and administration of KIPP Student and Family Surveys:
  • Lead communication design and strategy to engage schools and regions
  • Create and share resources to support school and regional points of contact in administering the surveys
  • Track weekly response rates, and support regions to improve response rates across their schools
  • Build, test, and launch annual surveys and survey reports

Coordinate KIPP Staff and Teacher Survey administration and report sharing:
  • Work with TNTP to create a detailed annual project plan
  • Lead network communication strategy to engage school and regional leaders
  • Create resources to support survey administration and report access
  • Support regions during survey administration to improve response rates across the network
  • Support school and regional leaders to ensure reports are actionable and accessible

Key Competencies
  • Planning and Execution
  • Stakeholder Management
  • Critical Thinking and Problem Solving

Experience and Qualifications
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Proven success in partnering with diverse stakeholders, both across organizations and teams, on complex, challenging projects
  • Demonstrated success in project management and driving complex projects to completion on deadline
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with a great deal of ambiguity and cross team collaboration
  • Experience with, or exposure to, educational research preferred
  • A love of data!
  • Passion for KIPP’s mission and values
  • San Francisco office location preferred but may consider remote
  • Exemption status – full time

Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers competitive salary commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package, generous vacation and PTO, 401k retirement plan with both pre- and post-tax options, as well as gym reimbursement, flexible spending account (FSA), and cell phone reimbursement are also offered by KIPP.

To apply please submit your resume online.Resumes submitted via email will not be accepted.
KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

Brilliant PR & Marketing Seeks Public Relations Press Coordinator

Leading agency serving consumer lifestyle brands with an emphasis on products for families including baby and maternity, toys and games, tech, and housewares and food, Brilliant PR & Marketing seeks an entry-level Public Relations Press Coordinator to support our fast-paced culture and rapid growth!

Our ideal Public Relations Press Coordinator is at the start of their career but has aspirations to progress quickly to more senior-level agency positions. Key responsibilities will be tracking the success and result your team generates through media monitoring, fueling our agency’s proprietary results reporting database, creating custom reports to merchandise results to clients, communicating those results directly to clients, and more.

This role is the perfect opportunity to learn and refine elements of the public relations trade that are the foundation for every role within an agency setting. This includes refining your research skills, developing professional judgment, learning how to strategically communicate with clients and more. You’ll work within the framework of a supportive 3-4 person team that will depend upon and guide you in executing the fundamental account tasks you’ll be leading while valuing your contributions to clients’ campaigns, strategies, events, and activations. We also recognize that the right candidate for this role may not be fresh out of school, but rather a seasoned professional from another field looking to take the first step toward a career pivot, or, a PR veteran who has been away from agency life for a while and looking to reenter.

So what’s Brilliant all about? We are a unique PR agency in that our more than 20 team members each work remotely, with pockets of staff centralized in NYC, LA and Scottsdale, AZ, and even more scattered around the country. We give our people the resources and freedom to get their work done without having to sit in a cubicle or stuffy office, but team members are expected to be self-starting, super-motivated individuals who have project and time management down to an art. Although we are remote, team members are expected to be available and online during normal business hours.


Responsibilities Include:

  • Monitoring client media, influencer, and social coverage and sending “Hits As They Happen” emails in real-time
  • Tracking and coordinating product requests, sample inventory, and client sample budgets
  • Generating monthly client reports via Coverage Book and manage real-time published coverage tracker in AirTable
  • Using Cision, Klear, Google, Twitter, Instagram, and more to build curated media and influencer target lists
  • Developing management skills by leading interns to success
  • Becoming a professional researcher and mastering the art of using Google, LinkedIn, and other search engines
  • Showing off your understanding of numbers and data by taking the charge on identifying insights and creating metrics reports
  • Learn how to be a pitch master!

Beyond these core responsibilities, you’ll have an opportunity to contribute to the bigger picture and reach toward more advanced tasks. Examples include contributing ideas for pitch angles, influencer opportunities, activations, and campaigns, drafting pitches, press materials and more.


Requirements Include:

  • At least 6 months experience in consumer products PR, preferably in an agency setting (including internships or college work experiences). No internship experience? Check out our Press Coordinator in Training program!
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication, project management, and time management skills
  • SUPER organized style and the ability to focus working off-site

We’re headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many disciplines of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities and Finance. Marketing Research Analyst

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

Assist with the implementation of a diverse set market research projects, including (a) customer satisfaction measurement, tracking and benchmarking, (b) image and brand equity research, (c) needs-based market segmentation, (d) new product and service concept testing and demand forecasting, (e) customer assessment of products and services, (f) ad and copy testing, (g) communications and issues management research, and (h) industry assessment. Many of the projects will require use of licensed on-line survey tools.

Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Executes market research and assists with identifying strategic and tactical insights as they relate to research and business objectives. Execution of market research will include use of on-line survey tools including survey programming and data analysis. 60%

  • Assists with developing and providing timely and actionable market research findings to internal clients. 20%


  • Assists Senior Market Research Analysts with planning, execution and analysis quantitative and qualitative research projects. 20%

Qualifications


POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Minimum:





  • Education: Bachelor’s degree required in market research, marketing, statistics, economics, psychology or computer science or other applicable field of study.

- Experience: Minimum 2 - 5 years or equivalent in marketing research or data analysis.





  • Analytical Abilities – Proven ability to execute market research, extrapolate and integrate data, draw conclusions, and develop clear, concise reports.




  • Communication Skills: Ability to use market research and data analysis to help develop conclusions and actionable recommendations. Good oral and written communication skills.

Preferred:

  • Master’s degree in Business Administration, Market Research or Marketing.

  • Programming and project management skills using on-line survey tools (e.g., Qualtrics).

Job Scope

  • Position will work across multiple departments to execute and assist with the development, analysis and provision of multiple market research projects.

General Responsibilities

The Microbiologist I is part of the Regulatory Affairs/Quality Assurance team working on utilizing the gift of human tissue to address various unmet clinical needs through innovative regenerative medicine products to improve the quality of life of patients. The Microbiologist I?s primary role will be the development of bioburden reduction studies for current and future projects. She/he will also be responsible for data analysis, entry as it pertains to sterility assurance. This includes planning and implementing experiments, analyzing data, reporting results, writing protocols, and training personnel.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and analyze experiments with a focus on bioburden reduction.
  • Grow microbe cultures using lab aseptic techniques and lab standard protocols to support the design, testing and validation of product sterility.
  • Accurately record data collected in the lab to support product manufacturing and technology transfer.
  • Use aseptic techniques to prepare microbiological/chemical samples.
  • Use aseptic techniques in the production of products.
  • Read papers to keep up to date with scientific and research developments.
  • Presentation of results to team.
  • Use a variety of standard and specialized microbiology equipment such as microscopes, gas chromatographs and high-pressure liquid chromatographs, electrophoresis units, thermocyclers, fluorescence activated cell sorters and phosphorimagers.
  • Other duties as assigned by the Supervisor and/or PTT Leadership that may include assisting in product development and technology transfer, communicating with vendors to order supplies, and preparing marketing research to assist the project lead.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required

  • Biology ? Knowledge of plant and animal organisms, their tissues, cells, functions, interdependencies, and interactions with each other and the environment.
  • English Language ? Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
  • Chemistry ? Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods.
  • Mathematics ? Knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and their applications.
  • Computers and Electronics ? Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.
  • Science ? Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems. Ability to use a bright field and fluorescence microscope and mammalian cell culture techniques.
  • Reading Comprehension ? Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
  • Writing ? Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience; Ability to write, review, and follow SOPs preferred
  • Problem Solving ? Ability to troubleshoot protocols and equipment preferred
  • Active Listening ? Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
  • Critical Thinking ? Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

Physical Environment & Working Conditions

  • Full Time position (40 hours or more) based in Arizona. Hours may include evenings and weekends to perform tasks outlined in the job description.
  • Ability to lift over 25 pounds
  • The Microbiologist I will work in a wet lab that contains various hazardous chemicals where personal protective equipment will be required.
  • The Microbiologist I may work in a clean room environment where protective clothing such as hoods, face masks, gloves, boots, and coveralls are required.
  • Job may require standing for long periods of time.

Equipment & Machines Used

  • Desktop computer and general office equipment.
  • MS Office, MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, and other electronic software systems.
  • Basic and advanced laboratory equipment such as biosafety cabinet, centrifuge, thermometers, and pH meters, etc.

Confidentiality Requirement

The Microbiologist I is expected to maintain confidentiality of all donor/recipient information.


Key Interactions and Relationships

  • Daily face to face and written communication with R&D, Sterility Assurance personnel and Supervisor to ensure studies and projects are executed appropriately.
  • Regular communication with and ordering of supplies from various vendors.
  • Collaboration with other departments including Quality Assurance/Control, Production, and Regulatory Affairs as needed and assigned by Supervisor to support process improvement and product development of current and future products.

Education and Work Experience Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in microbiology and a minimum of 1 year of experience in a related applicable field
  • Experience in designing and implementing bioburden reduction studies
  • Familiarity with Aseptic Technique
  • Familiarity with FDA guidelines for allografts and minimal manipulation of tissues and cells
  • Familiarity in performing microbiology techniques such as: Blood Cultures, identification of flora, antibiotic sensitivity assay, make bacterial growth plates, etc.
  • Familiarity with cellular characterization techniques such as: ELISA, immunofluorescence, flow cytometry, DNA extraction, western blot, gel electrophoresis, etc.
  • Working knowledge of common human skin flora and disinfection methods.
  • Knowledge of mycoplasma, endotoxin and sterility testing of human cells and tissues
  • Experience with Microsoft Office and Projects preferred.
  • Experience with environmental monitoring preferred.

Job Description:

Manage and optimize Cobrand Card sales through clients’ digital channels including web, mobile, email, and organic search. This position will have two key responsibilities within the Cobrand Digital Sales Integration team: 1) support campaign marketing efforts for top Cobrand clients across digital channels to ensure flawless execution of digital offers and report out on performance. 2) team lead for third party digital marketing channels (social, search, display, affiliate, etc.). As lead, establish strategies, process steps and serve as consultant across Card LOB for third party digital marketing channel efforts. Knowledge of the various digital sales channels, especially third party paid advertising channels, is a critical component of this role to readily assert oneself as a subject matter expert with clients and lead discussions with ecommerce teams and vendors. Familiarity with credit card product sales and marketing, and in particular Cobrand Card sales is a plus, to identify opportunities while navigating the financial products risk framework.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support digital campaign marketing efforts for top Cobrand (Affinity) clients partnering with Digital Sales Integration, ACE (Affinity Campaign Execution team), Segment Marketing and Digital Sales and Digital Marketing teams
  • Oversee development and approval of digital marketing creative and campaign components
  • Ensure campaigns are tested before production and validated post production
  • Ensure all digital offers adhere to regulatory and compliance requirements
  • Report out on digital campaign performance
  • Partner with Clients’ and bank’s social and paid advertising teams to develop a cohesive online third party marketing strategy to drive channel growth while mitigating risk
  • Establish processes for approval and execution of third party digital marketing tactics
  • Monitor key channel performance indicators and portfolio metrics to identify opportunities to improve or expand
  • Influence the integration of Card product offers across clients’ digital channels
  • Develop and drive continuous improvements to the digital customer experience to improve sales conversions and customer satisfaction
  • Manage complex digital campaigns to time and to budget
  • Identify best demonstrated practices for digital Card sales and providing consulting and recommendations across clients
  • Influence the development of new digital capabilities, features and functionality to drive growth and enhancements
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and channels; providing thought leadership and perspective for adoption when appropriate

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years of card experience
  • Experience with paid digital advertising including search, social and display campaigns
  • Detail oriented and highly organized with a strong ability to quickly identify and resolve complex issues
  • Ability to establish relationships and work effectively across the company and with partners
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple efforts with varying deadlines effectively
  • Ability to effectively navigate and influence internal partners, client organizations and vendors
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Ability to communicate with impact, ensuring complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to wide and varied audiences

Desired Skills:

  • Proven working experience with financial or travel product marketing
  • Card product experience, including Cobrand/Rewards industry acumen
  • Understanding of financial industry’s regulatory oversight and attention
  • Digitally curious with the appetite to research, recommend and help develop solutions
  • Understanding of Bank of America’s card marketing and governance provisioning processes
  • Deep and thorough understanding of success drivers of consumer credit card business

1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week:

40

Posting Title: Human Factors Researcher

What you’ll be doing:

The Human Factors Researcher is responsible for conducting user research and synthesizing the results to help guide design decisions, ensure FDA requirements are met to improve the safety, effectiveness, and usability of medical devices created at Tandem Diabetes Care. This role is responsible for working cross-functionally with a team of UX Designers, software engineers, regulatory directors, and marketing product directors to plan, execute, evaluate and share insights from user testing using a variety of research methodologies. The Human Factors Researcher II works across Agile teams and the organization to optimize our patient’s experience across products, and turn insights into engaging, actionable recommendations that make a difference for our patients and business.

  • Define, plan, and conduct, usability testing sessions and on-site user studies, documenting responses and results.
  • Assists with multi-site studies with outside venders.
  • Analyze user research data and synthesize the data into compelling user insights and design recommendations. Analyze results from formative evaluations and make recommendations for improvements based on Human Factors guidelines and best practices.
  • Provide research and design inputs related to human capabilities and product interactions to inform design and contribute to the verification and the validation of medical devices, in compliance with FDA recognized guidance and standards including 62366, HE-75, and others.
  • Participate in the development of product requirements and evaluation of risks related to product use (risk analysis).
  • Determine user needs by conducting task-focused analyses.
  • Partner with stakeholders and use Human Factors expertise to create custom studies based on business needs.
  • Act as a departmental liaison for Human Factors in cross-functional meetings.
  • Communicate quantitative and qualitative data and user insights to various stakeholders in the organization, such as, Senior Management, Software Development, Engineering, UI Design, and Marketing.
  • Assists in the development of protocols and reports on formative and summative studies for FDA, PMA and 510k submissions.
  • Participate in concept design and development as part of a cross-functional team.
  • Meet with UI designers, engineers and others to define or refine requirements and designs based on user research findings.
  • Contribute to the creation and writing of original research for the intent of peer reviewed publication.
  • Ensure work is performed in compliance with company policies including Privacy/HIPAA and other regulatory, legal, and safety requirements.


Who we are:

Here at Tandem, Diabetes is all we do and we are dedicated to making the lives of people with diabetes better and better, through relentless innovation. “In Tandem” means together, and we strive to embody that in every aspect of our business. We believe that working in tandem, not in isolation, is the best way to continually exceed expectations.

Designed, assembled and supported from our San Diego, CA headquarters, we are the makers of the only color, touch-screen insulin pump that is capable of remote feature updates and compatibility with continuous glucose monitoring.

Read more about our company & culture here: https://www.tandemdiabetes.com/careers/life-at-tandem and see what our customers are saying here: #tsliminthewild

What you need for this position:

  • 2 or more years of work experience including relevant Human Factors engineering experience in the medical device industry (can include internship and/or graduate school experience).
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science or related discipline.
  • Excellent time and project management skills.
  • Excellent presentation skills.
  • Experience with qualitative and quantitative research methods.
  • Experience working with a variety of research tools.
  • Ability to turn research findings into actionable recommendations for engineering teams and business stakeholders.
  • Able to persuade others, at all levels of the organization, through effectively consolidating, evaluating, and presenting relevant data driven information.
  • Curious and creative; enjoy complex issues and problem solving.
  • Great interpersonal and verbal communication skills.

What’s in it for you?

We’ve got you covered. We offer a robust benefits package to support your health and your family. From medical, dental, and vision, to flexible spending accounts for both health and dependent care – Tandem’s got you covered!

Stay well with us. Enjoy the outdoors during your workday by biking, running, or walking on one of our nearby trails. Or, break a quick sweat at our onsite gym, or check out our offsite gym, which boasts luxurious amenities including specialty fitness classes and state-of-the-art equipment.

Invest in your career. Tandem offers all employees access to training and development programs and courses to help keep your career and skillset updated, not outdated.

Live your life. Relax with 20 days of paid time off and celebrate 10 paid holidays in your first year. Save for your future with a company-sponsored 401(k) plan. Look forward to saving money on tickets to the San Diego Zoo, movies, restaurants, and so much more with our exclusive employee discount program.

Celebrate in Tandem. Join in monthly employee get-togethers, tacos for Cinco de Mayo, corned beef for St. Patrick’s Day, costume-contest for Halloween, and the annual JDRF walk.

AGENCY MARKETING STATEMENT:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is the agency Americans trust with their lives. As a global leader in public health, CDC is the nation's premier health promotion, prevention, and preparedness agency. Whether we are protecting the American people from public health threats, researching emerging diseases, or mobilizing public health programs with our domestic and international partners, we rely on our employees to make a real difference in the health and well-being of people here and around the world. This position is located in the Center for Surveillance, Epidemiology and Laboratory Services (CSELS), Division of Scientific Education and Professional Development (DSEPD), Business Management Activity (BMA) in Atlanta, GA. CDC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB SUMMARY:
The purpose of this position is to oversee and coordinate all administrative management and support services and to serve as an advisor and assistant to the management staff on administrative policy and procedural matters.

DUTIES:
[
"As an Administrative Officer you will: Participate in meetings with the management officials to assess and discuss justifications for budget increases, recommendations for resource allocations/reallocations, and resource priorities. Serve as administrative liaison on travel for serviced personnel. Serve as approving official for all personnel action requests prepared by serviced organization staff, including requests for recruit actions, promotions, reassignments, and special compensations. Provide leadership, guidance and oversight in the development or enhancement of a wide variety of computerized personnel reporting and tracking systems and resources tracking systems to forecast trends in hiring and attrition." ]

REQUIREMENTS:
US Citizenship is required. Background Investigation may be required. One-year probationary period may be required. Travel, transportation, and moving expenses will be paid: No Bargaining Unit Position: No Drug Screening Required: No Research position: No Promotion potential: No Supervisory position: Yes. Since this is a supervisory position, candidates must also have demonstrated or shown the potential to develop the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities. A supervisory probationary period may be required. Applicants should describe any previous experience or responsibilities which could be used in relation to the supervisory requirements of this position. Time in grade (TIG) must be met within 30 days of the closing date of the announcement. CDC Financial Disclosure -OGE form 450 Holding ourselves to a higher standard; the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention inspires public confidence in its trust responsibilities and mission by maintaining high ethical principles. This position is subject to the confidential financial disclosure requirements of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 (P.L. 95-521). Therefore, if selected, you will be required to complete a Confidential Financial Disclosure Report (OGE Form 450) to determine if a conflict or an appearance of a conflict exists between your financial interest and your prospective position with the agency. This Information will be required annually. All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of the announcement. Public Trust/Moderate Background Investigation (5) is required.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-12 grade level of in the Federal service as defined in the next paragraph. Specialized experience is experience which is directly related to the position which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs) to successfully perform the duties of the position to include experience in planning and directing administrative activities such as: personnel, financial, property management, procurement and contracting; and serve as an advisor and assistant to the management staff on administrative policy and procedural matters. Documenting experience: In accordance with Office of Personnel Management policy, federal employees are assumed to have gained experience by performing duties and responsibilities appropriate for their official series and grade level as described in their position description. Experience that would not normally be part of the employee's position is creditable, however, when documented by satisfactory evidence, such as a signed memorandum from the employee's supervisor or an SF-50 or SF-52 documenting an official detail or other official assignment. The documentation must indicate whether the duties were performed full time or, if part time, the percentage of times the other duties were performed. It is expected that this documentation is included in the employee's official personnel record. In order to receive credit for experience in your resume that is not within the official series and grade level of your official position, you must provide a copy of the appropriate documentation of such experience as indicated above.

HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED:
Once the application process is complete, a review of the resume and supporting documentation will be made and compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine if you are qualified for this job. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination is made that you have inflated your qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. The Search Marketing Specialist is the day-to-day coordinator of marketing acquisition including SEM, SEO, paid media acquisition and e-commerce marketing support. This role will help identify new audience segments within our existing user base to target, as well as new audiences to reach and connect with. They’ll be an audience expert, using in-depth knowledge to propose and implement experiments and improve existing retention acquisition and retention efforts. The role requires someone who is part data analyst, part technical analyst and part strategist. He or she must be a critical thinker who is creative in coming up with new, relevant ways to plan, measure and optimize performance marketing.


Essential Job Functions:

  • Planning, developing, and implementing comprehensive audience growth strategies to drive direct response and new user acquisition for the Monster Energy portfolio.
  • Developing direct response advertising strategies to drive sales revenue and/or qualified leads.
  • Creating and managing paid search accounts/campaigns via various paid search marketing platforms including but not limited to: Google, Bing, Yahoo, Amazon, Criteo, etc.
  • Conducting industry research and establishing bidding strategies to meet / exceed brand KPIs and benchmarks.
  • Creating and implementing campaign A/B test experiments to identify optimal campaign settings.
  • Using available data inputs and analytics tools to develop insights and action items intended to improve paid search performance and meet brand goals.
  • Forecast spend and manage budget allocations, optimizing based on performance.
  • Analyze competitor and industry trends.
  • Audit tracking and ensure measurability.
  • Be idea generator/thought leader on how to increase acquisition rates through non-traditional and/or innovative execution.
  • Communicating with cross-functional Marketing teams, primarily the Brand, International and Customer Marketing teams to regularly discuss goals and deliver results.
  • Partner with CMO and VP, Digital Marketing to develop the international digital growth capabilities and resources to best meet the needs of our global strategy and our regional business units.

Position Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing-related fields such as Communications, Media Studies, Marketing and Advertising, Business or other.
  • Minimum 2-3 years of relevant professional experience with an emphasis on performance marketing generating acquisition and conversion such as SEM, SEO, CRM, affiliates and re-marketing.
  • Experience with key platforms and channels such as Google, Amazon, Criteo, etc.
  • Deep knowledge of the SEM industry and the paid search advertising model, including experience with keyword research tools and web analytics tools, as well as how to use these tools in media campaigns.
  • Strong skills in data management such as Excel, pivto tables and databases (e.g. SQL).
  • A strategic thinker, practitioner, and excellent collaborator with experience building and leading analytics and managing agile workflows, including experience working with teams to successfully implement recommendations to drive business growth.
  • Must be proactive and focused, detail-oriented, self-motivated, results-driven, and able to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to think creatively, critically, in order to clearly present ideas and communicate with leadership.
  • Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills.
  • Digital media certifications a plus: Google, Facebook, Twitter, etc.
  • HTML/CSS experience a plus.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Executive, Consumer Insights (Social Research) - 47952
Client Services and Sales - India Offsite, Offsite
RESEARCH EXECUTIVE – CONSUMER INSIGHTS (SOCIAL RESEARCH), GURGAON

ABOUT THIS JOB
We won’t say we can predict the future, but our team of Market Research Analysts gets pretty close. This role combines data analysis and client consultation from the start, with plenty of room for growth. You find the stories behind scatter plots and help clients determine which products to launch. Your insights will influence decisions for some of today’s leading global companies.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Managing clients and their respective projects custom research team in matters of market research based on experience in one or more sectors (financial services; media, telecom & technology, energy, etc.) Reporting to a project lead, you will be responsible for the successful execution of customized quantitative studies, including project costing, questionnaire design, project management and execution, analysis and report writing.

Client Management Managing clients and their respective projects from beginning to end, including making actionable recommendations to support key business objectives Consistently exceeding client expectations from project inception through completion

Project Management Successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously, all in different design/analysis stages Proactively anticipating, troubleshooting, overcoming, and/or escalating challenges to your project lead in a timely manner Coordinating project task activities between your project team and internal support/operations team(s) Consulting (Questionnaire Design, Analysis, Reporting & Writing) Assist in the development of strong and captivating proposals to meet client needs, based on short research briefs and/or elaborate RFPs; including assisting with costing structure, methodological design, analytical framework, etc. Designing questionnaires/focus group screeners/interview guides to meet the specific or unique client objectives Synthesis and communication of both primary and secondary research findings into actionable insights according to the client’s objectives Full reporting and analysis (via PowerPoint): Interpreting and analysing multivariate data, drawing insightful conclusions and providing recommendations, where applicable. Provide "in office" research, administrative and operational support to senior staff Be directly accountable for work conducted for their nominated clients in terms of analyses, charting, etc and perform quality checks on all reports for alignment to request, accuracy and correctness

A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOU
Experience in Primary Quantitative Market Research with practical knowledge of research methodologies Proactive Strong interpersonal skills Very Good Influencing & Persuading Skills

QUALIFICATIONS
MBA in Marketing from a Premium Institute 0 to 1 years’ experience in Quantitative Consumer Insights role Knowledge of statistics and multivariate analysis

Job Summary:

Who are we?

Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment and eCommerce company, comprised of four market leaders: Ticketmaster.com, Live Nation Concerts, Artist Nation and Live Nation Network. Ticketmaster.com is the global event ticketing leader and one of the world’s top five eCommerce sites, with over 27 million monthly unique visitors. Live Nation Concerts produces over 22,000 shows annually for more than 2,300 artists globally. Artist Nation is the world’s top artist management company, representing over 250 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Network, the leading provider of entertainment marketing solutions, enabling over 800 advertisers to tap into the 200 million consumers Live Nation delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenation.com/investors.

HOB Entertainment, a division of Live Nation Entertainment, offers exceptional club venues nationwide. House of Blues Venues provide several genres of live music, from Rock, Hip Hop, Country, Rock en Español, Blues, Jazz, Reggae and Pop. House of Blues venues are also known for their southern-style cuisine, juke-joint inspired atmosphere and the World Famous Gospel Brunch.

House of Blues opened its doors on Thanksgiving Day in 1992, serving its first meal to the local shelters. Since opening, House of Blues has been committed to giving back to the community through the International House of Blues Foundation.

Who are you?

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!

The Role:

The Marketing Assistant will be responsible for assisting the Marketing Manager and marketing team on all administrative and marketing needs, and necessary tasks. Primary activities include developing marketing materials; market research (phone calls, web search); invoice handling; show support (filing, documentation) and promotional support (guest list, on-site promos, street team assistance).
This role is based ______ and ideal candidate would be able to be on-site daily.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform a range of administrative and marketing support duties related to the daily operations of the Live Nation marketing group
  • Maintain accurate up-to-date schedules, guest lists, ticket requests, phone logs, databases for marketing team
  • Support promotional and street team activities at venue, off-site and online
  • Create and publish venue newsletters, show e-cards, weekly press releases
  • Assist in maintenance of show files and supportive documentation
  • Engage patrons and inform them of upcoming events
  • Assist with venue social media calendar maintenance
  • Attend staff meetings at venue(s)
  • Order production of advertising materials as directed by Marketing Manager
  • Contribute to ongoing process improvements
  • Organize server, databases and Dropbox, keeping them continually maintained and updated
  • Track all invoices and payments
  • Maintain an understanding of Live Nation shows and products
  • Maintain current knowledge of organizational and department policies and procedures
  • Adhere to all confidentiality requirements for corporate, strategic, and marketing information

Qualifications:

  • 1-3 years work experience. Prior promotions or marketing experience a plus
  • Ability to function in a very fast-moving environment; quick reaction time to last minute changes
  • Attention to detail and a high level of organization is imperative
  • Must have the ability to prioritize, organize, handle multiple tasks
  • Must be able to think proactively and, at times, work with minimal supervision
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; communicates effectively and courteously with all contacts – internal and external
  • Highly adaptive and proactive problem solving critical to success; must be resourceful individual who can quickly solve problems; ability to make independent decisions
  • Organizes workload throughout the day to meet project timelines and deadlines; must multitask and manage several projects at once; continuously shift focus/priorities as needed
  • Familiarity with metro city and surrounding areas
  • PC proficient and works with a high degree of accuracy
  • High level user of spreadsheets and Microsoft Office (strong Word, Excel, and PowerPoint program skills)
  • Uses Internet and email programs proficiently
  • Familiarity with cloud services such as Dropbox is a plus

If the above description sounds like you and fits your background, apply online at http://www.livenation.com/careers/index.html to join the Live Nation Entertainment team today!

To efficiently sell and process ticket orders while providing friendly and polite customer service. Sell tickets to patrons interested in attending Boston Symphony Orchestra and Boston Pops concerts presented at Symphony Hall and Tanglewood. Supervise and assist representatives when managers are not available to accomplish sales and service goals.


Responsibilities:

  • Sell tickets by phone, or in person, to all concerts taking place at Symphony Hall and Tanglewood. This includes concerts presented by the Boston Symphony Orchestra and Boston Pops as well as concerts presented by independent promoters.
  • Accurately enter customer address and billing information into the Boston Symphony Orchestra database for use in tracking orders and in marketing efforts.
  • Process ticket exchanges for patrons who are unable to attend a concert that is part of their subscription series: find replacement tickets for the customer, and ensure that the patron is aware of all exchange policies and how they may affect the transaction.
  • Answer questions and assist subscribers with the purchase of subscriptions at the box office window.
  • Answer questions regarding performance content and ticket policies. Provide patrons with policy information for Symphony Hall and Tanglewood. Provide customers with policy information regarding outside concerts presented by independent promoters at Symphony Hall.
  • Answer the Re-sale ticket line and post re-sales to Tessitura.
  • Close out window at end of day and balance cash drawer.
  • File printed tickets for pick-up at will call.
  • Put together ticket mailings for single tickets sales and subscriptions.
  • Sort and prepare mail orders for processing. This includes thousands of orders received during the pre-sale period for Holiday Pops and Tanglewood.
  • Research and resolve customer issues.
  • Work with front of house manager to resolve seating issues.
  • Batch print tickets in orders taken by SymphonyCharge, Group sales and the Boston Symphony Orchestra’s
web site.
  • Run web reports to view and processes orders, which need to be filled manually.
  • Supervise and assist representatives when managers are not available. This includes the supervision of end of day close-out and balance of cash drawers.

Qualifications: Six months of experience in a call center/customer-related work environment preferably in a team environment. Flexibility with regards to job functions and scheduling. Must be able to commit to some evening hours. Basic typing skills and familiarity with personal computers. Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, the ability to work effectively in a fast paced diverse team environment.

“We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The Boston Symphony Orchestra is committed to building a culturally diverse staff and encourages applications from female and minority candidates.”

Opportunity Overview

The WarnerMedia Story

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Team

The Content Acquisition team is responsible for the licensing 3rd party content for the TBS, TNT & truTV, plus HBO Max. - We are a client-facing department; staff works directly with executives from the major Hollywood studios and production companies to negotiate all terms of licensing for linear and digital platforms including windowing, runs, license fees, marketing allowances, and rights surrounding TV Everywhere/VOD and SVOD distribution. - The Content Acquisition team also works closely with the Programming & Strategy departments from both HBO Max and the linear networks - to target the best and most appropriate content to license based on brand, audience demo and network/platform directionality, the Finance team - to establish budgets and targeted price points for our deals and the Legal group - to draft contracts memorializing the deals we negotiate. The acquisition process also often demands collaboration with other internal groups such as Marketing, Ad Sales, Research and On-Air, among others.

The Job

Our intern will participate and assist in all steps of the content acquisition process as we move through them, but will concentrate on analysis and research, helping us to achieve the highest level of preparedness before entering (and during) the negotiation process. - To ensure that we get the best terms and most comprehensive rights grant for our platforms and programmers, we look both backward to past acquisitions and forward to future needs during our initial assessment of content. Historical analysis and future-looking research can include anything from evaluation and monitoring of the broadcast, cable and SVOD markets.

The Daily
  • Help to determine what content is available for us to acquire.
  • Track major happenings within our competitive landscapes.
  • Determine who's buying what, whether WarnerMedia is getting the most expansive grant of rights and whether we're in line with what other services are paying for content.
  • Screen and keep track of submissions.
  • Help determine what content should be presented for licensing.
  • Interns who express enthusiasm, reliability and diligence can have opportunities to work on projects above and beyond research and analysis.
The Essentials
  • Film, theater or television major or background in entertainment law, business or finance.
  • Passion for film and television.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft suite of products, but skill in Excel is a MUST.
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills.
  • Inherent attention to detail.
  • Self-motivation
  • Forward-thinking
  • Efficiency (speed + accuracy)
  • Reliability, dependability
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Inquisitive, curious and enthusiastic
The Perks
  • An opportunity to work with a great team that is passionate about the same thing you are!
  • Networking opportunities to meet people that you’d like to know!
  • A speaker series that introduces you to cool executives and what they do for the best brands!
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Summer 2020 program dates are June 1st through August 7th. Interns are paid a competitive-wage based on location and relocation is not provided. Participation in the internship program is reserved for students who are currently enrolled or within 6 months post-graduation. Most positions are targeted to upperclassmen and graduate students.

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Come join the Tillamook Team where our philosophy is “Dairy Done Right.” As an independent farmer-owned cooperative, we have been guided by good, honest values since 1909. We believe in putting quality over profit, natural over artificial, and that hard work can never be outsmarted. We’re taking a stand for real food because everyone deserves better.

About you:

What does real food mean to you? Is your favorite dish a cheesy casserole? Perhaps a decadent and indulgent ice cream? Either way, your identification with food is important to us. People who fit well here at Tillamook have a commitment to quality in everything they do. About us:

Our team members understand our vision, contribute to our mission, thrive on innovative thinking, hard work and good, honest values. We live by these shared values: We are Good Stewards, We believe in Uncompromising Quality, We work as One Team, We Play to Win, and We Genuinely Care for each other.

What you will do:

The Consumer and Market Insights (CMI) Analyst – Research & Strategy supports the Sales, Brand/Category Management, Marketing, and R&D teams by conducting research and translating data from various syndicated and primary research sources into a seamless and compelling narrative to drive business outcomes. This is an analytical role that requires excellent analytical, presentation, project management, and relationship-building skills. Attention to detail is critical. This role also requires the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously with timely delivery of assigned tasks. This position can be located in our Portland or Cincinnati office. Due to the nature of the work, hours of operation for this role will be in Central Time.

Here’s a day in the life:

  • Demonstrate excellent ability to seamlessly integrate data inputs from disparate primary and secondary data sources into a cohesive narrative to drive action in support of business objectives for both internal and external audiences
  • Demonstrate excellent problem-solving ability
  • Demonstrate excellent ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously with timely delivery of assigned tasks.
  • Demonstrate excellent time management skills with the ability to work independently with little supervision.
  • Demonstrate advanced skills in Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, including listening skills.
  • Act as a team player and able to interact with staff at all levels of the company, maintaining effective relationships with employees, supervisors, and the general public
  • Interest in consumer insights, sales enablement, strategic planning, building processes, team building, and evolving your skillset.
  • Sales: Partner with account teams, Customer Development, Category Management, and Marketing to develop retailer-facing presentations that align Customer and Tillamook business priorities

Skills you’ll need:

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology or related field is required

Experience:

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in syndicated or primary data analysis is required, ideally in the food and beverage industry.
  • Experience designing, fielding, and reporting primary research is desired.

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.

Opportunity Overview

The Job

Our internship program is designed to provide an opportunity to gain knowledge of and exposure to a working studio environment. The Company makes a special effort to provide the support and training needed to prepare interns to succeed in real-time projects and assignments.

To be eligible to participate in our Summer 2020 internship program, applicants must meet the following criteria:

  • Must be enrolled in pursuit of an associate’s or bachelor’s degree at an accredited college or university during the entire 10 weeks of the internship, not graduating prior to the end of the internship.

    • June 8 – August 14
    • June 15 – August 21
    • June 22 – August 28

Why You’ll Love CommissionTrac:

Put Customers First. Team Over Self. Focus on Results. Action over Perfection. Glass Half Full. Change the Commercial Real Estate Industry.

These are the values that define who we are, and which have empowered us to grow quickly and even become a Techstars Atlanta ’18 portfolio company. It’s excited to awarded as the Real Estate Tech Awards 2nd Best Overall Real Estate Tech Company.

At CommissionTrac, our mission is to make running a commercial real estate brokerage back office simple and transparent. Our team is committed to creating heroes in the back offices of brokerages all over the country, giving brokerage owners the transparency to grow and thrive and brokerage agents the tools they need to stay on top of their own commission pipeline. Today our back office solution allows over 30 brokerages and 350+ agents at companies including CBRE, NAI, Lee & Associates, etc. to operate more efficiently!

We’re on a mission to redefine the commercial real estate industry. This is challenging work – but our team of brilliant creatives makes the journey thrilling! We’re fast-paced, innovative, and collaborative. We pursue excellence in everything and have a lot of fun along the way.

And here’s a great quote from Steve Weikal of MIT Center for Real Estate’s Innovation Lab: “Researchers at the MIT Center for Real Estate’s Real Estate Innovation Lab have investigated over 2600 commercial real estate tech startups globally that are upending traditional ways of transacting, operating, and developing commercial real estate. CommissionTrac is a compelling platform that helps real estate firms decrease transactional friction, increase velocity, and make more informed business decisions.”

We’re looking for interns located in Atlanta. We allow for flexible hours and telecommuting options, but you need to be in the Atlanta office on a regular basis.

This is a paid internship (albeit a small pay) that will expose you to the basics of business development, marketing technology, the world of building a startup in the commercial real estate space. As a Sales and Marketing intern for CommissionTrac, you’ll have the opportunity to participate in a fun, rewarding internship while adding valuable hands-on business experience to your resume.

Desire to learn new technologies

Would you like to be part of a dynamic organization who enable health care professionals to improve the lives of their patients in ophthalmology, microsurgery and other medical growth sectors?
The Senior Clinical Research Scientist is responsible for the day-to-day planning, execution, analysis, and reporting of clinical tests of prototype and current production instruments, as well as competitive instruments.

Senior Clinical Research Scientist

Job Functions

  • Design clinical studies for the purpose of assessing the performance of current products, of products under development or modification, and of competitors’ products.
  • Plan, perform, and manage off-site and on-site clinical studies.
  • Compile, analyze, and report results of clinical studies. With some supervision, draw conclusions from analyses.
  • Participate in development of new instruments and the improvement of existing instruments. Troubleshoot prototypes and current production instruments.
  • Maintain computer and statistical skills consistent with needs of position.
  • Maintain clinical competence with Carl Zeiss Meditec products.
  • Provide technical support to marketing personnel, answering customers’ questions, giving instruction in operation of Carl Zeiss Meditec products. Assist in the writing of users’ manuals and other publications.
  • Maintain knowledge of corporate guidelines for Good Clinical Research Practices and of IRB procedures.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent. Degree in medicine or optometry preferred.
  • At least five (5) years experience in clinical research and in handling subjects and patients in a clinical research setting.
  • Ability to interact professionally in the medical environment.

With more than 25,000 employees, ZEISS is one of the global leaders in the optical and optoelectronic industries and has been contributing to technological progress for 170 years. ZEISS develops and distributes lithography optics, measuring technology, microscopes, medical technology, eyeglass lenses, camera and cine lenses, binoculars and planetarium technology.

If you are interested in this position, please send us your application using the link at the bottom of this page.

We are an EEO/AAA/Veterans/Disabled employer

The University of Arizona’s Department of Intercollegiate Athletics is seeking an experienced sports marketing professional for the position of Marketing and Fan Engagement Coordinator. This position will be responsible for serving as the marketing lead for Soccer, Softball, and Arizona KidCats.

The successful candidate must be team-oriented, highly motivated, a self-starter and organized. This is a full-time, annually appointed position, reporting to the Director of Marketing and Fan Engagement. Candidates should expect to work evenings, weekends and some holidays based on sport competition schedules.

The University’s strength in undergraduate education and scientific research is paralleled by its excellence on the playing fields, courts and other venues of its 21-sport Intercollegiate Athletic Program. The Arizona Wildcats compete in the tradition-rich Pac-12 Conference, “The Conference of Champions.” For a more comprehensive view of what makes working in our department unique, please visit our website at: www.arizonawildcats.com.

Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; state and optional retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!

The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs. For more information about working at the University of Arizona and relocations services, please click here.

The University of Arizona is in the process of creating a new classification and compensation architecture. This University Career Architecture Project (UCAP) will revolutionize the way we think about professions and manage compensation at the UA. It is a two-year initiative that will replace the current classified staff and appointed professional categories of employment with market-based job functions and families. As an applicant, UCAP will create clearer career paths and opportunities and will help you make more informed pay decisions. To learn more about this project, please visit ucap.arizona.edu.

  • Assist with the development of digital strategies for assigned sports, including social media, e-mail and demand side platform

  • Two years of experience working in college athletics or professional sports marketing
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills

  • Knowledge of and compliance with NCAA, Pac-12 Conference, and institutional rules that relate to this position
  • Personal computer proficiency in the following applications: Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions
  • Ability to multi-task with frequent interruptions
  • Dedication and motivation to initiate, lead and support value-added projects
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented, and has a positive demeanor
  • Demonstrated organizational skills, including the ability to plan, establish priorities and successfully manage multiple priority projects
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain positive interpersonal relations
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with individuals at all organizational levels, and project a positive, professional attitude
  • Must be available to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master’s Degree in Sports Administration or Business Administration/Marketing from accredited university

Our mission at Progenity is simple: to help healthcare providers and patients prepare for life. We provide the most advanced molecular technology and the highest levels of service to guide patient care at critical life stages. We continually seek people with the motivation and skills to advance our mission.

Progenity is looking for a Clin ical Research Associate (CRA) who will be responsible for the day-to-day operational oversight of clinical trial sites in the Western US. Responsibilities include clinical trial start-up, conduct, and close-out activities in accordance with the protocol, standard operating procedures (SOPs), good clinical practices (GCPs) and other applicable regulatory requirements.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Contacts doctors and clinics to identify potential clinical investigators.

  • Manages and monitors clinical studies from site selection, study initiation, and routine monitoring, data collection, and site closeout.

  • Ensures studies are conducted in accordance with the protocol, SOPs, GCPs, and other regulatory requirements.

  • Liaises with investigators, site coordinators, other site personnel, and internal staff.

  • Validates study information by monitoring and tracking clinical study data including: CRFs, source documents, laboratory reports, inventory logs, etc.

  • Contributes to the development of clinical protocols, case report forms, informed consent documents, draft source documents, patient instruction guides, and study aids.

  • Facilitates in all operational activities pertaining to the execution of clinical trials.

  • Ensures applicable regulatory requirements are maintained in the execution of all activities.

  • Maintains comprehensive study timelines and metrics.

This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities, as deemed necessary.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s Degree.

  • 5+ years prior industry experience (women’s health / prenatal medicine preferred).

  • Ability to travel up to 70% of the time.

  • Strong organizational and verbal and written communication skills.

  • Working knowledge of clinical research, including FDA and ICH regulations, GCPs, clinical study design and documentation, and conduct of clinical trials.

  • Demonstrated interpersonal skills.

  • Ability to interface with other internal functions: laboratory, finance, marketing.

  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

  • Proficiency with computer software such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

  • Must be a detail-oriented, organized, self-starter with an ability to prioritize workload.

  • Ability to analyze and interpret data and solve practical problems.

Description




At Exelon, we've got a place for you!





Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.





Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.





Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 100 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!

Marketing Research Analyst

PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION

Assist with the implementation of a diverse set market research projects, including (a) customer satisfaction measurement, tracking and benchmarking, (b) image and brand equity research, (c) needs-based market segmentation, (d) new product and service concept testing and demand forecasting, (e) customer assessment of products and services, (f) ad and copy testing, (g) communications and issues management research, and (h) industry assessment. Many of the projects will require use of licensed on-line survey tools.

Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Executes market research and assists with identifying strategic and tactical insights as they relate to research and business objectives. Execution of market research will include use of on-line survey tools including survey programming and data analysis. 60%

  • Assists with developing and providing timely and actionable market research findings to internal clients. 20%


  • Assists Senior Market Research Analysts with planning, execution and analysis quantitative and qualitative research projects. 20%

Qualifications


POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Minimum:





  • Education: Bachelor’s degree required in market research, marketing, statistics, economics, psychology or computer science or other applicable field of study.

- Experience: Minimum 2 - 5 years or equivalent in marketing research or data analysis.





  • Analytical Abilities – Proven ability to execute market research, extrapolate and integrate data, draw conclusions, and develop clear, concise reports.




  • Communication Skills: Ability to use market research and data analysis to help develop conclusions and actionable recommendations. Good oral and written communication skills.

Preferred:

  • Master’s degree in Business Administration, Market Research or Marketing.

  • Programming and project management skills using on-line survey tools (e.g., Qualtrics).

Job Scope

  • Position will work across multiple departments to execute and assist with the development, analysis and provision of multiple market research projects.

Overview

Company & Program Overview:
Founded in 1912, Paramount Pictures works with talented filmmakers to produce and distribute entertainment around the world. The iconic Paramount logo has opened some of the most successful and beloved films in cinematic history, including timeless classics such as Sunset Boulevard, The Godfather, Forrest Gump and Ferris Bueller’s Day Off, and blockbuster franchises such as Star Trek, Transformers, and Mission Impossible. Recent innovative break-out films such as Interstellar, Arrival and A Quiet Place have added to Paramount’s film legacy. Paramount Pictures Television’s 13 Reasons Why, The Alienist and Jack Reacher have also been thrilling audiences. With a beautiful 65-acre lot in the heart of Hollywood, a worldwide network of offices and a culture of engagement, Paramount’s passionate employees ensure the studio continues to deliver creativity and innovation to a dynamic industry. Paramount is a subsidiary of Viacom, which reaches 700 million global subscribers through MTV, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, BET and other media networks.

Paramount Pictures offers an exciting Internship Program with the goal of identifying, developing, and retaining top talent! Students from diverse backgrounds will gain hands–on experience working in the entertainment industry. At Paramount, every intern has the opportunity to network with industry professionals, attend a multitude of events developed to expand their entertainment knowledge, and play an integral role in their department’s success.

At Ipsos, we make market research work. We understand people. We know data. And we succeed in delivering results. That’s why so many of the world’s leading brands and organizations look to us for their research needs. Operating in over 80 countries, we are recognized as one of the top 2 most innovative research companies in the world. We’re a global leader in quantitative and qualitative market research and one of the fastest-growing and most successful firms in the business. Our research focuses on five areas of specialization – advertising, marketing, public opinion, loyalty, and media – and we put our people and our clients first.


Sound like the right place for your career? Share our passion. Share our success. Be a Game Changer and join us in being proud to be Ipsos.


Vice President of Innovation & Go-to-Market


This is a unique opportunity to lead innovation from strategy to go-to-market execution at Ipsos UU, recently voted the #1 Most Innovative market research supplier and #1 Qualitative supplier (2019 GRIT report).


Profile


Dynamic, confident, and forward-thinking business-savvy motivational leader who independently identifies complex issues, capitalizes on opportunities, and is perceived as an expert by both their clients and co-workers. Able to spearhead strategic initiatives, understand implications, and build consensus across various levels to align with corporate strategy in a changing environment.


  • Visionary Leadership – has a POV on where the industry is going and able to make strategic and tactical decisions to achieve vision.
  • Research Mastery – 10+ years market research experience, with strong knowledge of qualitative methodologies and techniques.
  • External Focus – strong understanding of client business issues and how to address them, working knowledge of research industry players and trends beyond qualitative.
  • Internal Collaboration– a go-to partner within and across organizations, can work across levels, functions, geographies.
  • Engaging communication – Demonstrated ability to enroll others in a vision, even without direct positional authority. Ability to communicate POV internally within IUU and broader Ipsos, and externally with clients, in a way that builds commitment.

Essential Job Functions


Senior leader accountable for leading and activating IUU innovation and go-to-market strategy:


Envision & Execute Innovation Strategy

  • Develop and independently execute innovation strategy with clearly articulated focus areas and supporting plans.
  • Catalyze internal teams in support of innovation strategy and focus areas. Spearhead monthly case study sharing and regular communication that inspires adoption.
  • Work collaboratively with US IUU, other service lines, and global teams to build a “needs based pipeline” of innovation prospects suitable for development of new techniques, products and/or services.
  • Create, develop and deliver (pilots, resources, materials, training) strategic innovation projects that will create a competitive advantage for IUU in the market place and build margin.

Drive Client Awareness of Innovation POV

  • Showcase innovation to clients via client meetings, calls and pitches, in collaboration with senior leadership and client service teams
  • Establish IUU as an innovative thought leader in focus areas, via ownership and execution of IUU client marketing program, including e-newsletters, webinars, publications, conference and award submissions.

Improve Equity & Sales by Step-Changing Go-to-Market Materials

  • Oversee key materials in support of client service activity systems, including proposal slides, points of view and capabilities presentation materials. Create specific plans to clarify and modernize materials, making them easy-to-use for internal teams and significantly more compelling to clients.

Ipsos Makes a Difference

Our people see to that. We attract the best talent and serve the best clients. Ipsos offers a dynamic work environment where your talents are nurtured and your skills are enriched. We encourage initiative, innovation and risk-taking to further develop our business and our people. We are enthusiastic, confident and results oriented which is why our clients come to us. That’s what makes us proud to be Ipsos.


How to Apply

Interested in joining a premier organization committed to satisfying our clients beyond their expectations? Please submit a detailed resume and university transcript by clicking the "Apply" button below. Those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.
